story:
15/05 UPDATE: Watch the latest trailer above, showcasing new weapons and stages and download the demo from the Google Play store! https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nobleweapon.willofflame

We moved the pitch video down here to make space above for the new trailer.


Will of Flame is a frenetic 2D arcade shoot ‘em up with a scoring system that rewards the most spectacular and original kills. In WOF you control a space bounty hunter riding alien beasts through a planet crawling with aggressive monsters. To achieve the revenge you’re seeking, you will have at your disposal a huge array of weapons, myriads of death traps scattered through the levels and a tractor rifle that lets you pick up enemies and drag them wherever you want. How you combine all three means of destruction is up to you and will determine your final score and the cool stuff you unlock.

We plan on bringing Will of Flame’s hectic action to the screens of Android, iPhone and Windows Phone 8 devices as well as to PC, Mac and Linux. After two years of development, we have come to Indiegogo to enlist you in our commendable mission. Together we can deliver a modern tribute to the best of 2D gaming from the 90s: the trigger-happy pace and humor of arcade gems like Metal Slug, combined with the charm and originality of Nintendo’s platformers and RPGs. In addition to the fun we will have making and playing Will of Flame, there are some truly awesome perks you can get by being part of this project.

Before saying anything else, we want to let Will of Flame speak for itself. We have prepared a demo for you to get a small taste of what will be included in the full game. Please do take a couple seconds to read the “How to Play” first, keep in mind everything is work in progress, and don’t forget to come back when you’re done playing to hear the rest of what we have in store!

HOW TO PLAY (AVENGING 101):

1. SHOOT AND DODGE

- Use the W,A,S,D keys to move around. Aim and click with the mouse to shoot your enemies.

- Click on the weapon in the HUD or use keys 1-9 to toggle between weapons.

-You can use an Xbox 360 controller any time you want, just turn it on and use the left joystick to move, right joystick to aim, RT to shoot and LB and RB to switch weapons.

- Pick up weapon cases to restock ammo, health kits and shields to stay alive, and gold coins just because they’re shiny (in the final game you’ll be able to spend them).

2. USE THE STAGE

- Try shooting at interactive elements in the stage to create chaotic chain-reactions. Original and over-the-top kills will get a one-liner, which nets you more points than a standard kill.


3. THE TRACTOR RIFLE

- The 10th weapon slot (key number 0) will give you access to a very special tool: the tractor rifle. Click and hold to shoot an energy beam and use it to catch up to 3 enemies. Keep holding and drag them against one of the many death traps in the stage and watch your score and XP bar (experience) rocket!


Remember that revenge is nothing without style, so make every kill as splendid as you can. Your performance will be graded when the demo is over. That’s all you need to know, now click through and blast away!

Even with all the action it packs, the demo you played is just a tiny part of the whole Will of Flame experience. Aside from the obvious improvements such as tons of new weapons and more polished graphics, here is a quick rundown of all the features we are working on:

- FULLY SCALABLE GAMEPLAY

As you can see in the demo, the gameplay in Will of Flame is scalable by the player at any time. You can limit yourself to a more classic approach and just riddle your enemies with bullets, or you can get crazy and unleash all kinds of hell on them by combining your weapons, the stage and the tractor rifle.

No matter how you play you will always quench your thirst for fast-paced action; but the more you invest in the game, the more you will get in return. Like in the best action movies, your best kills will be rewarded with one-liners, worth extra points. You will also get more XP so you can level up and unlock new tools of destruction.

At the end of each level you will see your final score detailed so you can compete with yourself and your friends. There will be emblems to unlock by performing certain feats, and the game will track your stats so you can keep a record of every last one of your over-the-top antics.

Our aim is for Will of Flame to have as much replay value as possible to keep you coming back for more insane rampages.

- STORY MODE: 6 exotic locations, 21 levels.

Guide the vermillion bounty hunter on an epic quest for revenge. Your home planet has been invaded by monsters, your girl is in danger and your personal ship has been shot down. The responsible for all this is Dr. Kultz, an evil mad scientist. You have no option left but to collect every weapon you can get your hands on, tame the first flying beast that crosses your path and kill your way to revenge through 21 beautiful and dangerous levels.

Aside from the bottom of the ocean featured in the demo, other areas include a colorful jungle, a rocky desert and an abandoned city. Each of them will contain several thematic levels with their own unique enemies and death traps.

While most missions will consist in disposing of waves upon waves of standard foes in creative ways, we will break the pace every now and then to ensure that things stay fresh. In the final game you will find different enemy classes (like heavies that soak up damage and can’t be dragged around), chase sequences, and other variations such as dark sections that you have to explore with the only light of your own shots.

The story will be told through animated comics and will introduce you to an array of loony characters that will help you slowly piece together exactly what is going on.

- INFINITE RUNNER MODE.

If you’re feeling more casual, you can leave the story aside and dive into this mode that plays as a suicide mission. You get just one life and are pitted against an infinite supply of enemies in a procedurally generated level that never ends. Make your revenge last for as long as you can and see if you have what it takes to beat the hi-scores.

- GIANT FINAL BOSSES.

Because, what kind of an action game would Will of Flame be without some massive bosses to stuff with lead?

- EPIC SOUNDTRACK.

The soundtrack is a fundamental part of any action game and for that reason we’re making sure to get it right. Rock and electronic tunes will set the rhythm for frenetic bursts of action and will make every one of your choreographies of death feel much more glorious.

Check out a sample of WOF’s soundtrack by the phenomenal David Serrano.

- CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION.

Littered across the levels you will find hidden treasures that are worth hundreds of moola (in-game currency). Grab as many as you can and run to the store to spend them on new helmets, hats, hairstyles, goggles and jackets. Amass enough and you’ll be able to purchase exotic mounts to lead to revenge while looking the part.

Will of Flame will not have paid DLC nor will it let players pay real money in the store, just moola.

- MINIGAMES AND CHEATS.

We want to give you as many toys and extras to play with as we can, so that you get the biggest bang for your buck. Expect unlockable secrets that will add many hours of silly fun and refreshing changes in the rules.

Emilio is a telecommunications engineer currently working in the industry as a game programmer. At the tender age of 11 he was already building computers in the back of a store in Panama. He’s the architect coding the world of Will of Flame.

Antonio has a bachelor in Advertising and a master’s degree in 3D modeling and animation. He started making games in PowerPoint when he was a kid and later moved on to Flash games and animations. He’s in charge of the artistic side of the game.

Above all, we are two passionate video game enthusiasts who can’t get enough of creating worlds for other gamers to explore, mess around with and, of course, destroy. It is with this goal that we founded Noble Weapon Games and that Will of Flame was born.

We have been developing Will of Flame for more than 2 years while we finished our studies and worked part-time on and off. We have invested a massive amount of time and quite a bit of money in it. Now, after many gameplay prototypes, changing the whole visual style and moving from a custom engine to Unity 3D, we finally feel confident that the project can be completed just how it was always meant to be: perfectly polished and brimming with content in order to bring you the ultimate 2D action fest.

We now have the foundations, most of the tools and the tried-and-true workflow; but, if we want that dream to be realized, we are going to need to work on the game full time for at least 10 months and face much greater development costs. And that’s something we can only afford if you contribute to the cause.

With your help, a year from now, Will of Flame will bring a healthy dose of action to gamers all around the globe and you will be in possession of lots of great perks. 

SO HOW MUCH DOES WILL OF FLAME NEED TO REACH COMPLETION?

Below you can see the minimum budget necessary to finish and release Will of Flame in all its glory by Q2 2015



TOTAL BUDGET: €38,000

Design and Animation: €9,800

Development tools and licenses: €4,120 (buying tools and add-ons for Unity 3D, and licenses for Unity Pro, iPhone and Android).

Programming: €11,000

Music and Sound FX: €2,200 (15 songs + hundreds of sound effects).

Producing the Perks: €4,561

Legal costs & Reserve funds: €694

Taxes and Indiegogo and Paypal fees: €5,625


STRETCH GOALS

What happens if we get more than the minimum budget? For every €5,000 more than the initial goal, we will port Will of Flame to a new platform, starting with the Wii U and following with the PS4 and Xbox One. In the event that those stretch goals are covered we will use the extra funds to translate Will of Flame to more languages (the game will be originally released in English and Spanish).

There are 3 big ways in which you can help Will of Flame achieve its full potential. It is up to you to decide which options suit you best. Just remember that one option doesn’t exclude another (in fact all 3 are extremely complementary) and that every bit of help counts!

1. FUNDING THE GAME.

The most obvious way to help is by funding the game. Starting at €5 you will become a fundamental part in the making of this badass action game and you will take home a series of increasingly amazing perks (detailed in the next section).

2. SPREADING THE WORD.

We don’t have a big advertising budget, so we need all the help we can get when it comes to telling the world about Will of Flame.

If, like us, you want to see the game finished, you can help a lot by simply talking to others about it. Anything goes here: tell your family and friends, share the campaign on social networks, feature it on your blog or website, create your own content about it...


We need as many people as we can to watch the campaign video and to play the demo. The more they experience about Will of Flame the more likely they will be to fall in love with it.

Get a special reward using the Indiegogo share tools!

Do you have an Indiegogo account? If not, you can create one and help the project enormously by using IGG’s share tools.

To keep you motivated we will be giving a unique prize to the person who rakes in the most contributions: 2 copies of Will of Flame (PC and mobile device of choice) and an exclusive drawing of the winner as a WOF character.

Downloadable resources.

Aside from the links to the campaign and demo, if you click through this link you will find many more goodies in the form of images and videos of Will of Flame that we encourage you to distribute all over the Internet. We will keep adding more in the upcoming weeks.

3. GIVING US FEEDBACK.

We are always eager to hear your opinions and suggestions. We want you to have a blast with Will of Flame, so please tell us what you like, what you think doesn’t work, what you would love to see... Share all your ideas here at Indiegogo or email us at nobleweapongames@gmail.com

Aside from Indiegogo, we will also be in touch through our website, Youtube, Facebook and Twitter to share updates and keep the conversation flowing, so don’t forget to check back often and don’t be shy!

NOTES:

- Most of the art showing the perks is WIP which means the design of some of them will improve vastly before they get to you. We will also hold polls so you can choose which designs you prefer.

- For perks that involve you in the creative process, such as designing items and enemies, the following necessary terms apply: to redeem them you must agree to let us use your idea in the game; we will not accept any offensive content; and we will work with you to make sure that your ideas fit within Will of Flame’s world and gameplay mechanics.

- Delivery times will vary: some perks can’t be delivered until the game is completed, while most will be shipped within the first months of development. We will have more information on this very soon but in the meantime please rest assured that we will send them to you ASAP.

- Paypal disclaimer: Paypal requires us to state that we can't give a 100% guarantee of delivery for the rewards. While this is true, we can assure you that short of the untimely death of one of our team members, we will allow nothing to stand between you and your well deserved rewards.


Here’s a list of all the stuff we are preparing for our generous backers:

€2: REVENGE SUPPORTER

€5: GUERRILLA FUNDER

All of the above plus:

€10: TRIGGER HAPPY

All of the above plus:

€15: EYE FOR AN EYE (or get it for just €12 if you're one of the first 128!)

All of the above plus:

€25: BOUNTY HUNTER

All of the above plus:

€40: THE ART OF REVENGE

All of the above plus:

€60: LEGENDARY SPEARHEAD

All of the above plus:

€75: ENGINEER OF DESTRUCTION

All of the above plus:

€100: STYLISH AVENGER

All of the above plus:

€150: STYLISH AVENGER

All of the above plus:

€200: REVENGE SCHOLAR

All of the above plus:

€300: BEAST MASTER

All of the above plus:

€400: ACTION HERO

All of the above plus:

€700: TROPHY COLLECTOR

All of the above plus:

€1,000: AVENGING ANGEL

All of the above plus:


What platforms will I be able to play Will of Flame on?

You can expect Will of Flame to be initially available for Android,iPhone,Windows Phone 8 and standalone platforms like PC, Mac and Linux.

We have also discussed Wii U development as the controls are very suited for the game, but that requires a separate licensing process, just like PS4 and Xbox One, and is therefore one of our stretch goals.


Can I play Will of Flame in my language?

As native Spanish and fluent English speakers, you can expect the game to be in both these languages. However, we would love to translate the game to as many languages as possible (see our stretch goals for more details)

Will I find any DRM in Will of Flame?

We will avoid DRM, except for platforms which have special requirements like Steam.

What about DLC or being able to use real money in the game store?

Will of Flame will come packed with unlockable content from the get go and you will not have to pay extra money for anything. In the store in the game you will only be able to spend moola: in-game currency you collect by playing the levels.

Do you have any other questions?

You can visit our website for more information. If you still can’t find the answer you’re looking for, please don’t hesitate to e-mail us at nobleweapongames@gmail.com
story_txt:

To achieve the revenge you’re seeking, you will have at your disposal a huge array of weapons, myriads of death traps scattered through the levels and a tractor rifle that lets you pick up enemies and drag them wherever you want. How you combine all three means of destruction is up to you and will determine your final score and the cool stuff you unlock.

We plan on bringing Will of Flame’s hectic action to the screens of Android, iPhone and Windows Phone 8 devices as well as to PC, Mac and Linux. After two years of development, we have come to Indiegogo to enlist you in our commendable
mission. Together we can deliver a modern tribute to the best of 2D gaming from the 90s: the trigger-happy pace and humor of arcade gems like Metal Slug, combined with the charm and originality of Nintendo’s platformers and RPGs. In addition to the fun we will have making and playing Will of Flame, there are some truly awesome perks you can get by being part of this project.

Before saying anything else, we want to let Will of Flame speak for itself. We have prepared a demo for you to get a small taste of what will be included in the full game. Please do take a couple seconds to read the “How to Play” first, keep in mind everything is work in progress, and don’t forget to come back when you’re done playing to hear the rest of what we have in store!
HOW TO PLAY (AVENGING 101):
1. SHOOT AND DODGE
- Use the W,A,S,D keys to move around. Aim and click with the mouse to shoot your enemies.
- Click on the weapon in the HUD or use keys 1-9 to toggle between weapons.
-You can use
an Xbox 360 controller any time you want, just turn it on and use the left
joystick to move, right joystick to aim, RT to shoot and LB and RB to switch weapons.
- Pick up weapon cases to restock ammo, health kits and shields to stay alive, and gold coins just because they’re shiny (in the final game you’ll be able to spend them).
2. USE THE STAGE
- Try shooting at interactive elements in the stage to create chaotic chain-reactions. Original and over-the-top kills will get a one-liner, which nets you more points than a standard kill.
3. THE TRACTOR RIFLE
- The 10th weapon slot (key number 0) will give you access to a very special tool: the tractor rifle. Click and hold to shoot an energy beam and use it to catch up to 3 enemies. Keep holding and drag them against one of the many death traps in the stage and watch your score and XP bar (experience) rocket!

Remember that revenge is nothing without style, so make every kill as splendid as you can. Your performance will be graded when the demo is over. That’s all you need to know, now click through and blast away!


Even with all the action it packs, the demo you played is just a tiny part of the whole Will of Flame experience. Aside from the obvious improvements such as tons of new weapons and more polished graphics, here is a quick rundown of all the features we are working on:
- FULLY SCALABLE GAMEPLAY 
As you can see in the demo, the gameplay in Will of Flame is scalable by the player at any time. You can limit yourself to a more classic approach and just riddle your enemies with bullets, or you can get
crazy and unleash all kinds of hell on them by combining your weapons, the
stage and the tractor rifle.No matter how you play you will always quench your thirst for fast-paced action; but the more you invest in the game, the more you will get in return. Like in the best action movies, your best kills will be rewarded with one-liners, worth extra points. You will also get more XP so you can level up and unlock new tools of destruction.

At the end of each level you will see your final score detailed so you can compete with yourself and your friends. There will be emblems to unlock by performing certain feats, and the game will track your stats so you can keep a record of every last one of your over-the-top antics.
Our aim is for Will of Flame to have as much replay value as possible to keep you coming back for more insane rampages.
- STORY MODE: 6 exotic locations, 21 levels.
Guide the vermillion bounty hunter on an epic quest for revenge. Your home planet has been invaded by monsters, your girl is in danger and your personal ship has been shot down. The responsible for all this is Dr. Kultz, an evil mad scientist. You have no option left but to collect every weapon you can get your hands on, tame the first flying beast that crosses your path and kill your way to revenge through 21 beautiful and dangerous levels.

Aside from the bottom of the ocean featured in the demo, other areas include a colorful jungle, a rocky desert and an abandoned city. Each of them will contain several thematic levels with their own unique enemies and death traps.
While most missions will consist in disposing of waves upon waves of standard foes in creative ways, we will break the pace every now and then to ensure that things stay fresh. In the final game you will find different enemy classes (like heavies that soak up damage and can’t be dragged around), chase sequences, and other variations such as dark sections that you have to explore with the only light of your own shots.

The story will be told through animated comics and will introduce you to an array of loony characters that will help you slowly piece together exactly what is going on.
- INFINITE RUNNER MODE. 
If you’re feeling more casual, you can leave the story aside and dive into this mode that plays as a suicide mission. You get just one life and are pitted against an infinite supply of enemies in a procedurally generated level that never ends. Make your revenge last for as long as you can and see if you have what it takes to beat the hi-scores. 
- GIANT FINAL BOSSES. 
Because, what kind of an action game would Will of Flame be without some massive bosses to stuff with lead?

- EPIC SOUNDTRACK. 
The soundtrack is a fundamental part of any action game and for that reason we’re making sure to get it right. Rock and electronic tunes will set the rhythm for frenetic bursts of action and will make every one of your choreographies of death feel much more glorious.
Check out a sample of WOF’s soundtrack by the phenomenal David Serrano.
- CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION. 
Littered across the levels you will find hidden treasures that are worth hundreds of moola (in-game currency). Grab as many as you can and run to the store to spend them on new helmets, hats, hairstyles, goggles and jackets. Amass enough and you’ll be able to purchase exotic mounts to lead to revenge while looking the part.
Will of Flame will not have paid DLC nor will it let players pay real money in the store, just moola.

- MINIGAMES AND CHEATS. 
We want to give you as many toys and extras to play with as we can, so that you get the biggest bang for your buck. Expect unlockable secrets that will add many hours of silly fun and refreshing changes in the rules.


Emilio is a telecommunications engineer currently working in the industry as a game programmer. At the tender age of 11 he was already building computers in the back of a store in Panama. He’s the architect coding the world of Will of Flame.
Antonio has a bachelor in Advertising and a master’s degree in 3D modeling and animation. He started making games in PowerPoint when he was a kid and later moved on to Flash games and animations. He’s in charge of the artistic side of the game.
Above all, we are two passionate video game enthusiasts who can’t get enough of creating worlds for other gamers to explore, mess around with and, of course, destroy. It is with this goal that we founded Noble Weapon Games and that Will of Flame was born.

We have been developing Will of Flame for more than 2 years while we finished our studies and worked part-time on and off. We have invested a massive amount of time and quite a bit of money in it. Now, after many gameplay prototypes, changing the whole visual style and moving from a custom engine to Unity 3D, we finally feel confident that the project can be completed just how it was always meant to be: perfectly polished and brimming with content in order to bring you the ultimate 2D action fest.
We now have the foundations, most of the tools and the tried-and-true workflow; but, if we want that dream to be realized, we are going to need to work on the game full time for at least 10 months and face much greater development costs. And that’s something we can only afford if you contribute to the cause.
With your help, a year from now, Will of Flame will bring a healthy dose of action to gamers all around the globe and you will be in possession of lots of great perks. 

SO HOW MUCH DOES WILL OF FLAME NEED TO REACH COMPLETION?Below you can see the minimum budget necessary to finish and release Will of Flame in all its glory by Q2 2015
TOTAL BUDGET: €38,000
Design and Animation: €9,800
Development tools and licenses: €4,120 (buying tools and add-ons for Unity 3D, and licenses for Unity Pro, iPhone and Android).Programming: €11,000
Music and Sound FX: €2,200 (15 songs + hundreds of sound effects).
Producing the Perks: €4,561
Legal costs & Reserve funds: €694
Taxes and Indiegogo and Paypal fees: €5,625
STRETCH GOALS
What happens if we get more than the minimum budget? For every €5,000 more than the initial goal, we will port Will of Flame to a new platform, starting with the Wii U and following with the PS4 and Xbox One. In the event that those stretch goals are covered we will use the extra funds to translate Will of Flame to more languages (the game will be originally released in English and Spanish).

There are 3 big ways in which you can help Will of Flame achieve its full potential. It is up to you to decide which options suit you best. Just remember that one option doesn’t exclude another (in fact all 3 are extremely complementary) and that every bit of help counts! 
1. FUNDING THE GAME.
The most obvious way to help is by funding the game. Starting at €5 you will become a fundamental part in the making of this badass action game and you will take home a series of increasingly amazing perks (detailed in the next section).
2. SPREADING THE WORD.
We don’t have a big advertising budget, so we need all the help we can get when it comes to telling the world about Will of Flame.
If, like us, you want to see the game finished, you can help a lot by simply talking to others about it. Anything goes here: tell your family and friends, share the campaign on social networks, feature it on your blog or website, create your own content about it...
We need as many people as we can to watch the campaign video and to play the demo. The more they experience about Will of Flame the more likely they will be to fall in love with it.

Get a special reward using the Indiegogo share tools!
Do you have an Indiegogo account? If not, you can create one and help the project enormously by using IGG’s share tools.
To keep you motivated we will be giving a unique prize to the person who rakes in the most contributions: 2 copies of Will of Flame (PC and mobile device of choice) and an exclusive drawing of the winner as a WOF character.
Downloadable resources.
Aside from the links to the campaign and demo, if you click through this link you will find many more goodies in the form of images and videos of Will of Flame that we encourage you to distribute all over the Internet. We will keep adding more in the upcoming weeks.
3. GIVING US FEEDBACK.
We are always eager to hear your opinions and suggestions. We want you to have a blast with Will of Flame, so please tell us what you like, what you think doesn’t work, what you would love to see... Share all your ideas here at Indiegogo or email us at  nobleweapongames@gmail.com 
Aside from Indiegogo, we will also be in touch through our website, Youtube, Facebook and Twitter to share updates and keep the conversation flowing, so don’t forget to check back often and don’t be shy!
NOTES:
- Most of the art showing the perks is WIP which means the design of some of them will improve vastly before they get to you. We will also hold polls so you can choose which designs you prefer.
- For perks that involve you in the creative process, such as designing items and enemies, the following necessary terms apply: to redeem them you must agree to let us use your idea in the game; we will not accept any offensive content; and we will work with you to make sure that your ideas fit within Will of Flame’s world and gameplay mechanics.
- Delivery times will vary: some perks can’t be delivered until the game is completed, while most will be shipped within the first months of development. We will have more information on this very soon but in the meantime please rest assured that we will send them to you ASAP.- Paypal disclaimer: Paypal requires us to state that we can't give a 100% guarantee of delivery for the rewards. While this is true, we can assure you that short of the untimely death of one of our team members, we will allow nothing to stand between you and your well deserved rewards.
Here’s a list of all the stuff we are preparing for our generous backers:€2: REVENGE SUPPORTER
€5: GUERRILLA FUNDERAll of the above plus:€10: TRIGGER HAPPYAll of the above plus:€15: EYE FOR AN EYE (or get it for just €12 if you're one of the first 128!)All of the above plus:€25: BOUNTY HUNTERAll of the above plus:€40: THE ART OF REVENGEAll of the above plus:€60: LEGENDARY SPEARHEADAll of the above plus:€75: ENGINEER OF DESTRUCTIONAll of the above plus:€100: STYLISH AVENGERAll of the above plus:€150: STYLISH AVENGERAll of the above plus:€200: REVENGE SCHOLARAll of the above plus:€300: BEAST MASTERAll of the above plus:€400: ACTION HEROAll of the above plus:€700: TROPHY COLLECTORAll of the above plus:€1,000: AVENGING ANGELAll of the above plus:
What platforms will
I be able to play Will of Flame on?
You can expect Will of Flame to be initially available for Android,iPhone,Windows
Phone 8 and standalone platforms like PC, Mac and Linux.
We have also discussed Wii U development as the controls are very suited for the game, but that requires a separate licensing process, just like PS4 and Xbox One, and is therefore one of our stretch goals.

Can I play Will of Flame in my language?
As native Spanish and fluent English speakers, you can expect the game to be in both these languages. However, we would love to translate the game to as many languages as possible (see our stretch goals for more details)
Will I find any DRM in Will of Flame?
We will avoid DRM, except for platforms which have special requirements like Steam.
What about DLC or being able to use real money in the game store?
Will of Flame will come packed with unlockable content from the get go and you will not have to pay extra money for anything. In the store in the game you will only be able to spend moola: in-game currency you collect by playing the levels.
Do you have any other questions?
You can visit our website for more information. If you still can’t find the answer you’re looking for, please don’t hesitate to e-mail us at  nobleweapongames@gmail.com

story: Campaign moving to Kickstarter! join us then!
story_txt: Campaign moving to Kickstarter! join us then!

story:
What is it?

SimStock is a festival management simulator. You get to run your own festival, book bands, build stages, hire food trucks, place bars and sort out broken toilets, what fun! Imagine theme park, but with festivals and you are half way there, but our game is going to be pretty surreal and out there, aided by our good friend Russell Taysom who is adding his trippy visual style to the game.

At the stage the game is in a pre-alpha build with only minimal assets, mechanics and features. The point of this crowd funder is to raise the money so that we can add all the other bits in that we have dreamt up and make the game a real belter. See below for a road map of the game and it's development milestones.

How you win and how you lose

There are three things to pay attention to in SimStock: Money, people and waste. Each impacts the other, so the more people the more money you have coming in but also the more waste they produce and that will need to be dealt with otherwise people will start leaving.

You start with a small amount of money and nobody at your festival, start by buying some cheap stages, bars and food trucks and watch the numbers grow but to make real money you need to book a band! Certain bands can go on certain stages and will add a modifier to the stage, increasing the money you earn. Eventually you will need to build some toilets to increase your waste capacity and make sure people aren't disgusted by the state of your festival! 

If you are not careful your festival will start to fall apart and you'll end up with no money and no fans. If it goes well then you will be ready to move on to bigger sites with more complex maps and variations but as it stands, that is where the game ends... see below for what we would like to build into the game with your help!

Current build (pre-alpha):

Quick list of the current features, assets and mechanics we have in the game 

  • Engine!
    • ​We had to design and build our very own engine to run this game, Nathan has built the engine and mechanics and imported Russell's assets.
  • Small and basic map
  • Money (Euro) and Festival population and mechanics
    • ​Waste mechanic (to be implemented)
  • Small, Medium and Large
    • ​Stages
    • Bars
    • Food Trucks
    • Toilets - (to be added)
  • A few starter bands that we made up to play on the stages
    • ​​Some actual bands have now signed up to be in the game and we are working on getting them into the game for the first release. Each band will have a tune of theirs playing when you put them on a stage.​
  • Random event cards
    • ​We have a number of random chance cards designed and ready to go with beautiful illustrations by Russell Taysom. They range from noise fines to someone starting an acid-fuelled cult.
  • What we are currently working on:
    • ​Music implementation
    • SFX implementation (SFX are recorded and ready to go)
    • UI and UX
    • Waste meter and mechanics
    • Toilets
    • Crowds (Will increase to cover the map as more people arrive)
    • Testing

With the money from the crowdfunder we plan to add more features and more complexity to the game:

Release build (alpha 0.1):

Quick list of what we think is plausible to build into the next release with funding

  • Various maps and map types (beach, desert, lake, boreal etc etc)
  • More assets (stages, bars, food trucks, toilets, characters)
    • ​More complex assets and mechanics (bins, meeting points, clothing stalls etc)
    • Camp sites and camping facilities
  • Crew up! (Sound Engineers, Artist Liason, Stage Crew, Security etc)
    • ​Each crew area will cost money but give bonuses to artist modifiers, camping, and safety and will affect random chance cards
  • Animations
    • ​Right now nothing is animated because we can't afford to pay an animator to do this for us!
  • Phases
    • ​The jewel in the crown of this game will be the phases which are split into four and represent different aspects of a festival with unique challenges and mechanics. So far the only playable phase is the 'production' phase but from start to finish the phases are:
      • ​Planning
      • Pre-production
      • Production
      • Post-production
    • Stay tuned to our crowdfunder and sign up to our mailing list at www.simstock.rocks to find out what these are and how they will work!

Future builds and wishlist:

  • Real festival maps - would be great to get some real festivals involved and have custom maps for them
  • Proper AI punters that have wants and needs that you must meet to keep them safe, happy and at your festival!
  • Lots of other things that we will reveal as time goes on (can't give all our secrets out at once!)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need & What You Get

We set this up to see if people are interested in this idea, interested enough to play it and interested enough to support it, but we also set it up to build a community and generate some ideas. We are also selling the early version of the game to get a bit of money coming in to pay for the design and dev time needed to move us onto the next and better version of the game! 

Most of the funding will go to paying for Russell's time and Nathan's time (our lead developer) as we are in such early stages we can't give a complete breakdown of where funding will be going but as soon as we are at that stage we will release a breakdown document. We will also need some initial money for developer licenses, apple and google play store access and server costs.

  • What we need: £5000
  • Why we need it: to pay for development time, publicity and running costs
  • How we will use it: We will publish monthly spend reports to show where funding is going
  • What you get: access to the game as soon as it is prototyped and depending on the amount you choose to back us with some goodies!
  • What you also get: To be part of a community that helps us build the game and your name in the credits
  • What you can also have (if you want it): Links to any design documents, meeting minutes, trello boards, game design docs, finance reports and so on. We plan on being transparent and also inviting people along for the ride to see how the work is going and to know where your funding is going.

PERKS

​We will be releasing our perks incrementally so stay tuned to our twitter and mailing list for more info!

 

The Impact

We really believe that this game is worth building and we have already dedicated a year to it. A management game based on running festivals with trippy and beautiful artwork by Russell, coupled with some real life stories of festival woes has got to be worth a go. We are just starting out and this is very much a labour of love at this point, we aren't a company or getting paid or expecting to get paid, we are just enthusiasts with some fun ideas and funnier stories that we want to share with people. Everybody loves a festival and most people think they could run a festival better, so here is the chance! If this campaign picks up pace, so will we. We are happy to publish our spending so that backers can see what we are putting funds into and we wan't to build a community around this game.

  • Seed funding a new development studio
  • Developing a new game engine
  • Continued development of new and interesting games!

 

Risks & Challenges

There are a number of risks and challenges that we may or may not face but the largest one has got to be getting the thing off the ground! At the other end of the spectrum things could go the other way and we might end up with way too much money but in that case it means we can scale our team and the scope of the game to make it denser and add more mechanics, improve graphics etc etc. We are a two and a half person team (we pay Russell to be rad) and although we have considerable experience as developers we are not game developers. We are certain that we will run into various hurdles but from working on festivals and in software development for many years we feel we should be able to tackle issues as they come.

  • Not being able to build the game with the amount of money we have
    • This won't happen, even if we get no funding we will build it one way or another, it's just the more we get the faster we can do it and the better (in theory!) it will be!
  • Having too much money
    • In this case we can scale the scope of the project and the size of our team - meaning that we will be able to put more resources into the game and make an even better version of it (which was our end goal!)
  • Not having the game built by the deadline
    • This is an issue that many game developers face but we feel that we have a stripped back version of our ideas which is manageable and we are confident that we have the project management skills to stay on target.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support us, but you can't financially, then please let people know about SimStock! Get the word out there! Tell your friends, your supermarket attendant, your mechanic, your divorce lawyer! Tell your kids, tell the teachers, tell your pet. You get the idea

story:
We are 2Snakes, an independent small studio from Barcelona, with years of experience in the gaming industry. We have developed many games for mobile devices, and during these years of development, we always get the same conclusion: if you have a good story to tell, the best way to do it is with a gamebook.

And... you know what a gamebook app is, right? A gamebook app is an interactive book in which you decide the course of the story you are reading/playing.

We love original gamebooks, but in the case of "The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans" the mix between game and book includes a LOT of game.

In gamebooks, it's usually the dice which decides who wins the fights, but we prefer to create fight scenes and make YOU fight!

We have 2 different fight scenes:

  • Punch fight. You must punch the enemies without kicking the innocents.
  • Slide fight (with weapon. Similar to games like Fruit Ninja). You mist slide in order to kick the enemies, and of course, without hurt the innocents.


What we are going to do

We want to make two gamebooks both for ANDROID and IOS devices (iPhone and iPad), explaining the adventures of Guy Brush. Both available in Spanish and English.

  • The first one is: The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans.

"Guy Brush lost his job because he handed a very important document in Comic Sans.

Desperate, he went on a mad crusade to destroy Comic Sans... without knowing he was going to discover an awesome secret."

 


Everybody knows that there is something evil behind the Comic Sans. Several witnesses have reported strange things concerning the Comic Sans. Here's an example:


And here you can see a reflexion made by scientists around the world...astonishing!


In "The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans", you will join Guy in his crusade, taking decisions and fighting against a crew of mad characters.

When Guy loses his job, he finds a mysterious hotdog vendor. He offers Guy a strange hotdog from which a greenish fluorescent light emanates. When Guy bites the hotdog, he travels to the past, to 1959, right before the creator of the Comic Sans was born.

So, now, you are going to help Guy prevent the creation of the Comic Sans... but you need to know that nothing is what it seems....

 


  • The second gamebook we are going to create is: Raiders of the Frozen Idol

This story begins when Guy Brush reads in the newspapers that Disney bought and closed LucasArts. LucasArts has for years created the best games on the planet:  Maniac Mansion, The course of Monkey Island, Day of the Tentacle, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, and a lot of Star Wars games!

Guy is desolated and decides to discover where is Walt Disney being kept frozen, to unfreeze him and ask him for his help to keep the LucasArts Company from closing.

He has a clue to start the search:

"A long-standing urban legend maintains that Disney was cryonically frozen, and that his frozen corpse was stored beneath the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland"

Source: Wikipedia page about Disney's Hibernation urban legend

Join Guy in this crusade among the planet, and help him save LucasArts!


    


Gameplay

  • Fights

Our gamebooks don't use dices to defeat challenges... you must fight!

We are going to include 2 fight modes in both gamebooks (Punch fight and Slide fight). Depending whether the fight allows the use of weapons, you will need to punch or slide.

Here you can see a play demo (in Spanish) where you can take a look at the Punch fight mechanics.


  • Items 

Our gamebooks have an item list. When you do something important or relevant, it will generate a item. These items can be objects that you find along the story, events that happen, people you know, things that you decide to do....

These items will determine the future of the story. Something you did in the beginning of the story can completely change its course. 

Sometimes you'll see different possible options to choose from, but only some of them may be eligible to you. That's because it depends on the items you got in the previous pages of the story. 


Why do we need the money for?

We've currently almost finished the Android engine development, and we are very close to finish the iOS too. Also, the first gamebook, The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans story is finished, but written in Spanish (we are from Barcelona).

So, we need the money to be able to:

  • Finish the Android and iOS (iPhone and iPad) development.
  • Translate "The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans" into English (due to the size of the story it's quite expensive)
  • Finish writing "Raiders of the Frozen Idol", and also translate it into English (to write a gamebook takes much time, especially if you have a lot of threads)
  • Pay a musician to create the soundtrack of "Raiders of the Frozen Idol" ("The Awesome Secret of Comic Sans" soundtrack is almost finished)

And that's all. 


 

The team

2Snakes team is composed by:

  • David Regordosa. Computer engineer, nerd and writer. (@pisukeman)
  • Laura Tomàs. Chief editor, Japan lover and writer. (@lau_chan)
  • Adrià Regordosa. Illustrator and nerd. 
  • Eduard Tomàs. Computer engineer, Microsoft MVP, nerd and writer. (@eiximenis) 

Other games made by 2Snakes:

Yakuchi (arcade color balls game)

Space Junkman (retro style game)

story:
Vinilo eSports Club

The first call to the investment pool was launched on January 5, 2020 with the desire to build an Ecuadorian eSports team that is a reference in the country and Latin America. The team was born on September 26, 2019 as a test to see the performance and the possibility of making a multidisciplinary Ecuadorian sports team profitable. with an investment of $ 8118 dollars which to date amounts to $ 19320 dollars between computers, rental of the establishment, tournaments, basic services, among others. The computer equipment is installed in our specific player room for training of the Fortnite team which was recruited through tournaments with a cost of $ 10.

Within the team we already have 12 Fortnite players divided into 2 divisions which are 8 in aspiring division (second division) and 4 in recruits division (third division) of which once they pass the tests and prove to be the best The team will be promoted to the professional team (first division) 4 players who will receive a monthly payment of $ 200 plus auspices to national and international tournaments, but to maintain the level they will undergo tests and the opportunity will be given every 3 months to new players who demonstrate to be better; In the first and second division, contracts will be signed with each player to support the capital and exclusivity will also be required as players with penalties such as disqualifications as esports players and in case of passing to other teams the investment cost that is made for each player will be charged plus 500%; of all the capital that is generated from winnings in prizes discounting taxes and any type of withholding, 50% will be distributed among investors (25%) and team salaries among other expenses (25%), 50% will be for the player or team that won that award. We are also running a call for January 11, 2020 for Super Smash Bros. players on January 25, 2020 will be for League of Legends players and dates will continue to be scheduled for teams of Fifa, CSGO, Call of Duty, Dota 2 between others.

This project was born with Esteban Armendáriz at the head as team manager, seeing the potential of Ecuadorian players and the lack of incentives and professional preparation that exists despite being one of the businesses that currently offers the most profits, below. We cite some reference videos that explain a little more about the subject:

2017 An interesting explanation of esports: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fu6zWemA3co&amp...

The Worlds 2019 of League of Legends: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wX4m6G56iS4

The most prestigious eSports championships today: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AdqfxO9sJZA

THE 5 MOST RICH PLAYERS OF THE SPORTS 2018: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5XxgygcM0-U

Bugha earns $ 3 million in a Fortnite tournament and ascends the prize pool to $ 100 million: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WKl4EoRIlz4

Get to know some of the players in the Vinilo eSports Club team https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UMKaokBPOHI

If you want to know our facilities or get more information contact us and we schedule an appointment you can also follow us on our youtube, facebook, twitch, mixer channels, etc. on Wednesdays and Sundays at 7pm you will answer questions about investing in Vinilo, esports on the country and what is coming for the team. In this link you can connect to the live and training team Vinilo:

https://www.facebook.com/viniloesportsclub/

#VamosVinilo

story:
Hi. My name's Konrad Kiss. I'm an indie game developer - 35, living in Hungary, Europe. I have two mischievous kids, a beautiful wife and a weird dog called Paper.

Bitgap Games is my company - created with the aim to develop Xenocell, a massively multiplayer action-strategy game in a sandbox environment for the PC. [Initially for Windows with plans to port over to Linux as resources permit.]

I've been a programmer for over 16 years - creating games since I was 8. My first game to get noticed was called Droidarena in 2000 - it was a browser based strategy game where you had to use a programming language to manage your robot in team based fights within randomly generated arenas.

For the past over four years I've been working with a small team on Xenocell, a sci-fi themed desktop game for the PC that plays in the not so distant future.

The reason why we're here on IndieGoGo is that although Xenocell is nearly ready to go live, we now see that we don't have the required funds to be able to pay for the launch of the game. So we decided to try asking for outside help through IndieGoGo.

Your contributions will help us secure server resources and launch Xenocell - a huge effort for an independent game company which we are currently not able to undertake.

Please help us, we'd love to show the world how extraordinary Xenocell is!

 

More details about the gameplay

Read more details about the gameplay in a recent interview about the game by Video Games Interactive.

 

Background story

In the near future, govenrments fight hard to keep their control, but gradually lose to corporations. Before a new world order is born, the United Nations Space Program manages to launch the first interstellar space vessel created by humans - project EDEN.

Upon entering the gravity well of Alpha Centauri's only habitable planet, Ibelis, the ship breaks up in orbit under mysterious circumstances evacuating thousands of life pods towards the planet surface. The game tells the story of the survivors of the U.N.S. EDEN and their search for answers.

 

If you like the idea, please let others find us!

We'd be extremely grateful if you could spread the word about this campaign to your friends. This helps us more that you'd think. If you believe that Xenocell is interesting, please let others know! It is an excellent way for you to show off your support and for others to find out about Xenocell! Just click on any of the sharing tools at the top of the page! Thank you so much! 

 

What we need

The following is a short description of what we need your help with.

We estimated initial server and operating costs for two months at a player count where the game becomes able to support itself.

If everything goes according to plan, our third month will be funded by the game itself! Of course, to achieve this, we need to present sufficient server resources so players can enjoy a seamless experience. We also need to make sure that all the placeholder art is changed to final versions of 2D graphics and 3D objects.

To be able to quickly respond to bugs and feature request, we'll need to make sure that during those two months we're able to work on the game almost without interruption - so we'll need an additional programmer who can quickly jump in.

Finally, we need to make sure that we get the word out - so we'll get in touch with game magazines (we actually already got started with that!) and contact publishers like Steam (Greenlight), Desura and GoG, so we can get started with working on implementing their APIs.

Since we don't see the launch happen unless we reach our goal, we only take your pledges if we reach the target sum of $20K.

 

What you get

Here is a list of things we offer you in return for your invaluable help in getting Xenocell off the ground:

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Do I get a downloadable copy of the game?

A: Yes! Actually, everyone does! We are planning to make the game freely available to download for everyone. However, certain parts of the game are only available to VIP members. Things like being able to use higher quality items, or being able to start a clan. Most of our perks include VIP membership plans from a single month to a lifetime membership.

Q: What does it mean to be a VIP member?

A: Being a VIP member means that you can access every feature of the game. You are either a FREE or a VIP member. FREE members can play as well, but they won't be able to ie. start a clan.

Q: How do I become a VIP member?

A: To become a VIP member, you can either pay monthly for a subscription, or you can use an in-game item called a VIP ticket, which will turn the player's account into a VIP account for an entire month. The great thing about tickets is that you can give them to other players or you can trade them for other in-game valuables.

Q: Why do players need to subscribe? Why not charge only once for the game?

A: In contrast to traditional games, most massively multiplayer games like Xenocell need to support a huge number of servers to keep the game world active even while you are not playing. So, in Xenocell, when you close the game, the rest of the world lives on! When you log in again the next day, it is possible that you will have a new neighbor or see signs of an attack against your base.

This requires plenty of computers - resources that we need to pay for every month. We also believe that having to pay a few dollars each month as long as you play the game to its full or for free with minor limitations is fair and allows everyone to try the game without first buying it. If you don't want to play for a few months, you can just suspend your subscription or not use your VIP tickets - you can change back to playing for free at any time!

Q: What is the price of a VIP subscription for a month?

A: It's 400 store Points or $7.95 when you subscribe monthly. 400 Points cost from $4.57 (when you buy more Points) to $9.95 (when you buy exactly 400 Points). A great aspect of points is that you can spend them on several things in-game. Few items have a price both in Credits (in-game fictional currency) and Points (store currency you can buy for real money). We paid attention to being very careful about what items are available for Points in-game to not affect game balance.

Q: What platforms will the client support?

A: It will support all Windows versions since Vista.

Q: If you get a liftime V.I.P membership via donation, does that make the game free but with VIP access, for as long I want?

A: Yes! The lifetime option will make your account VIP - so you can access the game in full without having to either spend your store Points or subscribe for a few dollars a month. Please see the FAQ questions above for details about VIP access and Point values. To give you an even better idea, visit this page: http://www.xenocell.com/store/.

Q: What hardware demands does the game have?

A: We are still working on optimizing the game's performance and we've used older hardware for development and testing to see performance issues right away. We don't have the final specs yet, but the bottleneck will definitely be the graphics card. It currently runs great on an ATI Radeon 5770 card which according to http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/ is a bit weaker than an average card today.

Q: Only online mode?

A: Yes, the entire game is persistent, always online - like MMOs.

Q: What happens if you spend time and “money” on building stuff and needs to go away for some time. Will there be any way of protecting that from simply being blown away when you come back online later?

A: As long as your items are not destroyed you can always deconstruct anything you built back into a convenient inventory item. Deconstruction takes time and resets if you are interrupted.

Q: Is the game balanced for one player or group dynamics?

A: My goal was to allow single person groups to exist. By being able to build NPC defences, turrets and a host of other defensive options, a well-protected one player group will be just as hard to beat as an entire clan. However, attacking another clan will be very hard to do alone. The game helps a lot with defense, but little with offense.

Q: Is this game on a single shard server?

A: Yes, for now. We predict that it is able to host tens of thousands of players, perhaps even hundreds of thousands. We are able to clone a new shard in a day, however.

Q: What happens to avatar and/or equipment when offline?

A: Your avatar and your avatar's inventory disappear from the world just like in any other persistent online game. Your structures that you built and your hired mercenaries however stay where you place them and do their job. Mine minerals, defend your buildings, trade with your allies, etc...

 

 

Feel free to drop questions in the comments, we'll add them here and hopefully give you a thorough answer!

 

 

Note, that V.I.P tickets can be traded in-game. The amount of V.I.P tickets and store Points received is alway the highest value above a certain pledge level. Only the most significant forum badge will be made visible on the forum profile.

Again, thank you so much for your help! Feel free to ask questions in the comments section, via Twitter (@konradkiss - follow me and I'll return the favor) or through our official forums for the game at xenocellforums.com.

We'll work very hard to make you proud!

--Konrad

A: We are still working on optimizing the game's performance and we've used older hardware for development and testing to see performance issues right away. We don't have the final specs yet, but the bottleneck will definitely be the graphics card. It currently runs great on an ATI Radeon 5770 card which according to http://www.videocardbenchmark.net/ is a bit weaker than an average card today.
Q: Only online mode?
A: Yes, the entire game is persistent, always online - like MMOs.
Q: What happens if you spend time and “money” on building stuff and needs to go away for some time. Will there be any way of protecting that from simply being blown away when you come back online later?
A: As long as your items are not destroyed you can always deconstruct anything you built back into a convenient inventory item. Deconstruction takes time and resets if you are interrupted.
Q: Is the game balanced for one player or group dynamics?
A: My goal was to allow single person groups to exist. By being able to build NPC defences, turrets and a host of other defensive options, a well-protected one player group will be just as hard to beat as an entire clan. However, attacking another clan will be very hard to do alone. The game helps a lot with defense, but little with offense.
Q: Is this game on a single shard server?
A: Yes, for now. We predict that it is able to host tens of thousands of players, perhaps even hundreds of thousands. We are able to clone a new shard in a day, however.
Q: What happens to avatar and/or equipment when offline?
A: Your avatar and your avatar's inventory disappear from the world just like in any other persistent online game. Your structures that you built and your hired mercenaries however stay where you place them and do their job. Mine minerals, defend your buildings, trade with your allies, etc...
 
 
Feel free to drop questions in the comments, we'll add them here and hopefully give you a thorough answer!
 
 
Note, that V.I.P tickets can be traded in-game. The amount of V.I.P tickets and store Points received is alway the highest value above a certain pledge level. Only the most significant forum badge will be made visible on the forum profile.
Again, thank you so much for your help! Feel free to ask questions in the comments section, via Twitter (@konradkiss - follow me and I'll return the favor) or through our official forums for the game at xenocellforums.com.
We'll work very hard to make you proud!
--Konrad

story:
Game Overview

FootBall Universe 14 is a football-based game where you control a team of 5 fully customizable robots. 


Graphics: The game graphics are in 3D with low amount of polygons, to run on devices without crashes.
Designed for mobile: Play with a simple and intuitive control of screen taps (no on-screen buttons!) to control your characters in field.

Leaderboards: See how you rank compared to players Globally.
Stadium: The game will feature various stadiums and fields.

Character customization: You can customize your robots to improve the attributes of each, and your characters have items to use in the game, as traps, barriers and special attacks.


Your contributions mean everything to this project. All the proceeds go directly into developing FootBall Universe 14 Game and to keep updates.


Feel free to post your ideas, we will try to implement them as soon as possible.

Thank you so much for all your support and interest in our game! We would love to hear your suggestions!

ForGodMobile Team.



System requirements

  • CPU: +800 MHz
  • RAM: +512 MB
  • GPU: +64 MB
  • HD: +20 MB
  • DirectX: 9
  • System: Android [4.0], Windows [XP], Browser [IE, Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Opera], Linux [Ubuntu 10.10], Windows Phone [8], iOS [7], MAC [OS X 10.6].


Gameplay

You will dispute matches of 2 periods of 2 minutes or in training mode you can choose the time and difficulty level. The objective is to score more goals to win the match.
During matches the items and each character's equipment will help you improve the performance on field.
Each character has an energy bar with 100 points, each attack he gets subtracts of this bar, reaching 0 this character will stay unable to be controlled until the energy bar recover (approximately 20 seconds).



  1. Strength skill: increases the damage caused.
  2. Resistance skill: reduces the amount of damage received.
  3. Speed skill: reduces the time it takes to perform an action.
  4. Indicator: amount of matches that you won.
  5. Indicator: amount of Universe Cups that you won.
  6. Indicator: available credits.
  7. Indicator: points earned.
  8. Button: purchasing items.
  9. Button: go to the match.

*Each character has their individual skills.


Equipment

The equipment add or subtract values of the skills: strength, resistance and speed. Initially each skill will have 10 points.


Some examples of equipment 

  1. Head - Spartan head: +2 strength, +5 resistance.
  2. Arms - Defenders arms: +20 resistance, -5 speed.
  3. Trunk - Strong torso: +10 resistance, -2 speed.
  4. Legs - Simple legs: +2 resistance, +5 speed.
  5. Head - Pointed head: +2 resistance, +5 speed. 


Items

The items help you during the game and they can be: traps, barriers and special attacks.

Traps: Used to hamper the play of opponents.

Barriers: blocks or impedes something. And staying on the field for a few seconds.

Special attacks: The damage from special attacks are added to strength of those who launched and subtracts of who receives the attack.


Some examples of items

  1. Barrier - Christ: dwell time 20 seconds. Area of Effect (AoE): 9 squares.
  2. Barrier - Large hand: dwell time 5 seconds. Area of Effect (AoE): 3 squares.
  3. Trap - Catapult: throw far away those who pass over it.
  4. Special Attack - Punch Power: +10 damage.
  5. Special Attack - Energy Ball: +20 damage.


Each character will have the complete inventory with basic equipment and items. You can exchange the items and equipment and customize by changing the color of the equipment.

 

Examples of special teams

Any similarity is mere coincidence! The objective of the game is not equal to other characters, but allow you to customize your team the way you want.

Knight Team: Adds +5 in Strength skill for all of the team.

Spartan Team: Adds +5 in Strength skill for all of the team.

Avenger Team: Adds +5 in Resistance skill for all of the team.

Dragon Team: Adds +5 in Resistance skill for all of the team.

Detective Team: Adds +5 in Speed skill for all of the team.

Feminist Team: Adds +5 in Speed skill for all of the team.


Keep in mind that this demo is a very early development of the game and that things are subject to changes for the better.


Goals


1.        $1.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser.
           Game Modes: World.

2.       $5.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux.
           Game Modes: World, Training.

3.       $10.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux, Windows Phone.
           Game Modes: World, Training, Online VS.

4.       $50.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux, Windows Phone, IOS.
           Game Modes: World, Training, Online VS, Training penalty.

5.       $100.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux, Windows Phone, IOS, MAC.
           Game Modes: World, Training, Online VS, Training penalty, Online world.

6.       $500.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux, Windows Phone, IOS, MAC, More Other (BlackBerry, OUYA...).
           Game Modes: World, Training, Online VS, Training penalty, Online world, Online team.

7.       $1.000.000 Enables Us To:
           Platforms: Android, PC, Browser, Linux, Windows Phone, IOS, MAC, More Other (BlackBerry, OUYA...), CONSOLES (PlayStation, Wii, Xbox 360...).
           Game Modes: World, Training, Online VS, Training penalty, Online world, Online team, Mini game.


Game Modes

World: You will play with 32 national teams if you win all 32 matches, you dispute with a special team.
Training: Configurable game time and 3 difficulty levels (easy, medium, hard) to train.
Online VS: Play against random opponents or invite your friends to a game.
Training penalty: This game mode helps you train penalty shootout.
Online world: 32 players connected dispute among themselves, each team can play at most 4 matches.
Online team: Connect with up to 4 other players from around the world and complete a team of 5 players to dispute a match.
Mini game: It is a side-scrolling game with pixel art graphics.


Except training modes, all matches and Universe Cups that you won will appear in their respective indicators and it give you points or credits to use in purchasing items and equipment.

 

Contest

• 1 Your name in the credits
• 1 Thank You email from the ForGodMobile team

story: Just want to make someone somewhere happy.
