story:
Read first, please

If you are reading this, I suppose that The Tale of Three got your attention, didn't it? And if you want to make this game happen – just contribute! But if something prevents you from that, please answer two simple questions: What is that? And what should I do to resolve your doubts?

It seems that many people have objections and I would like to help them. But I cannot do it without feedback :( It will take you a minute to answer my questions, so please leave a comment here or on Facebook or email me directly: matthew@gamednastudio.com. I really need your even the smallest involvement :)

If the problem is that you don't believe that we can create this game, take a look at the video. Two people created this in about three months. Throughout the year we will be able to do much more. We dedicate The Tale of Three every minute of the day because we really believe in it. It's our dream and we want it to come true!

If you doubt because of the total amount of contributions so far, don't think about it ;) Game like The Tale of Three can be funded within hours or days. If everyone will make a contribution without thinking, "I would help them but I'm afraid they won't make it", we will reach our goal quickly. We can create The Tale of Three and we will do everything to create it! So don't hesitate, get on board, and together we can make it become a reality :)

OK, that's all about my thoughts. Below you can find info about the game, the team and our special contest ;)


Win digital and boxed copies of The Tale of Three, access to the alpha and beta versions, exclusive gnome figurine, and many more! Click on image above to learn more :)


SPECIAL OFFER!

During the Indiegogo campaign digital copy of The Tale of Three with goodies at a special lower price!

 


Imagine a game like a fable where you decide how the story goes…

Welcome to our crowdfunding campaign for The Tale of Three, which is a third-person perspective video game with three playable characters whose fates get tangled up with each other.

If you haven't already seen the trailer, don't wait anymore – you must see it! The video contains actual in-game footage from the pre-alpha version. We realize that it looks pretty raw without some assets, textures, or parts of gameplay but keep in mind that it's the beginning of the development and in the end it will look much better.

Our goal is to create a game like a fable, which will allow you to take part in an epic adventure with unforgettable characters in the mysterious world, and where on your choices will depend how the story goes. We hope that it will stand out by its original gameplay and high level of difficulty – like in old good games, but with a modern twist.

Among the inspirations we have to mention tales from our childhood like those by the Brothers Grimm, Hans Christian Andersen, Charles Perrault, and many, many others. When it comes to games, we take pattern from Hype: The Time Quest (it's quite old but still charming), Fable: The Lost Chapters, and Prince of Persia.

So what we want to achieve is to create something that will make us feel the same magic we felt when our mothers and fathers read us stories in childhood, and then when we played games as teenagers. Sometimes contemporary productions look pretty but finishing them no longer makes such pleasure like in the old ones. We would like to return to the roots, drawn from the DNA of classics and make for you something that you will want to play again.


We are friends whose love for games leaded to set up gameDNA studio, which so far is two-person indie game development team.


I've loved programming since I was a kid, so today I'm a software engineer with a degree obtained at the Warsaw University of Technology. In gameDNA studio I'm a Gameplay and AI Programmer responsible for all the technical issues (including programming in C++).


I've always loved art, so in our game I'm responsible for writing the script and creating all visual aspects of it including the whole world. I've already finished studies at the University of Warsaw and I have a bachelor of arts degree.


We have spent plenty of time playing games and we have always dreamt of creating them, so about a year and half ago we started to be more serious about this. At first, we were a little scared but when we started developing… we fell in love with it from the first sight! Sure, it's not easy but it gives us great pleasure and satisfaction. It's some kind of labor of love. We really believe in The Tale of Three and we hope that we're not the only ones :)



If you want to ask us about something or you have suggestions, we'd love to hear from you at: patrick@gamednastudio.com and/or matthew@gamednastudio.com. Don't be shy and feel free to write to us :) We promise that we will do everything to respond to all of you.

Beginner thief with magical powers, overgrown and extremely strong gnome, and smart elf with the powerful bow. Three heroes whose fates are suddenly tangled up with each other and lust for wealth leads to the one… But will they find what they expect at the end of the journey?

Well, the answer to this question you will obtain when you finish the game. But first you need to explore the magical world, defeat hundreds of enemies, discover pieces of the puzzle story and make decisions on which everything will depend. The great adventure is waiting for you!

The heroes appear in turns during the story so you will have an incredible opportunity to look at some events from the different perspective.

Main features of the game in case of reaching the campaign goal:

  • Almost every mission can be completed in multiple ways. You decide whether to accomplish it craftily, truculently, or maybe you can find a happy medium. You can sneak around or go all out, hide or attack. The choice is yours.
  • Each of three playable characters has its unique skills that are inestimable useful in combat. You can fight using melee and ranged weapons and also magical powers.
  • Use the environment! Due to the physics a lot of objects can be moved and destroyed but also used against the opponents.
  • Compete against different enemies: wild animals, skeletons, bandits, angry gnomes, and many, many others as well as bosses whose defeat require use of fancy methods. But remember that every opponent is different so each requires different tactics.
  • Get ready to explore the magical world (also on a horseback) covering approx. 10 square km (4 square miles) including undergrounds. Visit medieval city, enchanted forest, village of elves, ruins, dark woods, swamps, caves, etc., and also have some fun in the tavern, take a trip through the gnome mines, and sneak around the castle.
  • Be ready for the high level of difficulty, planning next move, solving puzzles, and making quick decisions that cannot be taken back.
  • Discover the dynamic world that is alive with day/night cycle and weather. Meet a whole host of animals (e.g. wolfs, bears, cats, cows, birds) and the magical creatures (yes, dragons too!).

The Tale of Three will be an action-adventure game with platform elements, but we won't hold your hand throughout the story. There will be a lot to discover but nothing will be given on a plate. We focus on a maximum immersion and high level of difficulty like in the old-school games.

It's hard to assess it now, but don't expect that The Tale of Three will be as big as AAA titles because these games were created by dozens of people for many years and their production cost millions of dollars. We are only two and so far our budget is made up of our savings, which slowly come to an end.

Thus The Tale of Three is going to be a smaller indie game, which would resemble a fable. Not an RPG but an action-adventure game with wonderful story that depends on your choices. No open-world but freedom in large locations.

However, if we would be able to collect money we need, it is possible that we will extend the original concept by adding some more stuff…

As we mentioned, we are using Unreal Engine which is a wonderful tool for game development. It powers such titles as BioShock, Splinter Cell, Batman, Borderlands, Thief, Fable Legends, Gears of War, Mass Effect and much more. The newest version of this engine allows us to build a detailed world with a day/night cycle, weather events and without loading screens.

Also we are using SpeedTree to create stunning plants as well as Mixamo to animate characters and animals.


We are going to run a forum for funders where you will be able to share with us your opinions, suggestions, and thoughts about The Tale of Three. It's extremely important for us to stay in touch with you so we could create the game that meets your needs.

For this reason, we will release the alpha version in late spring 2015 for all funders up from the Alpha Version tier, and then the beta version for all up from the Beta Version tier. We would like to give you an opportunity to participate in the development :)

We have never created a game before so first we wanted to make sure that we will be able to provide you a solid product.

Over a year ago we started to explore the possibilities and learn everything about game development. The first engine, which we used, was good and thanks to it we learned the basics but we wanted something more. Then, in the first quarter of this year, we decided to move to Unreal Engine 4. We started again and in the last three months we have created the pre-alpha version that you can see in the video above.



First of all, because we have to pay for some really expensive programs, updates and assets that are necessary to create an up-to-date game including SpeedTree for beautiful grass and other plants, and Mixamo for realistic animations.

Because we would be able to hire a few people who offered us their help. After all they will not work for free so we would be able to pay them wages.

Because we need to update some of our equipment in order to better optimize it for game development. We have to buy a new computer with the powerful graphics card because Unreal Editor needs a high performance hardware.

And last but not least, as for now we finance the game with our own savings that are running out. We work from home to minimize costs but we have to pay the rent, bills, taxes and other administrative costs. Also we must eat ;)

Combining it all together and adding the costs for the development and the perks, the budged set for this campaign is the total minimum. We chose "fixed funding" so if we do not reach our goal, The Tale of Three will most probably not be made because we will be forced to go to work and we will not have time to make it. Simply, it’s all or nothing.

But on the other hand, if we exceed the minimum goal, we will be able to create for you much more! We could port game to GNU/Linux and Mac, and add more characters, locations and missions.


The complete digital version of The Tale of Three which you will be able to download directly from us and, if we get the greenlight, from platforms like Steam and GOG.com.
Exclusive limited edition of The Tale of Three in the awesome digipack box. Available only during the Indiegogo campaign!
Have more fun in the world of The Tale of Three with this specially created additional mission!
The Tale of Three is full of secrets to discover but this one will be special… and we are going to reveal it only for funders!
Set of five wonderful wallpapers for various screen resolutions.
Join our closed forum about The Tale of Three with the special badge, share with us your thoughts and take part in game development.
A great set of postcards from The Tale of Three printed on high quality paper.
Awesome t-shirt with The Tale of Three motif printed on it. Before sending you will be asked for the proper size.
Exclusive B2 poster signed by The Tale of Three developers.
Your name as a funder in the game's credits. If you want to remain anonymous, please notify us via email.
Participate in The Tale of Three development! Get access to the alpha version and share with us your observations that will help us create even better game.
Play The Tale of Three before others! Get access to the beta version of the game and help us polish it.
Something for real collectors! Get the exclusive 10 cm (approx. 4″) figurine of the Gnome Hero! Yes, the same who will you have pleasure to play in The Tale of Three.
Find yourself in the world of The Tale of Three. Send us your photo and we will create character that will look nearly like you (choose whether you want to be an elf or a human).
Get the credit of the Co-Executive Producer in the game opening titles! Please note that it is not associated with the receipt of royalties.

When and on what platforms will The Tale of Three be released?

Currently we are working on PC version of the game that we want to release in fall 2015. It will be also possible to port it for GNU/Linux and Mac but it depends on exceeding the minimum goal of this campaign.

Will The Tale of Three be DRM free?

Of course it will be! We hate DRM! But please note that if you buy it via platforms like Steam it will be assigned to your account in accordance with terms of use of the service.

What languages will be supported?

English and Polish. We would be able to translate it into more languages in case of collecting more money than we assume.

What about risks?

Of course there is a possibility that the game may be delayed due to development problems but we promise to do everything to deliver it to you as soon as possible.

Also if we don't collect money we need, The Tale of Three won't be made.




Please, share this page on Facebook, Twitter and other social networks by clicking on buttons below the video on the top of this page. We will appreciate that!

You can also encourage your favorite game-oriented sites and blogs to write about The Tale of Three. If you want to help us this way, here's our press kit that you can send to them or write to us and we will do it.


Thank you for reading this! We hope that you like our game so get on board and make it happen :)
story_txt:
Read first, please
If you are reading this, I suppose that The
Tale of Three got your attention, didn't it? And if you want to make this game
happen – just contribute! But if something prevents you from that, please
answer two simple questions: What is that? And what should I do to resolve
your doubts?
It seems that many people have objections and I
would like to help them. But I cannot do it without feedback :( It will take
you a minute to answer my questions, so please leave a comment here or on
Facebook or email me directly: matthew@gamednastudio.com.
I really need your even the smallest involvement :)
If the problem is that you don't believe that
we can create this game, take a look at the video. Two people created this in
about three months. Throughout the year we will be able to do much more. We
dedicate The Tale of Three every minute of the day because we really believe in
it. It's our dream and we want it to come true!
If you doubt because of the total amount of contributions
so far, don't think about it ;) Game like The Tale of Three can be funded
within hours or days. If everyone will make a contribution without thinking, "I
would help them but I'm afraid they won't make it", we will reach our goal
quickly. We can create The Tale of Three and we will do everything to create it!
So don't hesitate, get on board, and together we can make it become a reality
:) 

OK, that's all about my thoughts. Below you can find info about the game, the team and our special contest ;)Win digital and boxed copies of The Tale of Three, access to the alpha and beta versions, exclusive gnome figurine, and many more! story:
OVERVIEW

IOX is an Action RPG set in the future around the orbits of Jupiter. As a player you take the role of a mercenary who works contract missions for various corporations operating in the solar system.

Four mission playable prototype on Steam and on our website. Test it out for yourself.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1190690/IOX/

https://ioxiangames.com/downloads/

 

ITEM PROGRESSION

Currently in the playable demo the item progression is just the foundation for us to build and experiment upon. Our planned item progression will have several features that let you customize how your gear work as well as provide scaling to allow you to tackle harder challenges once you have enough resources.

 

Augmentation

Items will have upgradeable stats to improve it for greater challenges. Usually it is more resource beneficial to try to find a similar item with better stats from a mission than trying to upgrade one from junk to god tier. If you are really keen on using the same item from the start to the finish you can do so.

Most items in the game will have slots for you to attach augments into them, modifying the base behavior of the item or provide various other effects. Augments can be attached freely but detached with a small cost and they will have their own internal stats that can be upgraded with resources.

Items can be sealed to give them the final boost of power. Once sealed the item can no longer be modified or it's augments removed. Sealing an item gives an option to choose a powerful extra modifier that can not be gained in any other way. During mid-game it can be useful to use some sealed items just for the additional power they provide, while keeping on improving similar non-sealed versions for the endgame.

Cosmetics

Players will have the ability to modify the look of the items they find as well as their effects. When you disassemble an item you will gain the ability to make any other same class item to look like the one you destroyed, both in the inventory as well as on the characters hands. For weapon and skill effects the players will have the capability to change the color, sound and particle effects to a certain degree of the item. This has no gameplay effect, but as we all know; victory means nothing if you don't look good while doing it.

 

TALENTS

As you progress through the missions and level up you will unlock talent points that you can spend to modify your character's playstyle. Talents are usually the factor that dictates what kind of equipment your character will use as even tho some talents give extra power in a straightforward manner, their biggest strength come from synergistic combinations. Talent points can be redeemed at a price, so if you feel like you selected a bad talent point or feel like trying something new you can respec some of your points easily. Respeccing entire characters will be costly tho so if you are planning a new build it is usually better to level up a new character for that rather than paying to redeem all talent points.

 

MISSIONS

All the missions in IOX will be handcrafted and will provide unique challenges and features. Players can choose to play missions in the order they like, so when you feel like you are ready for bigger challenges you can do so right away without having to grind through non-challenging content.

Missions will have variations and features that get randomized every time you finish up a previous mission. These variations will make the mission more challenging and more rewarding. You can see the active features on the mission selection menu so you can prepare accordingly. This will help with replayability of the missions as they are not bound to tiers and can freely go from easy to hard depending on how many and which features are active at a time.

 

PRICING MODEL

We will create mission packs and other downloadable content that can be bought at a low price to extend the gameplay of the core game. All characters are compatible with the extra content, you don't need to restart the game when you install new dlc. All support tiers will get the first mission and content packs that we consider will make IOX a full game. Depending on how well it goes we will look into developing extra content packs after the release of the initial ones to expand and experiment with the gameplay.

The core game will always remain free. This will ensure players can try the game that it is to their liking and that it works flawlessly on their machine. As we are a very small studio we don't have resources to test the game on that many rigs. Never the less, if you have problems running our game please let us know, we will do our best to make it work.

The core will also allow people who like to mod the game to do so without having to pay, making it more easier to share the project between people and machines. Also people are able to play mods made by others with the free core version, that way it is very easy to recommend your mod to others as they can just download the core version, install the mod and try it out.

 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES

Depending on the funding we manage to gather we look into developing additional features for the game. These features include modding tools, multiplayer mode (to some degree, we might not be able to provide full coop mode), vehicle combat missions and base building. We will discuss more about these features if we can make sure that including them won't impact the core development of the game. They can be features that we will add into expansions after the main game is complete.

 

CROWDFUNDING

Big part of the ARPG experience is coming up with your own build, improvise the next step depending on the loot you gain and having to balance various different aspects of your character. As huge portion of a character's strength come from synergistic power of combining items, augments and talents it becomes increasingly difficult trying to oversee everything that is going on. This is called combinatorial explosion as the number of different parts increase, the different ways you can combine them increase in exponential fashion.

Also as each of us have different preferences on what we like to play in an ARPG it becomes very important for us to talk to people who have different preferences. For example I rarely play minion builds myself so I depend on listening to those who do. These reasons are why we believe that including the community into the development process is the right way to do the game so we can ensure that all the different builds stays enjoyable to play.

We have spent our time to get the foundation of the game to be ready for pure content development. We can safely say that there are no big technical changes going on in the code at the low level and working with the tools already in place we are getting quite good on estimating how long each piece of content or feature will take.

As a backer you will gain access to our development channels for the duration of development. Depending on the perks this access will continue after the release of the first content packs. We call this access 'premium account'. All backers will receive a premium account and all premium accounts are the same, it just means if you have access to the development resources or not. Higher perks get some extra online swag to show their support level.

We are looking for two year development cycle to say that the game is fully released. After that we will work on at least couple expansion packs, maybe even more if everything goes well.

Estimated time for getting backer access to the beta content is Q4 of 2020.
Estimated time for getting finished content packs is Q4 of 2021.

Thank you for your time and interest in the project.


-Risto Paasivirta

When you disassemble an item you will gain the ability to make any other same class item to look like the one you destroyed, both in the inventory as well as on the characters hands. For weapon and skill effects the players will have the capability to change the color, sound and particle effects to a certain degree of the item. This has no gameplay effect, but as we all know; victory means nothing if you don't look good while doing it. TALENTSAs you progress through the missions and level up you will unlock talent points that you can spend to modify your character's playstyle. Talents are usually the factor that dictates what kind of equipment your character will use as even tho some talents give extra power in a straightforward manner, their biggest strength come from synergistic combinations. Talent points can be redeemed at a price, so if you feel like you selected a bad talent point or feel like trying something new you can respec some of your points easily. Respeccing entire characters will be costly tho so if you are planning a new build it is usually better to level up a new character for that rather than paying to redeem all talent points. MISSIONSAll the missions in IOX will be handcrafted and will provide unique challenges and features. Players can choose to play missions in the order they like, so when you feel like you are ready for bigger challenges you can do so right away without having to grind through non-challenging content.Missions will have variations and features that get randomized every time you finish up a previous mission. These variations will make the mission more challenging and more rewarding. You can see the active features on the mission selection menu so you can prepare accordingly. This will help with replayability of the missions as they are not bound to tiers and can freely go from easy to hard depending on how many and which features are active at a time. PRICING MODELWe will create mission packs and other downloadable content that can be bought at a low price to extend the gameplay of the core game. All characters are compatible with the extra content, you don't need to restart the game when you install new dlc. All support tiers will get the first mission and content packs that we consider will make IOX a full game. Depending on how well it goes we will look into developing extra content packs after the release of the initial ones to expand and experiment with the gameplay.The core game will always remain free. This will ensure players can try the game that it is to their liking and that it works flawlessly on their machine. As we are a very small studio we don't have resources to test the game on that many rigs. Never the less, if you have problems running our game please let us know, we will do our best to make it work.The core will also allow people who like to mod the game to do so without having to pay, making it more easier to share the project between people and machines. Also people are able to play mods made by others with the free core version, that way it is very easy to recommend your mod to others as they can just download the core version, install the mod and try it out. ADDITIONAL FEATURESDepending on the funding we manage to gather we look into developing additional features for the game. These features include modding tools, multiplayer mode (to some degree, we might not be able to provide full coop mode), vehicle combat missions and base building. We will discuss more about these features if we can make sure that including them won't impact the core development of the game. They can be features that we will add into expansions after the main game is complete. CROWDFUNDINGBig part of the ARPG experience is coming up with your own build, improvise the next step depending on the loot you gain and having to balance various different aspects of your character. As huge portion of a character's strength come from synergistic power of combining items, augments and talents it becomes increasingly difficult trying to oversee everything that is going on. This is called combinatorial explosion as the number of different parts increase, the different ways you can combine them increase in exponential fashion.Also as each of us have different preferences on what we like to play in an ARPG it becomes very important for us to talk to people who have different preferences. For example I rarely play minion builds myself so I depend on listening to those who do. These reasons are why we believe that including the community into the development process is the right way to do the game so we can ensure that all the different builds stays enjoyable to play.We have spent our time to get the foundation of the game to be ready for pure content development. We can safely say that there are no big technical changes going on in the code at the low level and working with the tools already in place we are getting quite good on estimating how long each piece of content or feature will take.As a backer you will gain access to our development channels for the duration of development. Depending on the perks this access will continue after the release of the first content packs. We call this access 'premium account'. All backers will receive a premium account and all premium accounts are the same, it just means if you have access to the development resources or not. Higher perks get some extra online swag to show their support level.We are looking for two year development cycle to say that the game is fully released. After that we will work on at least couple expansion packs, maybe even more if everything goes well.Estimated time for getting backer access to the beta content is Q4 of 2020.Estimated time for getting finished content packs is Q4 of 2021.Thank you for your time and interest in the project.-Risto Paasivirta

story:
A Campaign Problem - Update 1 - Paypal issues

There is a rather big problem with the campaign at the moment. The donations that we've recieved are not being processed and shown on the page. Even though that we actually got a lot of donations from you, (big thanks for them), it looks like that we won't be able to receive them due to some paypal issues. Donations are, for some reason, returned to the donator as soon as he makes the contribution. We are trying to solve the problem with the indiegogo staff, but we think that the solution won't be find. Once again, thanks a lot to everyone who donated. You have shown us that you really do care about us and that's why we will do our best to keep up with the show with the current technical problems, just because of you!

First of all, take a look at the video presented above, it doesn't last for too long! =)

Also, thanks for taking a look at our first Indiegogo campaign! We are very happy to have such a professional way to present your our project and ideas which will hopefully be recognized and supported by You!

My name is Igor "D2P.Nexus" Dudjak and I am the founder of Dota 2 Portal, one of the nicest Dota 2 communities on the Internet. From the moment I started playing this awesome game, I got hooked to it. Its interesting team-based gameplay creates a wonderful atmosphere for you and your friends to play. In my case, it was the love on the first sight.

In order to give something back to this nice game, I've created a Youtube channel and got an idea to combine the 3 things that I love the most - Dota, Video Editing and Music. After discussing it with some of my close friends, I created the first episode 3 weeks ago..

From the moment the show was uploaded and presented to the community, I've received a lot of positive feedback from the people saying that the "Dota 2 Lore" is one of the nicest Dota 2 shows at the moment. I was really happy and amazed by the reactions, even though our first episode was presented as a beta - testing of the show.

I would really like to continue creating these videos, but sadly, there are some huge problems that could lead to the complete shut down. That's why I am here, to seek out the help from you guys! Thanks a lot!

Before I proceed to the details of the campaign, I would like to present you some details regarding the "Dota 2 Lore". Hopefully, this will show you that our project is really one of the most promising Dota 2 projects right now!

Our Youtube channel is 1 year old. First video that was uploaded has around 1200 likes at the moment - Link, which is amazing. But this fact could blow your mind - our first testing episode for our new show, that was uploaded only 3 weeks ago, has already received over 1100 likes! I can't express how happy I was after I saw the comments from the community, so I have to copy paste some of them here!

"The way you narrated it was awesome, you have a very spellbinding way of words. Kudos" by Starkness1

"I really enjoyed it! The background music blends perfectly with the story telling and sketching. A little touch of color (for example, to make the hero stand out) wouldn't hurt. Can't wait for the next entry..." by Yossi Zinger

"It's been a while since I felt chills from watching a video about a game. This was amazing. Make more." by IconicSC

"Amazing series! The art style and music make it such a joy to watch...lore is always so interesting, I hope this goes on for a very long time :D Keep up the awesome work!" by Jeremy Kerr

"Yo, keep this up man! it is one of my fav dota series right and now. I swear i was waiting for some one to do dota lore and here it is. Once again keep up the good work." by Abdulrazaq Albinali

The most amazing fact is that you don't have to know any details about the game itself in order to enjoy these videos. If you are a fan of the good fantasy stories, Heroes, Dragons, Mighty Warriors, Battles, Loves and Deceptions, you will like the "Dota 2 Lore" show. I promise you that!

If you don't believe me, feel free to check out our first 3 episodes by yourself!

  • Beastmaster (Animal Protector) - Link
  • Bane Elemental (Underworld Demon) - Link
  • Jakiro (Two - Headed Dragon) - Link

Show comes with the English subtitles!


The problem is following: This show has to be recorded with some really good hardware. I am currently lending a camera from my friend in order to record in the HD resolution. Furthermore, scenes that I record are usually placed in the project folders that are often larger than 70-80 GB, for 10 min episodes.

My computer can't handle those numbers for a long time, without crashing my software at least 10-15 times during the editing process. What's even worse, once I finally edit the transitions and the scenes, I have to render the project. This rendering process takes around 6-8 hours for each episode, but only if the program doesn't crash during the rendering. If it does, I have to start over, what's really, really time consuming.

The only solution is to get a better computer and the equipment, but I won't have the necessary money for it in the both near and the far future. Currently, all the income I get is going to my College budget - appartment, bills, food, transportation and similar stuff..

Why 5000$?

Some of you could ask these kind of questions, so I would like to answer them right now. I am aware that the sum could be rather large at the first sight. But once you take into the consideration the taxes from IGG (indiegogo and PayPal), final sum won't be 5000$. The equipment we need for this project isn't cheap, as many of you already know. :) Even if we don't reach the final goal, what would be amazing, feel assured that we will use whatever we get in the best way! Of course, we will keep you informed of the things that we got, or might even ask for your help to point us to the best equipment!

Money raised over this campaign would be used for the following things:

  • I would buy a new computer, along with the 2 monitors that are "must have" for the professional video editing. - (1500 - 2000$)
  • I would buy an HD camera before I break the camera of my friend. - (1000$)
  • I would probably buy the professional drawing tablet, just to try out some stuff and hopefully bring the show to the next level. - (800 - 1000$)
  • Rest of the money would go towards the show promotion on the various places.

If you feel that you can help me out somehow, thanks a lot! Make sure to check out the Campaign Perks that could be of an interest to you!

At the end, thank you very much for showing an interest. Also, I do appologize for my rather poor English in the text above; it's not my native language. In case you don't understand some parts of the text or the idea behind this campaign, feel free to leave a comment here, or send me the question to dota2portal@gmail.com. If you want, I am always open for a live conversation with you, in case you prefer contacting people over skype - my username is "dota2portal"!

Now I have to get back to work and make another episode! ;)

story:
Mayhem Mines Overview

Mayhem Mines is a card game in which 2-4 players compete to collect the most treasure before tremors collapse the mine. The game takes between 10 and 25 minutes to play. In the game, players mine for treasure, sabotage other miners, and avoid traps and monsters such as the infamous Greedy Dragon!

Mayhem Mines is an incredibly simple card game with the objective being that at the end of the game, be the player that holds the most Treasure.

The game consists of of 4 types of cards.

Treasure Cards (Blue):
These are what you are searching for! Have the most at the end of the game and you win!

Actions Cards (Green):
An action card is held in your hand until you wish to play it.

Event Cards (Yellow):
When you draw an event card its effect takes place immediately and you reveal the card and follow the text.

Tremor Cards (Red):
Tremor cards are revealed and stay on the field.

The game is played by shuffling and dealing the entire deck of cards on to a play surface face down. Then on each of your turns you have two options, Search the Mine (pick up a card form the playing field), or Play an Action Card. Keep in mind, that some Actions Cards allow you to search as well!

This continues until 3 Tremors are caused by either revealing them in the mine or using the “Jack the Hammer” tremor causing card, the game ends immediately and a winner is determined. Add up the values of all your treasure cards. The player with the highest is crowned the winner.

Check out the Campaign Video above and download the full rules here.

View the Card Library Here.

Who are we?

Greetings. Our names are Colton White and Matt Turnbull. We have been working together for the past two years and have done a lot of gaming in that time. A while ago we set out to create a game of our own. After a few weeks of work we had a rough outline of what would later become Mayhem Mines.

When designing Mayhem Mines we had one goal; create a fast paced game that is hilarious and extremely fun to play. We encourage you to watch our video to learn more about the game, but in short, Mayhem Mines puts you in the shoes of a dwarf mining for treasure.

We have spent a lot of time designing and playing this game and we are in love with it but now we need your help. We both share the dream of having a game that we designed printed professionally and in the hands of other gamers. This is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

After getting quotes from a few different game manufacturers and shipping centers for worldwide shipping. We have determined that to not only have our game printed, but also deliver wonderful perks to our amazing backers, we need $15,000.  

The best of our campaign is that we have factored in shipping for all backers! That's right, what you see is what you pay. 

Check out the sweet perks:

story:
Reality is a matter of perspective...

Tessa's Ark is a unique Puzzle RPG with a Visual Novel Style presentation, based on the mental journey of a young woman named Tessa and her struggle to comprehend the world around her.

In the game you navigate Tessa through a post apocalyptic setting in which human kind has become extinct as a species and only exist as beings of pure thought inside a mainframe. 

Gain experience by solving Math and Color based puzzles, and advance thought the a world where the fabric of reality changes with path you choose.

Game Features:

  • Explore a unique world where both the visual aesthetic and the game play style shift based on what you believe is happening.
  • Solve math an color based puzzles to gain experience and perks to aid you in you journey.

     

  • Visual novel Style story presentation.

Here is a link to the Videogamers.eu Web Blog review of Tessa's Ark.

I apologize for it being in Estonian, but the game is really taking off in Eastern Europe. Google Chrome will translate it well enough that you can understand what it says.

“Math is always fun - ALWAYS!”
7/10 – Tessa's Ark Review

Demo version for windows is linked below:

https://neutron-dust.itch.io/quantum-tessas-ark

Demo for Android is linked below:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...

 

Scope of the Fundraising.

I already have most of the pieces in place for this project to be a success. The Game is already in Early access on Steam and has been through several rounds of revisions. I already have commitments from musicians and sound designers for the rest of the project, and I provide the graphics and programming. Even all the needed software has been purchased, so essentially all I need is time to finish and money to pay the musicians. I'm asking for 18,000 which will be distributed into 3 major categories.

  1. Music and Sound Design: I need about 3 more tracks to finish the game and the aid of a sound designer to get the menu sound up to snuff. This should be about 4,000 of the cost.
  2. Advertising and promotion:  I'm estimating this project will take an additional 6 -8 months to complete with a budget of $250 a month, so about $2,000 total.
  3. Keeping the lights on: This is the time element. I don't need any equipment or software to finish, but I do need to pay for electricity, studio space, and other general living expenses which totals about 1,500 a month for 6-8 months or about $12,000.

As far as what happens if I don't reach the goal...

I keep working on it. It just takes longer to finish. I've spent almost all of my free time working on this for three years and have been conceiving of since 1998. It's a product and a story I personally believe in and I have no intention of being deterred by anything.

Perks.

The game is currently in Early Access for Steam and in Closed Beta on Google Play.

All backers will have their name in the credits (if they would like) listed by level of contribution.

  • A two dollar commitment get you access to the format of your choice.
  • A four dollar commitment get you access to both formats.
  • A 16 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats along  with a 16 x 20 high quality print.

  • A 30 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats along  with a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy.

  • A 200 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats, a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy, and a hand drawn piece of the concept art picked at random.
  • A 400 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats, a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy, and a hand painted piece of the concept art picked at random.

Why it's important.

This is essentially a story about mental illness, and I feel it's a subject that is too often shied away from in polite discourse. I think there are a lot of conversation to be had on this subject, and it's sad to see a problem that almost half of adult suffer with at some point in their lives, being treated like it's something rare and unusual, and the people who suffer with the problems being perceived as broken or defective. I just want to start the conversation. I'm an older person (40 years) and with my graphic design background I have a couple of decades experience managing and completing long term projects. I've gotten it this far by myself, and while I could toil in anonymity to finish, I want to bring it to market faster and with a higher profile, and you can help with this

Risks & Challenges

This project is quite far along despite the current length of the game. The art style and art assets are for the most part created. All associated software and equipment has been purchased, and I have the skill to complete the project. The Early Access and Android versions are both feature complete and just need content added. I'm a professional designer with 20 years experience specifically in the printing industry including both print an T-shirt design. The game is already hosted on the platforms so you will get access to both formats at the close of the campaign. It's really just a matter of having the time and money to complete the project more quickly, and bring it to market with a bit of buzz already associated.

If you can't contribute...

Tell a friend or share this project on social media if you just find it interesting.

Or follow me on Twitter for updates:

https://twitter.com/Neutron_Dust

A 30 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats along  with a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy.


A 200 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats, a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy, and a hand drawn piece of the concept art picked at random.
A 400 dollar commitment get you access to both file formats, a Tessa's Ark shirt in Black or Navy, and a hand painted piece of the concept art picked at random.



Why it's important.
This is essentially a story about mental illness, and I feel it's a subject that is too often shied away from in polite discourse. I think there are a lot of conversation to be had on this subject, and it's sad to see a problem that almost half of adult suffer with at some point in their lives, being treated like it's something rare and unusual, and the people who suffer with the problems being perceived as broken or defective. I just want to start the conversation. I'm an older person (40 years) and with my graphic design background I have a couple of decades experience managing and completing long term projects. I've gotten it this far by myself, and while I could toil in anonymity to finish, I want to bring it to market faster and with a higher profile, and you can help with this


Risks & Challenges
This project is quite far along despite the current length of the game. The art style and art assets are for the most part created. All associated software and equipment has been purchased, and I have the skill to complete the project. The Early Access and Android versions are both feature complete and just need content added. I'm a professional designer with 20 years experience specifically in the printing industry including both print an T-shirt design. The game is already hosted on the platforms so you will get access to both formats at the close of the campaign. It's really just a matter of having the time and money to complete the project more quickly, and bring it to market with a bit of buzz already associated.

If you can't contribute...
Tell a friend or share this project on social media if you just find it interesting.
Or follow me on Twitter for updates:
https://twitter.com/Neutron_Dust

story:
Project ECHOZ is an action-adventure game, where the player is taking over the role of little Opus, who, with his companion, has to master the seemingly simplest task of the world … saving mankind.
He has to destroy the cursed phantoms and guardians to free the human echoz. But saving mankind can be interpreted in many ways, which happens to be the case with Salus, Opus' opponent. Salus wants to stop him at any cost, because according to him Opus will destroy mankind rather than save it. In the end faith will determine who's superior...

 

You can download our demo version here:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ia9tth6rf23roob/Project%20Echoz-Demo.zip?dl=0

 

 

The story

 

Ahrens, the creator, is disappointed by the race of the world he created … humanity. Mankind lives in hate, greed and rage. There is no peace in this world. Most of the wars find their origin in racism and religious differences.

 

 

These incidents led Ahrens to decide to redeem humankind, by taking their physical and mental differences. He deprived them of their souls, the echoz, and concluded their lifeless vessels into guardians. Ahrens sent the guardians to different areas and even worlds. These worlds can only be entered by gates: the Gates of Ahrens.

 

 

To protect the balance of his creatings Ahrens designed the keepers. They pursue the purpose of observing the guardians and mundits, the emotionless vessels of the former human.

 

 

100 year of peace have passed, when one keeper, named Buckles, decided to give the echoz back to humanity. In his eyes the redemption was a big mistake and he was preparing to destroy the guardians. He was searching for a mundit child, because the souls of children are the purest. Buckles tried to reconvert it into a human, which didn't succeed perfectly. The result was a little fellow named Opus, with whom he connected immediately. And thus both prepared for their adventure to oppose the sake of Ahrens and rescue the human echoz.

 

 

 

About the game

 

Our game is of the action-adventure genre and is modeled on the traditional game principle. With the task to free the human echoz you will immerse into different worlds. These worlds differ in surroundings as well as in enemies. The dungeons you have to pass are matched with the surroundings too.

 

 

There are different classes of enemies like phantoms or guardians. From them you will obtain new skills, which you will need to defeat new opponents or to navigate your way through the given scenario.

 

Opus, which you are able to play in the demo is not the only available character. Later you will get another impression of the story from the point of view of another person. Depending on the decisions you make during the gameplay the ending might vary and it is up to you on whose side you will end up!

 

 

 

 

 

About us

 

We place high value on the atmosphere and are eager to emphasize it with a appropriate soundtrack and imaginative noises.

 

 

But we need your support to be able to afford adequate equipment and to offer you an even better quality! We will also be able to enlarge our team and thus have the capacity to achieve more in the same time span.

 

 

When we have started developing this game we would have never imagined it would become such a great project. We are really proud of the soundtrack and the atmosphere, and especially of the beautifully set light effects. Sadly we haven't had the time we wanted to invest, due to our jobs and/or studies at the university. But nonetheless since October 2015 we focused on doing our best. Now we proudly present to you our demo version and we hope you like it! We would be very thankful if you could support us.

 

 

Rewards

 

 

 

 

 

T-Shirt Designs

 

123

45

67

 

When you choose a T-Shirt perk please write us a mail which size and design you want

info@team-modjo.de

 

 

THANK YOU!

 

We would be very happy if you would like our game and support us!

Thanks for your help! :)

 

Please visit us at

http://www.team-modjo.de

or

https://www.facebook.com/Team-Modjo-71356387545...

 

~Team Modjo

story:
What is Fusion Go?

Let's face it: modern handheld game consoles are bulky, overpriced, and obsolete. It's time to change that. Fusion Go is an all-new portable game console dedicated to gaming, dedicated to your friends, and dedicated to fun.

Fusion Go is designed to bring the amenities of most modern game consoles wherever you go--this means having messaging, online multiplayer, an always-fresh online game store, and more anywhere, anytime.

The sleek, retro-inspired design fits right in your pocket while still cramming in loads of fun wherever you are--the subway, out with friends, during class, or even at home.

A Premiere Gaming Experience

Playing games on Fusion Go is nothing at all like playing games on your smartphone, and that's a good thing. Instead of clunky "virtual buttons", we opted for real, precise gaming controls while still maintaining a sleek, minimalistic design. The 360-degree Analog Pad allows for a full range of motion while still being accurate enough for finite movements. Industry-standard face buttons make it easy to pick up and play on Fusion Go, and the innovative rear shoulder buttons are the perfect clash of function and portability.

For games that require a touchscreen, have no fear--Fusion Go's gorgeous 3.5" display doubles as a capacitive touchscreen as well, opening up all-new possibilities for gameplay.

Because Fusion Go is the next generation of handheld gaming, it leaves its competitors in the dust. Check out how it stands up against some other handhelds below:

A Developer's Best Friend

Hardware doesn't define a system, games do. And that's why we're making it easier than ever for developers to publish their masterpieces on a console. To start, there's no fee to become a registered Fusion Go developer--you pay nothing until you're ready to publish your masterpiece. Then, it's just a fee of $15 per game published, with a 15% royalty rate on paid games. And best of all, because Fusion Go is based on the flexible Android platform, you can start developing your games for Fusion Go right now.

Why We Need Your Help

Unfortunately, Fusion Go will never become a reality without your generous contributions. Our manufacturer is ready and able to begin production of our first batch of units, but we won't get there without your support. 

If we meet our goal, not only can we get our first units out into the world, but we can invest in an office, expand our business, and make Fusion Go the best handheld on the market. But none of it will happen without your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute to the project? Want to contribute more? It's simple: all we ask is that you share this project with your friends, gamers and non-gamers, to help spread the word!

story:
Project details

Welcome to Mimi No Ai
At first, we want to apologize for the bad English translation.
We have no money to hire a professional translator.
It took many times for us to translate the whole things with dictionary. (cry)

We hope this project will be successful so we can hire a professional translator.

Mimi No Ai is a visual novel and dating sim game that features love romance packed with beautiful CGs, music, full voice acting and Japanese culture theme! You'll be able to meet different girls and guys, build relationships, live many stories and much more!

There will be 2 versions to release:

(1) All Ages Version
(2) 18+ Version

Here is a quick overview of the default features of the game:

  1. Live2D
  2. Japanese Host And Hostess Clubs
  3. Sexy Art Style
  4. Full Voice Acting
  5. Character Events
  6. Story Events
  7. Multiple Endings
  8. Choices Matter
  9. 8 Dateable Characters
  10. Affection System
  11. Shopping System
  12. Minigame
  13. Map Navigation
  14. Combat System
  15. Inventory System
  16. Quest System

 

 

Our plan is to have Mimi No Ai developed in a timeframe of 6 months, regardless of funding. We'll aim for a December 2017 release.

 

 

Story

You’ll play as Mimi, a good and honest young girl who had been caught by Japanese Mafia Boss when you travel to Japan.The man threatened you to became his mistress.You can choose to work as a normal OL or work in his mafia group.Will you help him to commit a crime or stop him to commit a crime?

If you don’t like the man.You can also date with another guys or girls.
But please be careful don’t let the man know what you are doing or you will die!

Your choices affect the story!
You will find happiness if you make a right choice!
You will DIE if you make a wrong choice!

 

Play The Demo

(Windows + Mac + Android)

Wanna try it out firsthand? You can play the demo NOW! Click on the image below to go to the download link!

Available for Windows, Mac and Android!

 

Notice: Due to insufficient funds, we only able to make a short demo.The demo is currently missing some features. It is an extremely early alpha and does not yet have an advanced option menu. The UI is not final and the writing will receive further polish. Any part of the demo is still subject to changes and in prototype state, however, this will give you a good idea on how the final result will be.

 

 

Live2D

Mimi No Ai features Live2D technology to bring characters to life!
Experience unrivaled immersion with facial expressions and body language all animated seamlessly.

 

 

 

Characters

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Features

 

 

Goals

In order to make Mimi No Ai happen we need your help to fund this project! The higher we can raise means we will have more resources to work with resulting in more content being created for the game!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Social Media Goals

Unable to support by backing us? Anyone can help by spreading our Indiegogo campaign to the world by sharing, reblogging and retweeting the following links on Facebook, Tumblr and Twitter!

 

 

Rewards

 

 

 

We need your help!

 

 

Developer Team

story:
PLAY THE  FREE DEMO NOW!

A solitary warrior, wielding his trusted bow and arrows - a gift from the Demigodess of Sun - stands before the endless Legions of the Moon God. They are fearless, ruthless, ready to die and kill in the name of their master. The warrior pulls the bowstring. Divine powers at his command, endless courage and strength, valor and glory - He's the Celestial Hunter, sent by the Demigodess herself.

The Rage of Sun has come!

The Siege of Moon advances!

Take on the role of the Celestial Hunter - a mortal, chosen to atone for his sins by becoming a champion, fighting and serving for the Demigodess of Sun. During your quest to end the oppression of Moon Demigod, you will unveil the motives behind the Divine Siege, and participate in the creation of one of the greatest myths the humanity will pass on through generations...

 

Redum Of Sun combines the open world design similar to games from Far Cry series with fast-paced, power-fantasy battles of Doom (2016), to bring the most intense combat experience in a beautiful, modern art style. The game focuses on Archery and Magic combat to bring down whole squads of foes with epic boss battles in the forests, mountains, ruins and plains of the Homeworld of the Sun Demigodess.

 

  

Archery becomes Art in Redum Of Sun!

By bringing down Moon Sentinels and Bosses you gain their Ichor - the God Blood - to fuel your character's progress. Use it to gain powerful abilities, new arrows and divine magic to amplify your combat style, or craft useful items to aid you in dire moments - it's Dark Souls school of self-adjusting, currency-driven difficulty!

 

  • Fluid and intense archery & spell combat with rewarding character progression. Your weapon will become part of your soul.

  • Unique enemy and character designs, focused on the Divine and Exotic. Do not expect to see any mundane faces in these Celestial Lands - No mortal had ever been here before!

  • Breath-taking locations and vistas to explore. The open world of the unknown awaits to be discovered!

 

  • Old-school epic boss battles. there is no place for cowards in the Realm of Sun - only Glory for the victors!

 

  • Gain Ichor from foes you defeat to unlock divine abilities, tailoring and enhancing your own playstyle!

 

  • Unfold the truth of how the world came into existence. Collect pieces of mythos scattered in the farthest corners of the homeland of Sun

 

"Two people focused on blending the beautiful and the badass in a single experience!"

We are a two-people debutant team from Cracow, Poland - Marcin Tomala & Anna Siejka. We have been working on Indie Game Developement as hobby so far, having finished Mobile Games and Unity Asset Store products in our free time. Finaly we have decided to make the great step and fulfill our dream of creating a full-fledged Indie Game you see now!

Marcin is a Unity game developer with previous releases in Game Dev and ~6 years of experience with Unity environment and supportive software. Anna is an aspiring 3D Graphic Artist with passion to all that involves creativity and colour.

This game is the result of our common dream - to create a beautiful and memorable indie game to shine both visually and in gameplay. We are doing our best to achieve this goal and considering our team size - it is an epic challenge that we are more than glad to stand to!

Because we are a small, focused team, we wish on bringing you the best experience we dreamed of for Redum Of Sun. We don't want to sacrifice the quality of the core gameplay and feeling by placing our worktime somewhere else. We have some cool ideas for Stretch Goals, like Mac/Console ports, more language versions, more environments, or hiring Marketing Specialist so we can work more on the game itself, but we want to look objectively on what we can do in a given time. That's why we are focusing on bringing you a great game first, and accessory features second. Still, if optimistically we pierce the Main Goal with enough of your supportive power, Stretch Goals could appear in the future!

 

Do not expect that your support will go unnoticed! Every backer will recieve our gratitude, and for everyone who pledges 15$ and more, there will be rewards waiting!

(The delivery time of the physical rewards may be fluid, as they will be all hand-made and will need time to be made! :) )

Come with us on this adventure! We have different social media outlets which we update frequently with news and media. Comment, share and invite everyone you can, so more people can find out about Redum Of Sun!

Follow us on Facebook:

www.Facebook.com/RedumOfSun/

Follow us on Twitter:    

@FireballedGames

Follow us on Reddit:      

/r/RedumOfSun

 

 

Here you can find more pictures and GIFs from a pre-alpha, early version of Redum Of Sun - you can never have enough gameplay shots! Take a look!

 

 

...and Timeless Glory For All!

Redum Of Sun

Come with us on this adventure! We have different social media outlets which we update frequently with news and media. Comment, share and invite everyone you can, so more people can find out about Redum Of Sun!
Follow us on Facebook:
www.Facebook.com/RedumOfSun/
Follow us on Twitter:    
@FireballedGames
Follow us on Reddit:      
/r/RedumOfSun
 
 

Here you can find more pictures and GIFs from a pre-alpha, early version of Redum Of Sun - you can never have enough gameplay shots! Take a look!

 








 
...and Timeless Glory For All!
Redum Of Sun

story:
About Vida

Vida began in 2008 like a one man effort to make an old school looking game with newer technology. This came in Nov/2009 with UDK release. The goal was never to make a game to children, but instead a title to mature fans enjoy a hack slash RPG game on 3d with a story, mood and themes more suited to a mature audience.

Vida players can just do whatever they want at Airen continent just needing to keep themselves alive (no forced moral choices, just deal with consequences). The game offers a big character evolution arc, lots of things to discover, places to explore, creatures to fight and brings also deeper aspects like faith, politics, religion and afterlife, all this on a bloody and dirty visual.

Some features include:

  • Offline Single Player Campaign.
  • TCP Multiplayer up to 4 players.
  • Easy modding since it’s being made on UDK.
    (...well, I'm just hearing your wishes. AND...)
  • Character’s evolution game (item’s set independent).
  • A real medieval dark world (adult themed situations/quests when fits on the story).
  • 4 different areas: Airen, Manendil (the dead’s land), Abyss and the Celestial Plane.
  • By weapon techniques and a new way to compute armor (look the videos on the gallery).
  • So much spoilers here... Better keep some to the future.

Some warnings:

A) About the Gifts deliver

Be aware that I’m not including the delivering expenses on the gifts, so I’ll contact you in the future to communicate each. I prefered to do this way since I don’t know where are each of you, so would be unfair estipulate a flat fee. Also will be better we see the result just from what is really being pledged to the project.

B) Let’s be sincere

YOU NEED BEING 16+ AGE TODAY (2012) TO PLAY Vida. While I’m not worried about get a 18+, AO or whatever classification on the game I don’t want to be sued by some angry parents because their child seen some Abyssal’s boobs on the screen. So while you can donate, consider also that you can buy the game when the right time comes, the only difference is that it will be not a BACKER’s EDITION if you do so.

C) About backer’s edition

The backer’s edition will contain a personal message from me to all you backers, accessible trough a button on the main menu. This button and video will not be on the COMMERCIAL EDITION, that is the one that will be sold on public release. Also backer edition owner's: (I SWEAR) Will get a free download of any future DLC.

D) About the Legends & Avatars and Legendary Weapons Gifts

There will be just two statues like yours, an original clay one and the one I'll send you, I'll make then and break the frames exactly to make from it something so special as your contribution is being to the project now, so please take care. There will be merchandising after, but not like these I'll send to you.

What are donations to

If we don’t reach the Funding Goal...

The game will be finished regardless the funding goal be reached or not, so unless I die - or some other disaster occurs - you’ll see this game around sooner or later. Until this way, is not fair to keep the funds so if we don't reach enough to completelly change the development method you get your money back and I'll still working on the game. 

If we reach the Funding Goal... (as I hope)

I'll pay to make the gifts, the fees (engine and others), setup a team, rent a place to the team to work and so make Vida happens on the next 2-3 years, but ALL BACKER’s community will receive monthly updates through our private forums (that all backer’s will be invited to join) well like get demos at first hand throughout the project’s spam. Also I'll try get some partners to translate the game (OK, Localisate if you preffer) to the most languages possible.

If we beat GREATLY the Funding Goal…

I’ll TRY to get to Vida some CREATOR’S DREAM CONTENT. These are three ideas that I thought that would be great IF I get enough resources to invest on the game: 

1 – Upgrade engine license deal from UDK model to Source Code Licensee, this will give me access to do BIGGER MODIFICATIONS on the engine fitting it better to Vida and making the game GORYEST. 

2 – Get a legendary musician and composer to write the main game theme, when I talk about “legendary” I’m thinking on the legends from this page: http://www.songwriting-guide.com/film-composers.html, while I don’t know if one of then will be interested in producing to a small indie project I swear to try contact then. 

3 – Do you remember the live action cinematics from Resident Evil I? I think that this kind of movies fits a lot better with Vida than 3D considering the game mood.

About Me

Until being miles away from where everything happens I tried in many ways to viabilize this game, but after infinite unsuccessful tries in get investment or help I reached the point where I needed to become a lonewolf. Before start to make Vida alone in 2008 I knew that I just needed a pro technology to show everyone that I was not so mad, so in some way it's also the project of my life.

The time passed and today coincidently when some older gamers want to experience something new and at same time familiar, I had the tech, I know how to use it, it's not more just an idea and with your help I can make it faster.

Spread the word! Tell your friends! A new guy is coming to the block!
story_txt:
About Vida
Vida began in 2008 like a one man effort to make an old school looking game with newer technology. This came in Nov/2009 with UDK release. The goal was never to make a game to children, but instead a title to mature fans enjoy a hack slash RPG game on 3d with a story, mood and themes more suited to a mature audience.
Vida players can just do whatever they want at Airen continent just needing to keep themselves alive (no forced moral choices, just deal with consequences). The game offers a big character evolution arc, lots of things to discover, places to explore, creatures to fight and brings also deeper aspects like faith, politics, religion and afterlife, all this on a bloody and dirty visual.
Some features include:

Offline Single Player Campaign.
TCP Multiplayer up to 4 players.
Easy modding since it’s being made on UDK.(...well, I'm just hearing your wishes. AND...)
Character’s evolution game (item’s set independent).
A real medieval dark world (adult themed situations/quests when fits on the story).
4 different areas: Airen, Manendil (the dead’s land), Abyss and the Celestial Plane.
By weapon techniques and a new way to compute armor (look the videos on the gallery).
So much spoilers here... Better keep some to the future.

story:
Background

Do you know that one out of three kids in United States is considered overweight? Are you sick of your children so picky about food and do you worry about their health?


Here is a solution we suggest: teach kids through playing games! Video games have been proven to be an effective and motivating tool of education. Kids can play our SuperCook game, learn the appropriate diet, and establish a lifelong healthy eating habit.


Parents will no longer need to nag for junkfood. We want to help kids design their own healthy meal while having fun!

Game features

Here are some exciting features of our game!

  • Players can create their unique game character and recipe

  • Arcade mode provides food ingredients during the game. Players may earn more variety of ingredients by creating healthy recipes!

  • SuperCook provides suggestions about improving recipes to keep it healthy.

  • Players can experience virtual cooking in Arcade mode - flipping the pan, sprinkling salt...

  • Players can send their picture of virtually cooked dish as a gift to their friends on Facebook!

  • Players can share recipes with other players. Players can also rate each other’s recipe according to how tasty and healthy it is.

  • Recipes are printable! - we suggest kids ask their parents to cook the healthy dish for them!

Mock-up Screenshot

Welcome screen

Creating recipe screen

Cooking screen

Finish and share! 

Who are we?

We are "A+Health" Team! We are students at Carnegie Mellon University - Haiyi Zhu, Stephany Park, and Ruogu Kang. We hope to design a technology solution to encourage kids to eat healthier. We appreciate your attention.

What's our plan?

We are aiming at delivering a detailed web-based prototype of an ipad game with main game features. We will have users interact with the prototype and help us evaluate the game. Your funding will help us get momentum!

This is how we will spend the money (budget). 

How can you help?

Give us $3, $5, or more!
