story:
Hey guys, Eric here informing you all about the North American Gaming League. It's a Toronto, Canada based Lan/Arcade center for professional, semi-professional, amateur and casual gamers.

Our Objective- To bring gamers of every kind into one place where they can enjoy the casual and competitive side of the gaming community. Giving gamers the chance to experience the excitement and atmosphere of Pro status. And last but not least, a place where gamers can show off what they do best, have fun and make new friends while doing it :)

Raising The Funds-We are raising funds to fill our center with 24 x 22'' Monitors for crisp image gaming (allowing eight teams of four to play at once), 24 x Xbox 360's to serve all the gaming needs and 15 x Stereo sound gaming headsets to get you closer to all of the action. We also need to fill our center with the latest and up to date Sports, Fighter and FPS games. The most exciting part about this project is Main Stage. This is where players are made. 2 x 50'' projection screens will show off tournament play for a cheering and admiring audience. During tournament off days (mon-fri) the main stage can be used by anyone who wants to game. This gives gamers the sensation and thrill of feeling like a pro. Show off your skills on the big screens:) The screens will be powered by two crystal projection units allowing the best picture possible. We will need pump main stage's sound out to send the crowd into a cheering frenzy. That's where the Yorkville mixer and PA system come into play, to make sure the audience can feel every hit, goal and kill.

Tournaments- When we are up and running we will be holding tournaments every weekend for prizes and status. There will be singles, doubles and teams of four tournaments in the latest sports, fighter and FPS games. Tournaments give gamers a chance at prizes, status and also a chance to get a sponsorship. This is where a player can experience what it takes on the road  to become a champion.

The Lounge-This is a place where gamers can take a break from the intense world of competitive gaming to chill out and relax. Play classic arcade titles  from Donkey Kong to Pacman or grab a bud and a N64 and chill out with Mario Kart. Relax on our sofa's and refuel with some snacks and energy drinks.The only rules in the lounge are to relax and have fun.

Travel- When we are stable we will be taking the gaming experience to you. Traveling all across Canada and the United states. This will allow us to reach gamers all over the continent and take the North American Gaming League to new and exciting heights.

Regular day admittance levels-

(professionally signed MLG players have a free lifetime membership.)

Early Bird
·    Mon-Thurs 11am-6pm, Fri-Sat 10am-7pm
·    Individual or Team (up to 4 people)

Night Owl
·    Mon-Thurs 6pm-2am, Fri-Sat 7pm-4am
·    Individual or Team  (up to 4 people)

Hall Pass·    All Day/Night  pass

Backstage Pass
·    Weekly pass to center
·    Individual or Team (up to 4 people)
·    Free spectator for weekend tournament

All Access Pass
·    Monthly Pass to center
·    Free entry to tournament play for one month
·    Individual or Team  (up to 4 people)
·    Free spectator for all tournaments for the month

I Pretty Much Live Here Pass
·    3 months of Unlimited Individual or Team game play
·    Free entry to all tournaments for 3 months
·    Free spectator (+2) to all tournaments·    Free Lounge and Internet access

Tournament play admittance levels-

Spectator Badge
·    All day pass to spectate tournament play
·    Free sticker

V.I.P Badge
·    All weekend  pass to spectate tournament play
·    Free access to lounge
·    Free Sticker
·    Enter in draw to win a free T-shirt

Semi-Pro
·    Entry into Tournament play (up to 4 people)
·    Free access to lounge
·    Free Sticker
·    Enter in draw to win sweaters for team·    A chance to take home the a Championship title

The more we raise the more bad ass this thing will be :D

With your help we can take gaming to the next level.

story:
Give Us Cards!

Give Us Cards is a fun strategy game modeled after the dynamics of the open source community: have a patch duel with your opponents, gather karma, and climb the halls of fame! 

The game lets players experience why it's good to collaborate even with rivals: Since you are free to choose when you open source your projects, you can experiment with different collaboration strategies while having fun. 

Give Us Cards itself follows the Open Source Community’s philosophies of collaboration, reuse and free licenses. You can fork the game on GitHub, reuse our bootstrap deck to make a deck for your community, or extend the game with your own extension pack.

  • Who is this for?
  • Less garbage, more branding & Fun!
  • Donate cards, for free!
  • Get it started
  • Our goals
  • Perks for community backers
  • A perk for collectors
  • Perks for organizational backers
  • What's up with the voting?
  • What’s up with the zombies?
  • About us
  • Get involved
  • What we will do with the money
  • Other Ways You Can Help

Who is this for?

As an individual you should back this campaign if you want to:

  • Give companies in the tech community a renewable alternative to plastic junk give-aways.

  • Be part of the creation of a fun game that you can play with your family, friends and customers.

  • Start collecting unique cards that celebrate our communities.

Your organization should back this campaign if:

  • As a Community Manager you want a new fun way to reward your community members.

  • As a Marketeer you want merchandise that will keep on generating brand impressions throughout a long engaging life cycle.

  • As an HR manager you want an educational tool to explain to new hires why it’s good to work in/with the open source community.

The Game

The following is a preview that gives you an idea about the look and feel of the game in just over 1,5 min: 


Less garbage, more branding & Fun!

With this project we want to create a type of merchandise that is better for the environment. That can replace the plastic gimmicks that are trashed in truckloads at conferences around the world. To create something that can be scarce, unique and valuable while inexpensive, something produced from renewable resources. All our cards will be printed on certified FSC cardboard (a label for responsible forest management that is awarded by FSC, a global not-for-profit that defines best practices that address both social and environmental issues in forestry www.fsc.org).

Give Us Cards! is the blueprint for a collectible deck building card game, with cards you can collect when you participate in community events or when you contribute to certain campaigns. It is a fun geeky card game that you can play with your friends, family and customers.

With it we want to build a shared community playground in which organizations can creatively rival each other with over-the-top cards that celebrate their contributions to the community. At the same time, it makes our individual marketing efforts part of a much larger project that will build a shared marketing resource. A tool that is bigger than anything any individual company can do, that furthers the goals of our community as a whole.

Through collaboration our communities have built better software at lower costs, collaboratively we can make conference giveaways that generate greater longer lasting brand interactions for less money, that can be used to educate people about open source, its communities and the things we celebrate.

Donate cards, for free!

Open source projects wouldn't exist without all the amazing people that have given so much of themselves to make our communities happen. 

If you like what you see here, and you want to help us promote the game and at the same time say thank you to someone important in your community, take part in our pay it forward campaign. It’s free, all you need to do is to click on one of the below links and fill in the Twitter handle of someone you know that you would like to give a free card.

  • Nominate a community organizer for the #SocialMediaNinja card

Throughout our campaign We will announce 5 free cards that you can nominate your community heroes for. We’ve planned 100 cards for each of the free card campaigns. Back us, follow us or sign up for our newsletter to get a notification when we announce the next cards.

Use the appropriate hashtag to tell us who should get the reward. You can nominate as many people as you want, but you can only vote once for the same person. In case there are more people nominated than we have cards we will send cards to nominees in order of the number of people that have tweet-voted for them. A tie will be broken based on the date of a nominee's first tweet-vote. Tweet-voting for all 5 free card campaigns will close on the deadline of the crowdfunding campaign.

Important: As with all our other perks, also the social media perks will only be printed and distributed if we reach our minimum campaign target.

Get it started

To make this all possible we need your help:

We need enough individual contributions to convince even the more conservative organizations that there is a large number of people in the community that will get excited about a card game that replaces more traditional non-renewable merchandise; To prove that people want to collect unique cards about the projects they are involved in; That our game is appealing enough to invest in for an upcoming conference.

We also need an initial group of organizational backers who want to be pioneers with us and who want to help create a fun marketing resource for the wider open source community that lets people experience first hand why it makes more sense to collaborate with a community than to build in isolation.

This is an all or nothing campaign: if we don’t at least reach our basic funding target, we will publish what we already created but we won’t be able to continue working on this project. If the project can’t rally a minimal support from the community it won’t make sense to keep on investing in it.

Our goals

With this campaign we want to create the basic infrastructure we need to get Give Us Cards started:

  • Website to share cards
  • Rule set for the game
  • Initial card game of 55 cards
  • A first extension pack of 11 cards

Perks for community backers

To make it worth your while to become a backer, we’ve put together a series of perks you won’t be able to resist: check them out on the right.

A perk for collectors

For collectors who want to get their hands on a copy of all the different types of the world's first series, we've created the collector's perk that includes 2 copies of all the default card sets we will produce plus a number of unique cards you wouldn't be able to get anyhow else. This perk is the only way to get your hands on a copy of all five "pay it forward" cards, 2 campaign t-shirts and 2 copies of any custom extension packs our corporate backers don't mind us producing an extra copy off.

Perks for organizational backers

We've done everything to make Give Us Cards the perfect conference giveaway. Contact us to discuss what we can do for you, we are printing digitally, so we can produce batches of as little as

  • 100 times a single card
  • 100 extension packs of 11 cards in a see-through flow pack
  • 2000 custom decks

You can also become one of our pioneers with one of our perks on the right.

What's up with the voting?

You, our community decides what open source projects we will include in the Bootstrap deck. Anyone who backs us for at least 1 EUR will be able to cast their vote for their favorite projects.

What’s up with the zombies?

We are really excited about our partnership with Lucy A. Snyder, the author of “installing linux on a dead badger”, who is helping us with our Vüdü Linux extension pack. We became a fan of Lucy's Zombie IT Universe after we heard her story "Your Corporate Network and the Forces of Darkness" on EscapePod (you should definitely check it out, it's a free podcast). These are a few of the cards we created inspired by her work, that will be included in the Vüdü extension pack:


About us

Give Us Cards is in the first place an open source project, anyone who’s interested can join the project. Soon you will be able to download a printable bare bones play deck (nothing fancy just functional) to help us test play the rules of our game. We want to work together with you, our community, to make an open standard that anyone can use to create a deck, extension pack or even a single card, that will be compatible with our game. If you are interested we would very much appreciate any feedback that can help us improve the rules of the game, true open source style.

The Give Us Cards IndieGoGo campaign is run by Pronovix, a 20 people strong software consulting company based in Belgium and Hungary that’s an active contributor to the Drupal project. We are really passionate about the open source movement, and it’s community. That is why we want to further enrich the ecosystem with a collaborative marketing tool like the Give Us Cards project.

We previously did a successful IndieGoGo campaign for making better documentation tool for online software. We have fulfilled our campaign perk promises and the project looks like it is going to be a major success story, To find out more check out our campaign site at http://walkthrough.it.

Get involved

To get your hands on a test deck, or to give us feedback on the project join us at the Give Us Cards repository on GitHub.

We’ve done a lot of work on the artwork presented in this campaign. It is however very likely that some minor and maybe even so not so minor design elements will change based on further feedback we’ll get from you, our community.

We’ve also done a lot of work to make a game that is fun to play and that doesn’t require a training bootcamp before you can start playing. But the most exciting thing about doing this project as an open source project is that it can evolve and that people can contribute patches to the gameplay to avoid bugs you might encounter while playing.

What we will do with the money

Money we receive from this campaign will only be used to build and launch this game. Our ultimate dream would be if we can reach all our stretch goals so that we get a large enough budget to also build a digital open source Card Game for the Give Us Cards campaign.

By backing this project you will also help Vincent, a young artist, start his career. A few months ago Vincent was looking for a job in Szeged when he contacted us. His portfolio showed his amazing talent for cartoon drawings, that is why we decided to work with him on this project. This is a unique now-or-never opportunity to combine a long standing dream with his talent to get this project started.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute to our campaign for whatever reasons, there are a lot of other ways you can support the project:

  • Talk about our project to your friends and colleagues

  • Donate cards for free through the free cards campaign

  • Tweet, like or share our project

Thank you for reading this far! Now go tell your friends!
story_txt:
Give Us Cards!
Give Us Cards is a fun strategy game modeled after the dynamics of the open source community: have a patch duel with your opponents, gather karma, and climb the halls of fame! 
The game lets players experience why it's good to collaborate even with rivals: Since you are free to choose when you open source your projects, you can experiment with different collaboration strategies while having fun. 
Give Us Cards itself follows the Open Source Community’s philosophies of collaboration, reuse and free licenses. You can fork the game on GitHub, reuse our bootstrap deck to make a deck for your community, or extend the game with your own extension pack.

Who is this for?
Less garbage, more branding & Fun!
Donate cards, for free!
Get it started
Our goals
Perks for community backers
A perk for collectors
Perks for organizational backers
What's up with the voting?
What’s up with the zombies?
About us
Get involved
What we will do with the money
Other Ways You Can Help


Who is this for?
As an individual you should back this campaign if you want to:

Give companies in the tech community a renewable alternative to plastic junk give-aways.
Be part of the creation of a fun game that you can play with your family, friends and customers.
Start collecting unique cards that celebrate our communities.

Your organization should back this campaign if:

As a Community Manager you want a new fun way to reward your community members.
As a Marketeer you want merchandise that will keep on generating brand impressions throughout a long engaging life cycle.
As an HR manager you want an educational tool to explain to new hires why it’s good to work in/with the open source community.


The Game
The following is a preview that gives you an idea about the look and feel of the game in just over 1,5 min: 

Less garbage, more branding & Fun!
With this project we want to create a type of merchandise that is better for the environment. That can replace the plastic gimmicks that are trashed in truckloads at conferences around the world. To create something that can be scarce, unique and valuable while inexpensive, something produced from renewable resources. All our cards will be printed on certified FSC cardboard (a label for responsible forest management that is awarded by FSC, a global not-for-profit that defines best practices that address both social and environmental issues in forestry www.fsc.org).
Give Us Cards! is the blueprint for a collectible deck building card game, with cards you can collect when you participate in community events or when you contribute to certain campaigns. It is a fun geeky card game that you can play with your friends, family and customers.
With it we want to build a shared community playground in which organizations can creatively rival each other with over-the-top cards that celebrate their contributions to the community. At the same time, it makes our individual marketing efforts part of a much larger project that will build a shared marketing resource. A tool that is bigger than anything any individual company can do, that furthers the goals of our community as a whole.
Through collaboration our communities have built better software at lower costs, collaboratively we can make conference giveaways that generate greater longer lasting brand interactions for less money, that can be used to educate people about open source, its communities and the things we celebrate.

Donate cards, for free!

Open source projects wouldn't exist without all the amazing people that have given so much of themselves to make our communities happen. 
If you like what you see here, and you want to help us promote the game and at the same time say thank you to someone important in your community, take part in our pay it forward campaign. It’s free, all you need to do is to click on one of the below links and fill in the Twitter handle of someone you know that you would like to give a free card.
Nominate a community organizer for the #SocialMediaNinja card
Throughout our campaign We will announce 5 free cards that you can nominate your community heroes for. We’ve planned 100 cards for each of the free card campaigns. Back us, follow us or sign up for our newsletter to get a notification when we announce the next cards.
Use the appropriate hashtag to tell us who should get the reward. You can nominate as many people as you want, but you can only vote once for the same person. In case there are more people nominated than we have cards we will send cards to nominees in order of the number of people that have tweet-voted for them. A tie will be broken based on the date of a nominee's first tweet-vote. Tweet-voting for all 5 free card campaigns will close on the deadline of the crowdfunding campaign.
Important: As with all our other perks, also the social media perks will only be printed and distributed if we reach our minimum campaign target.

Get it started
To make this all possible we need your help: 
We need enough individual contributions to convince even the more conservative organizations that there is a large number of people in the community that will get excited about a card game that replaces more traditional non-renewable merchandise; To prove that people want to collect unique cards about the projects they are involved in; That our game is appealing enough to invest in for an upcoming conference.
We also need an initial group of organizational backers who want to be pioneers with us and who want to help create a fun marketing resource for the wider open source community that lets people experience first hand why it makes more sense to collaborate with a community than to build in isolation.
This is an all or nothing campaign: if we don’t at least reach our basic funding target, we will publish what we already created but we won’t be able to continue working on this project. If the project can’t rally a minimal support from the community it won’t make sense to keep on investing in it.

Our goals
With this campaign we want to create the basic infrastructure we need to get Give Us Cards started:


Website to share cards
Rule set for the game
Initial card game of 55 cards
A first extension pack of 11 cards



Perks for community backers
To make it worth your while to become a backer, we’ve put together a series of perks you won’t be able to resist: check them out on the right.

A perk for collectors
For collectors who want to get their hands on a copy of all the different types of the world's first series, we've created the collector's perk that includes 2 copies of all the default card sets we will produce plus a number of unique cards you wouldn't be able to get anyhow else. This perk is the only way to get your hands on a copy of all five "pay it forward" cards, 2 campaign t-shirts and 2 copies of any custom extension packs our corporate backers don't mind us producing an extra copy off.

Perks for organizational backers

We've done everything to make Give Us Cards the perfect conference giveaway. Contact us to discuss what we can do for you, we are printing digitally, so we can produce batches of as little as


100 times a single card
100 extension packs of 11 cards in a see-through flow pack
2000 custom decks



You can also become one of our pioneers with one of our perks on the right.

What's up with the voting?
You, our community decides what open source projects we will include in the Bootstrap deck. Anyone who backs us for at least 1 EUR will be able to cast their vote for their favorite projects.

What’s up with the zombies?
We are really excited about our partnership with Lucy A. Snyder, the author of “installing linux on a dead badger”, who is helping us with our Vüdü Linux extension pack. We became a fan of Lucy's Zombie IT Universe after we heard her story "Your Corporate Network and the Forces of Darkness" on EscapePod (you should definitely check it out, it's a free podcast). These are a few of the cards we created inspired by her work, that will be included in the Vüdü extension pack:





About us
Give Us Cards is in the first place an open source project, anyone who’s interested can join the project. Soon you will be able to download a printable bare bones play deck (nothing fancy just functional) to help us test play the rules of our game. We want to work together with you, our community, to make an open standard that anyone can use to create a deck, extension pack or even a single card, that will be compatible with our game. If you are interested we would very much appreciate any feedback that can help us improve the rules of the game, true open source style.
The Give Us Cards IndieGoGo campaign is run by Pronovix, a 20 people strong software consulting company based in Belgium and Hungary that’s an active contributor to the Drupal project. We are really passionate about the open source movement, and it’s community. That is why we want to further enrich the ecosystem with a collaborative marketing tool like the Give Us Cards project.
We previously did a successful IndieGoGo campaign for making better documentation tool for online software. We have fulfilled our campaign perk promises and the project looks like it is going to be a major success story, To find out more check out our campaign site at http://walkthrough.it.

Get involved

To get your hands on a test deck, or to give us feedback on the project join us at the Give Us Cards repository on GitHub.
We’ve done a lot of work on the artwork presented in this campaign. It is however very likely that some minor and maybe even so not so minor design elements will change based on further feedback we’ll get from you, our community. 
We’ve also done a lot of work to make a game that is fun to play and that doesn’t require a training bootcamp before you can start playing. But the most exciting thing about doing this project as an open source project is that it can evolve and that people can contribute patches to the gameplay to avoid bugs you might encounter while playing.

What we will do with the money
Money we receive from this campaign will only be used to build and launch this game. Our ultimate dream would be if we can reach all our stretch goals so that we get a large enough budget to also build a digital open source Card Game for the Give Us Cards campaign.
By backing this project you will also help Vincent, a young artist, start his career. A few months ago Vincent was looking for a job in Szeged when he contacted us. His portfolio showed his amazing talent for cartoon drawings, that is why we decided to work with him on this project. This is a unique now-or-never opportunity to combine a long standing dream with his talent to get this project started.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute to our campaign for whatever reasons, there are a lot of other ways you can support the project:

Talk about our project to your friends and colleagues
Donate cards for free through the free cards campaign
Tweet, like or share our project

Thank you for reading this far! Now go tell your friends!

story:
Здравствуйте МЕНЯ зовут Андрей. Инженер-конструктор - технолог

Воронежский государственный технический университет, "дизайн и технологии радио электронных средств".

Я занимаюсь развитием технологий виртуальных развлечений.

Введение новых возможностей для Киберспорт.

Проект для этой цели создали.

  Я хочу спросить вас!

  Вы любите играть в видео игры?



Вместе мы сможем сделать видео игры лучше и интереснее!

Для профессионалов и простых поклонников видеоигр.



Это будет лучше, легче играть и с новыми возможностями.

Простое подключение через гнездо USB.






Новый восприятие игры.


Средства, привлеченные для IndieGoGo необходимы для завершения проекта.

Чтобы представить проект на мир на выставку,

www.e3expo.com





Entertainment Software Association. в 2015 году.

У нас есть сегодня рабочий прототип манипулятора.

Today manipulator is better compared to all controls PC, PS, X-Box, Nintendo...

Там нет зависимости игрок правша или левша.



На поднятых фондов IndieGoGo мы заменим кнопки манипулятора и программного обеспечения.

Программное обеспечение для функции макроса на кнопку.

Мы будем покупать элементарную 3D-принтер.

Это позволит улучшить манипулятора тело.

Business Trip Organization the exhibition E3 2015.

Мы очень надеемся, что ваши возможности будут превышать наши ожидания.

Если это произойдет, мы организуем мелкосерийное производство манипулятора.

Стоимость одного манипулятора будет около 250 долларов.

Плюс доставка в вашу страну.

Вес изделия в упаковке приблизительно: 14 кг.

Упаковка объем примерно: 0,14 кубометра.

На нашем сайте можно будет заказать и оплатить MGM Мульти игрового манипулятора.

Поднятые фонды IndieGoGo пойдет на мировую защиты патентов.

Создание программного обеспечения для видео игр. Программное обеспечение поможет вашим видеоигры для поддержки аналогового управления.

Закупка оборудования для производства.

Комната, в аренду, чтобы начать производство.

Каждый доллар собраны IndieGoGo пойдут на ходе реализации проекта.

С вашей помощью видеоигры сделает эволюционный скачок.

Независимо от результата привлеченные средства, превышающие нашей цели в 17000 долларов будут направлены на подготовку производства.

Вопрос не в том, что будет производство MGM или нет. Ответ однозначно да! 

Вопрос в том, кто является становится первым поддержку нам производителей ПК или PS или X-Box или Nintendo?

Вы очень нам поможет, если вы рассказать своим друзьям о нашем проекте.

Я отвечу на все Ваши вопросы!

Спасибо за внимание!

Вопрос в том, кто является становится первым поддержку нам производителей ПК или PS или X-Box или Nintendo?Вы очень нам поможет, если вы рассказать своим друзьям о нашем проекте.

story:
Richard Jean:  Graphic designer for 20 years.

10 years ago i invent a new type of cards to make House of Cards.

Freelance designer for long time I had the idea to make an illustrate game of construction cards for my 3 son's.

My first product was the Medieval Castle.  I had a good success with it and over the years I done a dozen of different thematics. 

Every year in a trade show in Montreal I receive demand for the Blue Castle but it is sold out for a long time. 

Of course the first batch are actually very rare. In 2003 it was a 150 cards box.

The 10th anniversary of the Deknik company it is the good time for me to make the Blue Castle reprint. This collection box will be my best product ever. I also will design new cards to complete the 100 extra cards.

The fund will cover the cost of the design of 250 cards layout, papers, pre-press material, press time for cards and box, die-cut of the cards, Shipping cost.

The objective is to have a special design product. An exclusive one time production box. This package will not be available again. 

The price in store of the 2003 game was $29.99 for 150 cards. This collection box of 250 will be at the aproximative same price $30.00. The shipping cost from Montreal to you is between 15$ and 25$ (more for certain location). To be fair to every supporter I add a fix 20$ shipping. 

I will print some extra product (10%) for donation to a children fundation in Montreal. The fondationdrjulien.org. 

I hope you join my enthusiasm to make this offer a success. I know you will have good time with your family. 

Thank You for your support,

Richard Jean

story:
Bringing the Gaming Community Together in One Place

The tabletop roleplaying game, or RPG, community consists of a massive group of dedicated people who are extremely passionate about their hobby. Yet this community consists of small camps of people supporting one game system or another spread across a variety of forum boards, websites, online stores, and social media sites.

This can cause confusion for people entering the hobby, press releases and new information to slip through unnoticed by some, and up and coming games to go unnoticed. We intend to change all of that.

Imagine a website that's primary purpose was tabletop roleplaying games. A singular location containing everything you needed to know, not just about a single gaming system, but every system available. A website with an active forum board discussing the RPG hobby, an online Auction House where gamers can sell to other gamers directly, links to videos with tips and suggestions on how to run better roleplaying games, reviews on upcoming products by gamers for gamers, and an online store to purchase more roleplaying games products. Everything you need in one place, stored away and guarded over for gamers by gamers.

Welcome to the Dragon's Hoard!

The Hoard

Our current goal for the Hoard is $25,000. This will allow for the set up and licensing of our website, authinticating and copyrighting our logo, the launch of the in site Auction House and Store, and initial distribution costs of our perks to you the contributors. Speaking of perks let us take a closer look at the perks we offer.

Counting Coppers-An affectionate name for our $1 perk will place your name forever on our website as well as having our eternal thanks for supporting this project & special dragons hoard poster.

Visage of the Dragon-At this level you will be recieving a custom t-shirt with the official Dragon's Hoard logo (A silver dragon standing over a pile of gold and tabletop roleplaying games) created by our Lead Artist Tony Dixon.

Bronze Dragon Membership-At this level you receive a years membership to the Dragon's Hoard online store.Which entitles you to 10% of your first years purchases.

Silver Dragon Membership- At this level you receive a life time membership to the Dragon's Hoard. Additionally this entitles you to 15% every purchase and you will never need to re-new your membership.

Gold Dragon Membership- At this level you receive a life time membership to the Dragon's Hoard. Additionally this entitles you to 20% every purchase and you will never need to re-new your membership.

The Chronicler- This limited perk will allow to become a permanent resident reviewer of all things gaming.Your reviews will be attached to products for sale on the Dragon's Hoard website.You will either keep the products you review or receive credit to spend at the shop.You will receive one product every two week's.

Sean's Vault of Secrets DVD-At this level Sean Connors our Project Leader, known as theOutsiders68 on Youtube, will produce a series of 10 DM Tips videos just for you that will contain some of his best tips and smoke and mirrors strategies to help bring your gaming experiences to the next level. Additionally you will receive a signed copy of Sean's Youtube famous dungeon crawl the Tomb of Curses, being published by Brave Halfling Publishing later this year.

A Game of Legends-At this our highest perk Sean Connors himself, or one of the Dragon's Hoard Project Team, will run a game for you and five friends on any system you like anywhere in the world. You provide the food and drinks and we provide the game.

Until we meet our goal of $25,000 all contributor donations will be treated as a pledge, and no money will be collected unless the project reaches its goal. In the event that we are unable to reach our goal in the alloted time the project will end and we will take it as a learning experience and come back at a later date to give it another go. We feel that the Dragon's Hoard is the perfect next step for the tabletop roleplaying games community and will return at a later date to give the project another go.

The Impact

The roleplaying community sits at a crossroads, on one hand sits a fragmented kingdom where small groups don't talk to one another and remain insular and talk only amongst themselves, calling out that their game or their edition is the best and will hear no arguement. On the other road sits a singular community gathered together to share their ideas and work together to better themselves and others within the RPG hobby, where each person's voice is heard and opinions matter. This is the goal of the Dragon's Hoard.

Here at the Hoard we see the fragmentation, where it is system vs. system and edition vs. edition, of the RPG industry and community as a step backwards. Tabletop RPGs have always been about community and shared experiences, the gathering around the table on Friday nights with friends, dice, and paper to set out on grand adventures together. It is this sense of community that we want to bring back to the community with the Dragon's Hoard project. A one stop spot for gamers to come together to discuss ideas for games, provide links to videos where people can get advice on gaming, provide a platform for gaming entrepreneurs to show off their creations and receive feedback directly from the community that would be purchasing their product, and reunite the gaming community under a single banner to continue the betterment of this hobby.  

If you agree with this idea and wish to share in our vision please consider donating to the Dragon's Hoard, no matter the amount you are able to donate every little bit will help us achieve our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now, but still want to see the Dragon's Hoard succeed? Then please tell your friends about the project, jump onto your favorite RPG forum board, social media site, or head down to your local gaming store and send them our way. The Dragon is always looking for more treasure to add to its Hoard.

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign and for your support in the Dragon's Hoard project. If you have any questions please leave a comment below and remember that even if you are unable to contribute monetarily spread the word to your friends the social grapevine is the fastest way to spread information to the community.

Counting Coppers-An affectionate name for our $1 perk will place your name forever on our website as well as having our eternal thanks for supporting this project & special dragons hoard poster.
Visage of the Dragon-At this level you will be recieving a custom t-shirt with the official Dragon's Hoard logo (A silver dragon standing over a pile of gold and tabletop roleplaying games) created by our Lead Artist Tony Dixon.
Bronze Dragon Membership-At this level you receive a years membership to the Dragon's Hoard online store.Which entitles you to 10% of your first years purchases.
Silver Dragon Membership- At this level you receive a life time membership to the Dragon's Hoard. Additionally this entitles you to 15% every purchase and you will never need to re-new your membership.
Gold Dragon Membership- At this level you receive a life time membership to the Dragon's Hoard. Additionally this entitles you to 20% every purchase and you will never need to re-new your membership.
The Chronicler- This limited perk will allow to become a permanent resident reviewer of all things gaming.Your reviews will be attached to products for sale on the Dragon's Hoard website.You will either keep the products you review or receive credit to spend at the shop.You will receive one product every two week's.
Sean's Vault of Secrets DVD-At this level Sean Connors our Project Leader, known as theOutsiders68 on Youtube, will produce a series of 10 DM Tips videos just for you that will contain some of his best tips and smoke and mirrors strategies to help bring your gaming experiences to the next level. Additionally you will receive a signed copy of Sean's Youtube famous dungeon crawl the Tomb of Curses, being published by Brave Halfling Publishing later this year.
A Game of Legends-At this our highest perk Sean Connors himself, or one of the Dragon's Hoard Project Team, will run a game for you and five friends on any system you like anywhere in the world. You provide the food and drinks and we provide the game.
Until we meet our goal of $25,000 all contributor donations will be treated as a pledge, and no money will be collected unless the project reaches its goal. In the event that we are unable to reach our goal in the alloted time the project will end and we will take it as a learning experience and come back at a later date to give it another go. We feel that the Dragon's Hoard is the perfect next step for the tabletop roleplaying games community and will return at a later date to give the project another go.
The Impact
The roleplaying community sits at a crossroads, on one hand sits a fragmented kingdom where small groups don't talk to one another and remain insular and talk only amongst themselves, calling out that their game or their edition is the best and will hear no arguement. On the other road sits a singular community gathered together to share their ideas and work together to better themselves and others within the RPG hobby, where each person's voice is heard and opinions matter. This is the goal of the Dragon's Hoard.
Here at the Hoard we see the fragmentation, where it is system vs. system and edition vs. edition, of the RPG industry and community as a step backwards. Tabletop RPGs have always been about community and shared experiences, the gathering around the table on Friday nights with friends, dice, and paper to set out on grand adventures together. It is this sense of community that we want to bring back to the community with the Dragon's Hoard project. A one stop spot for gamers to come together to discuss ideas for games, provide links to videos where people can get advice on gaming, provide a platform for gaming entrepreneurs to show off their creations and receive feedback directly from the community that would be purchasing their product, and reunite the gaming community under a single banner to continue the betterment of this hobby.  
If you agree with this idea and wish to share in our vision please consider donating to the Dragon's Hoard, no matter the amount you are able to donate every little bit will help us achieve our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute right now, but still want to see the Dragon's Hoard succeed? Then please tell your friends about the project, jump onto your favorite RPG forum board, social media site, or head down to your local gaming store and send them our way. The Dragon is always looking for more treasure to add to its Hoard.
Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign and for your support in the Dragon's Hoard project. If you have any questions please leave a comment below and remember that even if you are unable to contribute monetarily spread the word to your friends the social grapevine is the fastest way to spread information to the community.

story:
Calculate, guess, estimate or do whatever you want.. But do it fast!” A brand new game from Acabo Games that challenges you to make smart estimations

The Game 

Questions are read out loud and all players have 90 seconds to draw, calculate and work those brain cells to be the one closest to the correct answer. Each player give their answer in turn by placing a marker on the game board. The players will then receive points based on how close they are to the correct answer. 

The Question Cards 

The questions come in three categories: Market, Technology and Mind Twister. Each question has a numerical answer which is given on the back of the question card.  

Why Become a Guesstimaster? 

Guesstimaster is both great fun to play and an excellent intellectual training tool. Play to:

  • Become faster at estimating numbers 

  • Blast the neural choke points

  • Improve your ability to solve problems  

  • Increase your general knowledge

  • Prepare yourself for a case interview at the workplace of your dreams

The Name of the Game

A ”guesstimate” is an educated guess at a figure first perceived as almost impossible to calculate. A person who wins a competition by being the best at performing guesstimates will be the master. Therefore the game is named: Guesstimaster

The Board

The board displays a logarithmic number spiral, going from 1 to 10 000 000 000 000 000 000. It might sound a bit complicated for a board game but it really makes game play quick and easy.

Each player submits their answer by placing a marker along the spiral. The player who puts the marker closest (in actual distance on the game board) to the correct answer will get the most points.

 Action Cards

Action Cards are included to increase the gaming experience. An Action Card is distributed to the player who is furthest away from correct answer, making the game thrilling and unsettled until the very last question..  

 

 

The Creators

Acabo Games is an entrepreneurial firm situated in Uppsala, Sweden. The firm is driven by a group of board game crazy academics. Eight people have been closely involved in this project and many other have contributed to finalize the game. Our goal is to create entertaining games where you have the chance to try and develop your academic skills. Acabo Games has previously released "The Art of Science"  http://theartofscience.se/, which is a challenging trivia game in natural sciences and technology. 

Perks

Please check out the perks on the right side of the page. There is both a german and a english version of the game. The game will be ready well in time for Christmas. Why not support us and get a great Christmas gift to your friends?

SPREAD THE WORD

Please share this link with everybody and don't forget to check out our website at www.academicboardgames.com

Play your way to knowledge!

----------------------------------------------------

PRODUCT DETAILS

  • Time to play: 30 min
  • Number of Players: 2-4 players or teams
  • Recommended age: 18 years or older 
  • Number of questions: 600
  • Product Dimensions: 26 x 26 x 6 cm
  • Weight: 1.3 kg
  • Version: Upgraded 2nd International
  • Game type: Strategic Quiz game

Rule leaflet can be downloaded at:

http://d2oadd98wnjs7n.cloudfront.net/medias/479...

story:
Also Find This Campaign On:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • YouTube
  • Crash Course DHS

 Using Technology to Save Lives

How does anyone gain the experience to react correctly when lives are on the line?  Pilots need to.  Firefighters, Police, EMTs, astronauts and surgeons all need to.

They do it with simulators. Simulators prepare you for critical and unexpected dangers. If you’re going to have a deadly accident, do it in a simulator and learn how to avoid it in real life!  We’re graphic designers and programmers and avid gamers led by a former insurance investigator who has seen firsthand the horrific results of traffic accidents. We asked ourselves, why can’t we bring this same kind of training to the young driving population? If simulations can train emergency responders to react correctly under duress, why can’t we do the same thing and help reduce the thousands of deaths and serious injuries that happen every year to our young drivers? So we merged our graphics, programming and gaming skills to create a truly unique simulator that gives inexperienced drivers that second chance.

We're programming a unique Artificial Intelligence engine that makes Crash Course DHS a totally different experience each time you use it.

Our Crash Course Driving Hazard Simulator doesn't teach you to drive - it teaches you to survive. 

With your backing, we can all make a difference.  Saving even one life with this advanced training system makes it all worthwhile!

Let's fight the leading cause of teen death

 Making a game, even a serious game like Crash Course Driving Hazard Simulator, is incredibly expensive.  To get this finished, we need your help.

We're hoping to raise $300,000 to expand our small staff .  We need to add additional game programmers and artists in addition to funding the game licenses, development software and logistics support for the additional staff so we can produce a PC version of Crash Course DHS.

Any additional contributions will help fund versions for additional platforms - even additional languages!   Teen driving tragedies are universal so we have international editions on the drawing board for both right and left-hand drive countries.  Once the Crash Course DHS core programming is done, we can begin the artwork and translations for individual country editions .  We also have a networked  version planned so young drivers can drive together in the same virtual world.

Imagine the learning opportunities where a driver can assume different roles - road rager, drunken driver - and endanger other drivers! 

We've come up with some exciting perks that let you actively participate (besides contributing) and also let the world know you care.

When you contribute $40 or more, you receive an electronic copy of the final Crash Course DHS program. For a $65 contribution, you receive the electronic version plus a packaged DVD. Why not multiply your contribution by giving the DVD as a gift and keeping and using the other? Can you imagine how you'll feel if they avoid even a minor fender bender as a result of your generosity?

Our exclusive backer T shirts proudly proclaim your help and support on both the back and front.  Our shirts are high quality, yellow with black lettering and images.  

The Deluxe and Collector's editions, with the steering wheel/ pedals and Track-IR (Deluxe edition) rig make phenomenal gifts! 

Adding a steering wheel to an already immersive virtual world takes the immersiveness up a really big notch.

With the Collectors Edition, you'll receive an easy to set up steering wheel, brake and gas pedals.  Really take control with this rig.  Add to this our thanks and acknowledgement as a "Benefactor" on our Credits web page. The Collector's Edition also includes everything from the prior perks levels too.

For the ultimate experience, TrackIR can't be beat!  Available with the Deluxe Edition, this cool tool maps your head movement to the virtual world so when you look at a rearview mirror on screen, for example, your head moves the same way in the game. Glance down at your speedometer (in the real world) and you look down in the game. Look at a cell phone screen and you take your eyes off the road! It's impossible to effectively describe in words and really must be experienced! Both the steering wheel and TrackIR are compatible with a wide range of games from Flight Sims to FPS games.  This perk level earns you "Advocate" status  and you'll be acknowledged for your help and caring on our website's credits and kudos page.  You'll also receive everything from the Collector's package as well.

Select our "Get in the Game!" perk and take a stroll through our world as a pedestrian - we'll need a good picture of you to model.  You'll look good but no guarantees on what you'll be doing!  The Artificial Intelligence engine we're programming will determine that!  Includes the Deluxe Edition and perks 1-4.

The same for driving.  Selecting the "Why walk  when you can drive?" level beats going to a car dealer any day!  As a driver in an AI controlled vehicle, you may be conscientious and obey all the rules of the road. Or maybe not. Maybe you'll lose your temper and exhibit road rage, maybe you'll be in a hurry and speed (you could even get a ticket from a virtual police officer who may even be you! Tickets are payable, of course, in virtual dollars).  As with pedestrians, the AI determines your behavior!  The AI will also decide which vehicle you'll drive - one day it may be a vintage Mustang Fastback, the next a dump truck.  Includes the Deluxe Edition and perks 1-4. 

We're programming an ever changing environment so that every time someone uses Crash Course DHS, its a new experience.

The real world is unpredictable and so is ours! 

Our "I can see my house!" perk lets proud homeowners showcase their homes and if you drive by your own home, you may catch a glimpse of yourself cutting the grass or taking out the garbage because we'll model both you and your home.  As you've probably figured by now, what you'll be doing around the house is determined by the AI engine.  Drive by once, you may be painting the house.  Drive by another time, you may be snoozing in a hammock! 

Business owners show your customers you really care with our "Show off your business!" perk.  If you have a stand-alone building, we'll model it for you.  Not stand-alone?  We will do billboards, building face signs etc. to highlight your business. You earn a "Guardian Angel" title on our website's Contributor's credits page and a big thank you and acknowledgement on our FB page.

In addition to the opportunity to showcase your business to a huge potential market, we also include the Deluxe Edition and perks 1-4!  

A Personal Note from our Project Director

Crash Course DHS is more than a great idea and important project to me.  It’s a mission.  It completes a circle started many years ago.

As an Insurance Investigator early in my career, I responded to accident sites immediately when it was my turn to be the “on-call” investigator.  Our job was to lend emotional, financial and legal support to the drivers of large commercial clients.  As you can imagine, any accident involving large commercial vehicles is devastating and usually meant fatalities in the other vehicles.  What you can’t and shouldn’t imagine is the absolute horror found at these accident sites. Even these many years later, the images are still vivid. 

I was finished after seeing the result of a car driving in excess of 70 mph running off the road and hitting a wall head-on. The driver had misjudged distance when passing a truck at high speed.  Four people not much younger than me, were in that car.  An overwhelming accident scene, a shattered but physically uninjured truck driver, grim faced police officers and EMTs – but mostly the rage and utter futility at what could have been avoided - ended my career.  That was the true beginning of what we are calling Crash Course Driving Hazard Simulator.

Fast forward many years to when a disability, combined with an obsession, produced a creative solution to the very real problem of teen driving deaths and injuries.

 My son, Jonathon suffers from Asperger’s Syndrome and also loves auto racing video games.  Very early in the process of learning to drive, he demonstrated uncanny ability to handle a variety of unexpected hazards.  When I asked how he managed to recover from an uncontrolled skid on a patch of icy road before being taught, he replied, “I do that all the time!”  What he meant, of course, was he skids a lot in racing games.  He also scored 100% on his road test the first time out.

While arranging insurance for Jonathon, I related this story to the agent.  The agent remarked half kiddingly, “Every kid should be forced to play those games!”  When I told that to Jonathon, I saw a light bulb go off above his head – he suffers from ASD but he’s not inscrutable!  His idea: “Dad, you’re a programmer, we should do a game where you can learn to handle dangerous stuff like that!”  The kernel of Crash Course Driving Hazard Simulator was born.

Things had truly come full circle.  It took decades and the unique thought processes of an ASD sufferer but I could finally address that futility I felt so many years ago.

We need to get this done.

Even if you can't contribute...

There's lots you can do even if you can't contribute.  Please help us get the word out. 

Mobilize your social networks, spread the word anyway you can

  • like us on Facebook,
  • follow us on Twitter
  • subscribe to our channel:  Crash Course DHS   on Youtube
  • use indiegogo's share tools,
  • share everything with your family, your friends, coworkers or classmates,
  • pass along this link, a parent's worst nightmare: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ub5bV51zhE . 

The more noise we make, the closer we will be to getting this training to our teens and young adults.

story:
PAZL

 

Hi!, my name is Sebastián García, I'm a 14 years old programmer and designer, today, I'm going to introduce you to my first IndieGoGo campaign.

Were All Started

I've always been a very big fan of science and technology, but, specifically, in computers.

When I started to get curiosity for game development, it was at my 9 years old, when I started to investigate about the gamedev, then, I started to learn how software works, "you need to write some weird stuff in a computer with a black window and green text", I started to get an idea of how does it works. When I have 12 years old, I found an app for iPad called Hopscotch", that is some kind of a Facebook with scratch, you can create your games with simplified code and share it to people. Also, I installed an app made by Apple, called "Swift Playgrounds" that learns you real code writing.

At the first days of 2018, I got my dream come true, a computer! That is my father's computer because we don't have money to buy one, as you can expect, it's specs are really bad, but enough to coding, so, I started to create Windows Forms apps, and then, I started a real Xamarin.Forms oriented object programming, and I wanted to do some games so, I took a really good prototype of a hopscotch game that never saw the light, and turn it into PAZL, with obvious improvements and fixes.

As you can see, I've evolved more trough all the time, but It would be so long to write all!.

Info

What is PAZL?

PAZL Is a new online mobile videogame, it's about minigame matchs.

Online 1 vs 1 mode

In the online match mode, you play with a random player in the world, who finishes first 10 minigames and faster than the time limit, wins the match.

Single player mode

If you are outside of your house, you can play the offline single player mode, You vs the time limit. If you finish 10 minigames faster than 180 seconds, you win the match.

Why 1400 USD?

I will buy the following stuff:

  • iMac 21.5" (México Price $1319)
  • Apple Developer License ($99)
  • Android Developer License ($25)
  • Microsoft Developer License ($19)

IndieGoGo gets 5% of the IndieGogo money goal, so that's why.

Here you have some reference links to see the prices:

  • iMac (https://www.apple.com/mx/shop/buy-mac/imac/21.5-pulgadas-2.3-ghz-1tb#)

 

  • Apple Developer License (https://developer.apple.com/support/purchase-activation/)

 

  • Android Developer License ( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14070239/what-are-the-fees-to-develop-on-ios-android-and-wp)

 

  • Microsoft Developer License ( https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/store/register)

Why an iMac 21.5"?

This is the cheapest iMac, I choose this because I want to not grow the campaign's price.

If my campaign succeds and it gets money even when the campaign has reached it's goal, this money will be used to get a better iMac.

Also, if you don´t know, to publish an iOS app, you need an iMac, so that's why.

Thanks.
story_txt:
PAZL Hi!, my name is Sebastián García, I'm a 14 years old programmer and designer, today, I'm going to introduce you to my first IndieGoGo campaign.Were All StartedI've always been a very big fan of science and technology, but, specifically, in computers.When I started to get curiosity for game development, it was at my 9 years old, when I started to investigate about the gamedev, then, I started to learn how software works, "you need to write some weird stuff in a computer with a black window and green text", I started to get an idea of how does it works. When I have 12 years old, I found an app for iPad called Hopscotch", that is some kind of a Facebook with scratch, you can create your games with simplified code and share it to people. Also, I installed an app made by Apple, called "Swift Playgrounds" that learns you real code writing.At the first days of 2018, I got my dream come true, a computer! That is my father's computer because we don't have money to buy one, as you can expect, it's specs are really bad, but enough to coding, so, I started to create Windows Forms apps, and then, I started a real Xamarin.Forms oriented object programming, and I wanted to do some games so, I took a really good prototype of a hopscotch game that never saw the light, and turn it into PAZL, with obvious improvements and fixes.As you can see, I've evolved more trough all the time, but It would be so long to write all!.InfoWhat is PAZL?PAZL Is a new online mobile videogame, it's about minigame matchs.Online 1 vs 1 modeIn the online match mode, you play with a random player in the world, who finishes first 10 minigames and faster than the time limit, wins the match.Single player modeIf you are outside of your house, you can play the offline single player mode, You vs the time limit. If you finish 10 minigames faster than 180 seconds, you win the match.Why 1400 USD?I will buy the following stuff:
iMac 21.5" (México Price $1319)
Apple Developer License ($99)
Android Developer License ($25)
Microsoft Developer License ($19)
IndieGoGo gets 5% of the IndieGogo money goal, so that's why.Here you have some reference links to see the prices:iMac (https://www.apple.com/mx/shop/buy-mac/imac/21.5-pulgadas-2.3-ghz-1tb#) Apple Developer License (https://developer.apple.com/support/purchase-activation/) Android Developer License ( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14070239/what-are-the-fees-to-develop-on-ios-android-and-wp) Microsoft Developer License ( https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/store/register)Why an iMac 21.5"?This is the cheapest iMac, I choose this because I want to not grow the campaign's price.If my campaign succeds and it gets money even when the campaign has reached it's goal, this money will be used to get a better iMac.Also, if you don´t know, to publish an iOS app, you need an iMac, so that's why.Thanks.

story:
Have you ever felt proud for some of your hardest achievements in video-games?
You spend hours developing tactics and training your precision, failed and tried again hundreds of times, became lightning-fast and with a bit of luck you make it – you unlock the achievement! Enter a small pixelated picture, all you get for your hard work and effort. I’ve always wanted the achievement to be tangible, something you can put on the shelf to be proud of yourself. You deserve real awards for your in-game achievements!

 


You can get a medal for each Platinum Trophy on PlayStation or 1000G on Xbox. The website is fully integrated with these systems and tracks your progress in real time to let you get the award you really deserve.

 


It’s silver-colored medal 4 cm wide 40x3 mm. The upper part contains the game title, the lower part contains your PS or Xbox nickname. The center of the medal is decorated with an image, an in-game object, symbol or anything else that reflects the spirit of the game. The rest of the surface is black allowing for greater contrast of the silvery part. The medal has a its own number stored in our database, which makes it unique and personalized.

 

- Marketing and advertising.
- Development of models for thousands of games (not only the fresh or popular ones).
- Creation of a web platform integrated with PS and Xbox databases where you can monitor your achievement progress, order awards, track your order and vote on new designs.
- Our own high-quality production, not some cheap souvenirs. We need great industrial capacities to give awards to all players.
- 10% of income will be donated to charities.

 


Our prizes are free! Have you ever seen winners paying for their awards? Each user can receive one free medal in 60 days (just enough time to study the game thoroughly).

 


Spread the word about us to your friends who like to play videogames, share information on your social page. The more we are, the more awards you can choose from.

 


Production costs are covered by income from advertising on our website, payments for waiting time reduction and contracts with game publishers.

 


Only Beckers can vote for the final award design and for the next game to get its award system.

 

We plan to launch the project in Fall 2018. Beta website and first medals will be available earlier this year.

 

Our mission is to reward all gamers. We have many challenges ahead: creating and promoting the web portal, establishing a production chain, making copyright agreements, etc. Most likely, not every game publisher will agree immediately to have the game’s logos and names used in medals but we will do our best to reward all players for each and every game.

story:
About the game:
Game of Cthulhu is a 2D RPG, with the open world and hundreds of quests, as well as the plot, and side. 2 parties: Humanities and Technicians. You choose for whom you play, but the plot moves independently of you, you are the observer of the plot, but you take a key role in this world.
Plot:
The plot is twisted on the first war between the two parties in 15th century.The world is full of magic and magical creatures, but the war is only between people who have chosen either magic or technology. Technology against Magic, and whom do you choose?
