story:
Somewhere in the world, hidden, sealed, awaits The gate.
The few that know of its existence learned about it only because of its legend.
It is said that it exists from the beginning of time, the planet slowly forming around it, never missing its eternal duty.

Every fifty thousand turns around the sun its seal is lifted, the latches drop, and for a brief moment, any witness lucky enough will be able to cross its threshold.

Beyond The gate are hopes. Wishes. Dreams.
All the possibilities.
All the paths.
Beyond the gate awaits unlimited power...
And it’s about to open.



After the Age of Discovery ended and the efforts of the scientific community were focused on documenting the artifacts and places of a lost past, a tiny fraction of archaeologists were carrying their studies in a very different way: disregarding recorded history and focusing instead in their individual discoveries. They carried their activities with unconventional methods (and a certain lack of common sense) on their way to find some intrinsic meaning, to look where nobody would ever think of looking before, in the hope of discovering unknown parts of history, or, more importantly, correcting what was previously known.
Shunned by their peers (and for good reason), most of them followed red herrings through all their lives, never accomplishing anything significant. 


However, for one particular small group things were quite different.
On a long forgotten altar from an otherwise unremarkable ancient civilization, they happened to find a technology far beyond their comprehension.

With the goals of studying it and keeping it out of public knowledge, the organization SAGA was founded, and they dedicated their lives to it.

Today, several decades later, the artifact's origins and inner workings remain mostly unknown. But they do have a guess about its purpose.
And they want to test it.

You follow Arae who, victim of her own greed, became their unwilling test subject. She is tasked with traveling through different worlds, unraveling the mysteries behind their existence, for science, and trying to regain freedom, for herself.


  • The world of Fa'el – Beyond The Gate – consists of a series of interconnected dimensions, each with their own particularities and challenges.  Arae can travel back and forth between them, acquiring new abilities that will help her advance and understand their history. (Or as many would call it, a metroidvania)
    Exploring every corner will be necessary for the most intrepid players to unlock all the secrets that lie within!

  • Arae can also gain access to her Inner World, a metaphysical place that represents her growth, where the flow of time is so drastically different that the outside world appears to be completely frozen.
    As her powers grow more rooms and characters will appear within it, giving new insight on the world, access special events and, more importantly, new abilities to help her survive.
    It's possible to enter at any time and place so she can, for instance, warp to the Inner World to cover herself with an energy shield and return to deflect a devastating hit just at the right moment!

  • There are many bosses in Fa'el to surprise and engage you with different custom special and awesome techniques. Big, small, weird... as soon as you beat one you won’t be able to stop until you  see what the next has to offer!



  • While keeping the amount of mandatory reading to a minimum, we encourage you to have long talks with the NPCs if you want to, learn more about the lore, the events that took place, the artifacts, and the characters themselves. Still, they remain optional to the gameplay.
    Although, talking with many characters will help you  find and complete more secret quests!

The estimated release date for the game is June 2015.

It will be available for Linux, Windows and OS X.

The initial release will be in English, with Spanish and Japanese translations to follow.

(All the art and game footage featured is not final and subject to improvement with the addition of an artist to the project)



The music of Fa'el is the work of renowned video game composer Yamajet, known worldwide mainly for his work in music games such as O2Jam, Audition and Cytus. His instantly distinguishable style blending Eurobeat, Disco, Chiptune and Classical Piano gives a unique musical identity to the game!
 
You can listen to some of his works on his personal web page: http://www.yamajet.com/

For this game to become the reality we envision, full‐time work on it is needed.

The main bulk of the funding target comprises my living expenses so I can survive and fully focus on the game until it's complete.
Up to this point, I have been working on the game mostly by myself. But to make it truly shine I’ll also need to hire people to work on cool pixel art, animations and music.

The rest of the funds are for perks and payment processing fees.


  • Digital copy of the game
    Standalone DRM‐free digital copy of the game for all the supported systems (Linux, Windows and OS X), plus redeemable keys for all digital distribution platforms the game gets released on, at launch and in the future.

  • Digital copy of the OST
    A digital download of the game’s OST by Yamajet, in lossless audio format, including artwork.
    If the Side-B stretch goal is reached, all the extra tracks will be included!

  • "Fa'el - Beyond The Edge -" Beta access
    A digital download of the "Beyond The Edge" Game Boy ROM (See below for more info) at the beta phase of production, before public release.
    Your name will also be listed in the ROM’s credits as a beta tester.

  • SAGA mug


    Drink your beverage of choice like an overworked but dithyrambic member of SAGA with this 320 ml (11 oz) white glazed ceramic mug!

  • Red-Cyan Anaglyph 3D T-Shirt
          


    A T‐Shirt featuring anaglyph 3D artwork that looks great on its own and reveals the outstanding depth dimension on your chest to anybody brave enough to look at it with a pair of red‐cyan glasses!
    Available in XS, S, M, L, XL and 2XL

  • 3D-printed hand-painted Figure
    A 10cm (~3.9'') tall hand-painted figure of one of the models of the game. You will be able to choose between several characters and enemies.

  • "Fa'el - Beyond The Edge -" boxed Game Boy cartridge
    A custom 3D‐printed physical cartridge with the tie‐in game "Fa'el - Beyond The Edge" for Game Boy systems, complete with cardboard box and manual!
    Production of these cartridges will be limited to 20 units, each labeled with a unique serial number!
    Additionally, you will be listed as an owner of these unique pieces in both the credits and the manual of the game!

  • Fa'el‐themed custom Game Boy console with Special Edition "Fa'el - Beyond The Edge" Game Boy cartridge
    A Fa'el‐themed custom‐painted Game Boy console with a Special Edition of the "Fa'el - Beyond The Edge" Game Boy cartridge. Only one of these will be ever made!
    This version comes in a golden cartridge, with a signed box, and contains a unique build of the game featuring alternative title screen artwork with your name on it!
    You will be listed as the owner of this unique Special Edition in the credits and manuals of all the Game Boy games!

All items ship worldwide at no additional cost.

Fa'el - Beyond The Edge is a small tie‐in game being developed for the original Game Boy system.
The events of "Beyond The Edge" take place in the same universe and time as Fa'el - Beyond The Gate.
As they progress through the game, players will be able to affect the main story by using passwords provided in "Beyond The Edge" to transfer special items to "Beyond The Gate".
While playing "Beyond The Edge" won’t be necessary to enjoy the main story, the deepest secrets of the Fa'el universe will be revealed only to those that complete them both!


The Game Boy ROM file for the game will be released free for everyone with the launch of Fa'el - Beyond The Gate.
 
Additionally, a super exclusive real Game Boy cartridge, complete with packaging and manual, will be available to backers of this campaign! These are a limited run, and will be something worth having in any collection, so be sure to get one before they run out!


We believe that one of the most important things for a game like this to be truly awesome is to have quality content all along, and avoid filler segments at all cost. With that in mind, the graphical style chosen along with the custom engine that drives it, enables us to create quickly and nearly effortlessly content with a definitely unique look. (You can get some more info about the engine in this devlog post: http://www.fa-el.com/devlog/20140112204751.html )

As with any software project, there are unpredictable factors that can be anticipated but not exactly predicted. That being said, we are confident that with our small tight team, there won't be much interference for delivering the product we want to make on time.

story:
Daddy or mommy

Bring your baby into the world and bring him up like a real child. Breastfeed him, follow him in his first step and watch him growing up.

 

  Love

He needs love, if you don’t follow him, he won’t love you. Give him all love you can and he will love you too!

 

 Watch him

Follow his growht phases, from his born to his fifth birthday. Watch his body and conduct changes!

 

 You play…

Play with him and became the best parent ever! Challenge your friend and rise in I Live ranking!

 

 …  He lives

He lives night and day, waiting for your return!

 

 And much more

I Live is much more! Buy clothes, games and gadget. Make your baby happy for a real experience!

story:
Voxalia is a modern voxel game produced, promoted, and designed by Frenetic LLC using the Frenetic Game Engine.

It is a game centered around the notion of survival in a voxelized, randomly generated world. The game has functioning dynamic physics. Every portion of the natural environment from land to sea moves and flows in reaction to all you do. It's designed to make you feel like it is actually vibrant, alive, and moving at all times around you to simulate a realistic ecosystem.

From the grass-filled plains to the jagged mountain ranges, the world is in constant flux. Giving you the feeling that you are actually living in a whole nother universe.

The world is also changing at all times. Gradual shifts between night and day, as well as changes in season. With all of the survival hazards that may accompany it. From temperature fluctuations, snowstorms, thunderstorms, hurricanes, tornadoes, et cetera. The game is made and designed to throw everything it has at you to give you the best experience possible.

Every single object in the terrain can be used in a multitude of various ways. From the rain that comes from the sky, to the earth beneath your feet, giving your imagination wings.


Every aspect of the world and how it works is one-hundred percent customizable. So, that every single game can be ultimately designed for any individuals desires. Every section of the world and how it functions can be altered to whatever desire seen fit using either console commands, or alternatively, a friendly user-interface to alter the game itself.

You wish for a hardcore survival experience? You can make that.

You wish for a light and forgiving world that you can play casually? You can make that too.

Every single part of the world is what you want it to be.

There is so much more we wish to add to this developing world:

- A full single player story campaign, playable with up to four of your friends
- A dynamic melee system with item durability, strength weapons, finesse weapons, armor weak spots
- Functioning injury system as well as proper medical application
- Fully customizable technological tiers

Every day our team works collaboratively to come up with even more ideas to pour into our project for you, the players, to enjoy the way you want. So, that you may enjoy playing it as much as we do making it.

All we would ask is for a little help making our dream a reality for you. Any donations that can be provided to Frenetic LLC help in ensuring the official release of this wonderful game as fast as possible.

We are also looking for people skilled in various studies to assist in not only creating Voxalia, but possibly future projects and becoming part of a team. From animation, artwork, writing, coding, sound effects and more. If you want to contribute please let us know.

We have a Discord server everyone is welcome to be a part of:

https://freneticllc.com/Go/Discord (or invite code ' eggWVJt ').

We would love to have you in our dysfunctional family here at Frenetic LLC and hear all the wonderful ideas you have.

Anyone that donates fifteen dollars or more will get access to the closed alpha and a copy of the game to keep forever.

Donations of $5 or more get a role on the Frenetic public Discord. At $5, you can see the crowdfunders-only text and voice channels, at $15, your name is elevated on the userlist sidebar, and at $50, your name will be colored gold.
To receive the role, send a DM to AlexGoodwin#9512 on Discord, and in your message include your name and email that you donated with.

Thank you so much for your consideration and thought.

----------------------------------------------------

Zachary "Angel" Brooks
Chief Creative Officer of Frenetic LLC

From the rain that comes from the sky, to the earth beneath your feet, giving your imagination wings.Every aspect of the world and how it works is one-hundred percent customizable. So, that every single game can be ultimately designed for any individuals desires. Every section of the world and how it functions can be altered to whatever desire seen fit using either console commands, or alternatively, a friendly user-interface to alter the game itself.You wish for a hardcore survival experience? You can make that.You wish for a light and forgiving world that you can play casually? You can make that too.Every single part of the world is what you want it to be.There is so much more we wish to add to this developing world:- A full single player story campaign, playable with up to four of your friends- A dynamic melee system with item durability, strength weapons, finesse weapons, armor weak spots- Functioning injury system as well as proper medical application- Fully customizable technological tiersEvery day our team works collaboratively to come up with even more ideas to pour into our project for you, the players, to enjoy the way you want. So, that you may enjoy playing it as much as we do making it.All we would ask is for a little help making our dream a reality for you. Any donations that can be provided to Frenetic LLC help in ensuring the official release of this wonderful game as fast as possible.We are also looking for people skilled in various studies to assist in not only creating Voxalia, but possibly future projects and becoming part of a team. From animation, artwork, writing, coding, sound effects and more. If you want to contribute please let us know.We have a Discord server everyone is welcome to be a part of:https://freneticllc.com/Go/Discord (or invite code ' eggWVJt ').We would love to have you in our dysfunctional family here at Frenetic LLC and hear all the wonderful ideas you have.Anyone that donates fifteen dollars or more will get access to the closed alpha and a copy of the game to keep forever.Donations of $5 or more get a role on the Frenetic public Discord. At $5, you can see the crowdfunders-only text and voice channels, at $15, your name is elevated on the userlist sidebar, and at $50, your name will be colored gold.To receive the role, send a DM to AlexGoodwin#9512 on Discord, and in your message include your name and email that you donated with.Thank you so much for your consideration and thought.----------------------------------------------------Zachary "Angel" BrooksChief Creative Officer of Frenetic LLC

story:
Chains and bones dangled from a fence of bloodied pikes connected by rust and wire. Cracked skulls littered the bases of battle standards, festooned with torn flags that rippled in silence with each dry gust. Carrion crows drifted in wide, lazy circles above, their black plumage stark against a sky of dying amber light. Shadows faded into harbingers of night as they stretched their twisted arms outward from the fence and a strange chill bled from the growing darkness. The air was heavy with dust and ash and the lingering remnants of war.

 

 

Sondum is an epic fantasy game played on desktops and tablets via the web. In this massively multiplayer game, players train minions that evolve from small animals into mighty beasts, commanding them to battle enemies, conquer lands, and build empires.

The game is expansive and open-ended, allowing players to engage in a variety of dynamic activities. Players can embark on exciting quests to earn rich rewards or journey across dangerous lands to uncover lost treasures. They forge clans, which wage wars upon each other as the struggle for power intensifies.

 

 

ASPECTS OF THE GAME

One of the best things about Sondum is the incredible variety of things players can do. Here are just some of the activities players can engage in:

• Capture and train more than 20 species of minions, including Crocolisks, Ivorans, and Leoxes.

• Watch your minion learn powerful new spells and attacks as it levels up and evolves into a powerful creature.

• Equip your minion with formidable armour and lethal weapons to make it unstoppable in battle.

• Challenge other players to battle in thrilling one-on-one fights or amp up the bloodshed with intense two-on-two combat.

• Embark on unique quests from mystical oracles who promise mountains of rich rewards.

• Craft armor, cut jewels, and concoct potions as you master an array of professions.

• Test your luck with fun gambling mechanics such as the Kingswheel.

• Gather rare Frostiron atop the icy, jagged peak of Mount Aslund, or venture across the vast sands of Zathas to acquire exquisite gems.

• Hone your fighting skills by battling a wide variety of computer-controlled opponents.

• Gain experience points, earn gold, and loot valuable items as you journey through treacherous dungeons.

• Join a clan to meet other players and forge alliances to accomplish greater  achievements.

• Sail the South Sea to Westbarge to check out what the pirates are selling, or ride your horse through the Stonam Plains to Lionspeak to seek advice from a wise elderly Brutan.

• Engage in real-time clan wars that test your ability to remain courageous in the face of certain defeat.

• Buy, sell, and trade items through the Auction House and Trading Post to collect rare goods or turn profits.

• Dominate your local marketplace by building a huge shop that other players buy from.

• Become your bank’s favourite client as business success turns you into the wealthiest merchant in your clan.

 

 

WHO WE ARE

A team of three passionate gamers who have been playing games for a combined 30 years. From Pokémon Red and Blue on the original Gameboy to Guild Wars 2 on high-powered PCs, we love games and want to create one of the best web-based games of all time.

We have been quietly working on Sondum for more than two years and have personally invested several thousand dollars into the game. To bring it to fruition, however, we require some financial assistance from you.

 

 

WHY PLEDGE?

Your pledge secures you a spot in your beta, which is going to be private and only operate with a limited number of players. You'll be a part of the very first wave of explorers to journey into Sondum and will have the amazing opportunity to help shape the game as we use player feedback to improve your experience.

If you want to keep it simple, $5 gets you one private beta account. For a little more, you can reserve a username for the official game and even get an exclusive title for your character. Keep spending and you'll have your name engraved on our Wall of Heroes, a cool area in Sondum where all donors are honoured.

For a truly rich experience, become a Warlord, King, or Realm Overlord donor. Perks here include a treasure trove of in-game goodies, an epic special minion, and a limited editon t-shirt.

 

 

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO

There is an array of costs associated with bringing this game into a working beta. Here’s a rough breakdown of how we’ll be using your generous donations to create the next great web game:

• 60% development costs (hiring additional programmers to help code).

• 15% hardware costs (buying and maintaining servers).

• 15% art and design costs (concept art, in-game art, and web design).

• 10% miscellaneous costs (marketing and emergency funds).

We need a minimum of $15,000 to stay on schedule with our beta launch. More money means we can accelerate the launch and deliver more of our awesome content sooner.

story:
Articles

IndieGameMag: “Peaking Out Of The Sand ‘Ostrich Island’ Shows A Beautifully Crafted World To Explore” http://www.indiegamemag.com/peaking-out-of-the-...

GodIsAGeek: "...the whole game is presented in an aesthetic that is pleasing to the eye and actually makes you want to stay on the island at times, instead of escaping."
http://www.godisageek.com/2012/11/20-minutes-ostrich-island/

 

UPDATE #3 (November, 5)

Sven Gerlach, a remarkable German composer and sound designer, has joined Ostrich Island project! You may expect his professional, high quality ambient sounds and sound effects will be added to the game soon.

UPDATE #2 (November, 2)

The third difficulty level for the hardcore players announced.
Want the highest score? Vacation is over! Fallen trees stun you, water level raises as crazy, enemies are quicker and, to make it more fun – you have one life. 
Availability: Soon after the main release.

 UPDATE #1 (November, 1)

The new video shows the ideas/features recently added to the game.
Watch it here: Carousel of Features and do not forget to change quality in player to HD.

 

About the game

Ostrich Island is the unique mix between an adventure (explore beautiful islands and search for collectibles) and a platformer (jump over dangerous waters, run and kick different objects), with a slight hint of role-playing game (level up and gain new abilities).

KICK ALL THE STUFF! COLLECT ALL THE BONUSES!
ESCAPE TO THE NEXT ISLAND BEFORE THE FLOOD!

Will be available for Windows, Mac and Linux

Main Features

  • Gain experience points and upgrade your Ostrich with new skills and abilities!
  • Lots of collectibles and hidden bonuses. Ones found they can be closely examined in the Nest;
  • Two difficulty levels: "Relaxing", where you can slowly investigate the islands, searching for collectibles with nothing to worry about, and "Escape", where constantly rising water level adds some stress but increases score multipliers in return. The third level "Hardcore" will be added later - Want the highest score? Vacation is over! Fallen trees stun you, water level raises as crazy, enemies are quicker and, to make it more fun - you have one life.
  • Global leader board and country scoreboard across all platforms.

The demo version of the game is available and can be downloaded for your Windows/Mac computer (http://www.medungeon.com/Home/Download). The demo contains the first 3 islands.

Who I am

My name is Yaroslav Bakh and I am the creator and owner of MeDungeon Games, the one-man indie games studio from Finland. I have over 15 years of experience in a serious software development, building multi-tier, client/server applications. The game development is my passion and hobby, which I spent most of my free time.

Why I need your money and what you will get

The raised money will be spent on:
  • additional game assets (more objects to interact, more enemies to kick!);
  • outsourcing 3D animator, composer and sound designer work (better animation, more music and sound effects);
  • the game engine "Full" license (more eye candies, for example dynamic shadows, better looking water and fog);
  • additional programming work and localization (interesting extra features. More adventure elements or more platformer or RPG? Let's discuss it together!) 

Stretch goals

Stretch goals will be defined when/if this project will be successfully funded. At the moment I am thinking about the character customization, multiplayer and additional platforms. Plus, more islands!
 

Rewards

Level 1. Supporter. $5
  • Full digital download of the game for Windows, Mac and Linux (Beta and all consequent releases, including the final version);
  • Exclusive access to the forum where you can contribute to the game development with your ideas;
  • "Early bird" badge on game forums.
Level 2. Good Friend. $10
  • Additional copy of the game for your friend;
  • Special "Friend of ...", "In love with ..." or even "Parent of ..." mark near your name in Leader Board on the game web site when your friend joins the game;
  • All rewards from previous level.
Level 3. Fast Learner. $25
  • "Fast Learner" ability will be available for you from the beginning of game (normally at level 9, 10% more experience points, your score is not affected directly);
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 4. From Ostrich Island with Love. $50
  • I will send you the unique "From Ostrich Island with Love" Postcard;
  • Special gold mark near your name and your friend name (when she/he joins) in Leader Board on the game web site;
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 5. Credited. $100
  • The unique Ostrich Island Cap;
  • Your name will be listed in game credits;
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 6. Magnificent. $250
  • The unique Ostrich Island t-short;
  • One collectible in the Nest will have a message in your honor (or in honor of your friend), for example "This sculpture was donated to Ostrich Nest Museum by [Your name here] the Magnificent";
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 7. Best Friend of Ostrich. $500
  • The unique Ostrich Island Flip-flops, now, with a cup and t-short from previous levels, you are all set for the tropical adventure!
  • Your name will be in "Best Friends of Ostrich" section of credits;
  • Very special mark near your name and your friend name (when she/he joins) in Leader Board on the game web site;
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 8. Collector. $1000
  • The unique Ostrich Island Charm Necklace!
  • You may design your own collectible for the game, including shape, name and description (some restrictions may apply);
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 9. Small God. $5000
  • A whole island will be created in your honor, island design and content will be discussed with you;
  • Your name will be in very special "Small Gods" section of credits;
  • All rewards from previous levels.
Level 10. The Boss. $10000
  • Your are the Boss. Your suggestions on the game design and content will be taken into account whenever possible;
  • Your name will be the very first in credits, e.g. "[Your name here] Presents";
  • All rewards from previous levels.

 

 

What if you cannot contribute this time but like the game?

You can help in multiple ways and I will greatly appreciate it:
  • spread a word or two about this project with your friends and social networks
  • like the project video and like the game community on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/OstrichIsland)
  • follow @MeDungeon on twitter (http://twitter.com/MeDungeon) and publish some story about this campaign on Google+
Let me know about your deeds and when/if the project will be successfully funded I may have a surprise for you!

Exclusive access to the forum where you can contribute to the game development with your ideas;
"Early bird" badge on game forums.

Special "Friend of ...", "In love with ..." or even "Parent of ..." mark near your name in Leader Board on the game web site when your friend joins the game;

All rewards from previous levels.

Special gold mark near your name and your friend name (when she/he joins) in Leader Board on the game web site;

Your name will be listed in game credits;
All rewards from previous levels.

Level 6. Magnificent. $250

One collectible in the Nest will have a message in your honor (or in honor of your friend), for example "This sculpture was donated to Ostrich Nest Museum by [Your name here] the Magnificent";
All rewards from previous levels.

Level 7. Best Friend of Ostrich. $500

The unique Ostrich Island Flip-flops, now, with a cup and t-short from previous levels, you are all set for the tropical adventure!
Your name will be in "Best Friends of Ostrich" section of credits;
Very special mark near your name and your friend name (when she/he joins) in Leader Board on the game web site;
All rewards from previous levels.

Level 8. Collector. $1000

The unique Ostrich Island Charm Necklace!
You may design your own collectible for the game, including shape, name and description (some restrictions may apply);
All rewards from previous levels.

story:
Check out www.scriptedcolony.com. It has the same info as here, but looks nicer.

You can also try the demo!


Scripted Colony is a free-to-play persistent base builder game that teaches the player how to program. 

It bears some resemblance to Settlers: little flying Drones will carry all your resources back and forth. The added twist is that you can program most of your daily tasks so that they are performed for you. When you have automated your entire colony you can just lean back in your chair and watch how your brain child takes care of itself. This is the joy of programming!

A key feature in the design is that the game play is never overshadowed by the programming. The game is always meant to be fun, not become a schoolbook in disguise. You are able to reach higher levels without touching the programming parts of the game. Although you can earn Programming Badges that will require you to write code. 

The game is built in Unity, so all world graphics are in full 3D, right here in your browser. It takes place in a sci-fi setting, where you colonize planets, build and upgrade buildings and move resources between planets so every citizen can thrive. Terra-forming planets, building new and better Droids, researching new technology in the vast tech-tree and of course defending against the evil aliens and other players.

I try to focus the design on what is unique with this game and not so much on the graphics and similar content. Almost all of the textures and models you see are bought from various asset stores.


Programming

The language you will learn is Python. This is a well known and established programming language. If you should get stuck or feel the tutorials are too easy, there are many resources online that can help you.

A big focus is on the programming learning curve. The first step is to just run a prewritten script. The next step is to open a piece of code and change a number. In the end you will be writing scripts that balance your economy and solve rather complex tasks. The idea is that if you reach level 30 and have earned ten Programming Badges, you will probably be able to pass the test in a high school programming course.

Depending on your programming experience the hint system will let you specify how much help you need. If you are a proficient programmer you don't need to be taught what a for-loop is.

Get started by building a Programming Center. In that building you will find the controls for opening the Code Window. It opens up below the main game window and let you have full access to the rest of the game without bothering your scripting. Upgrade this building to get access to more advanced programming features like timers that automatically calls your scripts for you. Each new level also gives you the next programming tutorial. 

My goal is to get as many people as possible to write their first lines of code and find out just how rewarding it can be.


 

Features

  • Food buildings

12 kinds of food produced and refined in 12 different buildings. Hydroponics creates Beans. The Bean Masher turns Beans into Hummus. The Bio Chem Lab produces "Meat". "Meat" and Hummus becomes Kebab in the Kebab kitchen.

  • Unwanted resources

Waste of five different kinds. When the waste facilities flow over people lose happiness and the atmosphere takes damage. Really nasty waste like Uranium damages nearby buildings. On the other hand, some waste can be recycled into new resources.

  • Droids

Flying vehicles that are essential to getting your Colony working. Mostly they move resources from building to building, but also help upgrading them. They are built from smaller parts, like: hull, engines, cargo holds and so on. All buildings will have a little landing site next to them where droids can land.

  • Mining

Send out probes in the terrain and find where the different kinds of minerals are located. Then send drones out with special mining equipment. 5 different kinds of raw materials (not all exist on all planets.) And 5 different kinds of refined material, made in 5 different kinds of buildings.

  • Tech-tree

A vast tech-tree with a lot of different unlocks. Buildings, droids, refinery methods, terraforming techniques, war space ships, colonization ships, spy techniques and so on. Developing one branch will make another one more expensive or lock it completely.

  • Scripting

Write scripts in Python and schedule when they should be started. For example, you might want to run the Empty Trash script every hour.

  • Internal mail

An in-box where all reports end up. Building damage, Market reports, outcomes of orbital battles, programming tutorials and so on.

  • Tutorials

A very low learning curve so that even players who have never written a single line of code can keep up. When the Programming Center is built every new level will give you the next chapter of the tutorial.

  • Programming Badges

To prove that you have been able to automate your colony, activate one of the badges. This will disable all command buttons in the game and you will not be able to issue any orders, only watch as your script does the work. Now your scripts have 24 hours to complete the task. 


Risks and Challenges

Most, if not all, of the basic features are in place. The server is up and running 24/7 and have been through some stress testing. The programming infrastructure is done. Some basic game play is implemented (and is quite fun already). So the challenges are more about finishing all the features on time and not so much about solving technical problems. 


Stretch Goals


If the IndieGoGo Campaign is successful and reaches $9000 (USD), it will go on for higher goals.

$9000

The first goal.

Including all basic features.

$11000

More than one planet.

A galaxy-map view where you send probes and select the next planet to colonize. Different planets have different colors, minerals, gravity and atmosphere.

$13000

Social elements

Market where you buy and sell resources and technology. The tech-tree will be even more expensive so cooperation is more rewarded. Alliances, so you can team up with friends. Missions that give you expensive resources or technology. Some missions require an alliance to complete. If you want every technology, you will have to cooperate.

$16000

Space War

Space ships made for orbital fighting and planetary bombardment. Spies that sabotage or steal technologies. Defensive buildings against bombs and spies. This will be voluntary. If you don't want to play this bit, you don't have to.

$22000

Ground War

You droids will be equipped with weapons and fight in real time. Program them to become better fighters. Random aliens will attack, so you need some defense. Order dummy drones to perform attack simulations and test your drones' capabilities. Spies now have to infiltrate buildings with their small, somewhat cloaked, ships. This will probably make planetary bombardment boring and replace the bombers with droid carriers.

You can also try the demo!

The added twist is that you can program most of your daily tasks so that they are performed for you. When you have automated your entire colony you can just lean back in your chair and watch how your brain child takes care of itself. This is the joy of programming!
A key feature in the design is that the game play is never overshadowed by the programming. The game is always meant to be fun, not become a schoolbook in disguise. You are able to reach higher levels without touching the programming parts of the game. Although you can earn Programming Badges that will require you to write code. 
The game is built in Unity, so all world graphics are in full 3D, right here in your browser. It takes place in a sci-fi setting, where you colonize planets, build and upgrade buildings and move resources between planets so every citizen can thrive. Terra-forming planets, building new and better Droids, researching new technology in the vast tech-tree and of course defending against the evil aliens and other players.
I try to focus the design on what is unique with this game and not so much on the graphics and similar content. Almost all of the textures and models you see are bought from various asset stores.




Programming

The language you will learn is Python. This is a well known and established programming language. If you should get stuck or feel the tutorials are too easy, there are many resources online that can help you.
A big focus is on the programming learning curve. The first step is to just run a prewritten script. The next step is to open a piece of code and change a number. In the end you will be writing scripts that balance your economy and solve rather complex tasks. The idea is that if you reach level 30 and have earned ten Programming Badges, you will probably be able to pass the test in a high school programming course.
Depending on your programming experience the hint system will let you specify how much help you need. If you are a proficient programmer you don't need to be taught what a for-loop is.
Get started by building a Programming Center. In that building you will find the controls for opening the Code Window. It opens up below the main game window and let you have full access to the rest of the game without bothering your scripting. Upgrade this building to get access to more advanced programming features like timers that automatically calls your scripts for you. Each new level also gives you the next programming tutorial. 
My goal is to get as many people as possible to write their first lines of code and find out just how rewarding it can be.
 Features


Food buildings


12 kinds of food produced and refined in 12 different buildings. Hydroponics creates Beans. The Bean Masher turns Beans into Hummus. The Bio Chem Lab produces "Meat". "Meat" and Hummus becomes Kebab in the Kebab kitchen.


Unwanted resources


Waste of five different kinds. When the waste facilities flow over people lose happiness and the atmosphere takes damage. Really nasty waste like Uranium damages nearby buildings. On the other hand, some waste can be recycled into new resources.


Droids


Flying vehicles that are essential to getting your Colony working. Mostly they move resources from building to building, but also help upgrading them. They are built from smaller parts, like: hull, engines, cargo holds and so on. All buildings will have a little landing site next to them where droids can land.


Mining


Send out probes in the terrain and find where the different kinds of minerals are located. Then send drones out with special mining equipment. 5 different kinds of raw materials (not all exist on all planets.) And 5 different kinds of refined material, made in 5 different kinds of buildings.


Tech-tree


A vast tech-tree with a lot of different unlocks. Buildings, droids, refinery methods, terraforming techniques, war space ships, colonization ships, spy techniques and so on. Developing one branch will make another one more expensive or lock it completely.


Scripting


Write scripts in Python and schedule when they should be started. For example, you might want to run the Empty Trash script every hour.


Internal mail


An in-box where all reports end up. Building damage, Market reports, outcomes of orbital battles, programming tutorials and so on.


Tutorials


A very low learning curve so that even players who have never written a single line of code can keep up. When the Programming Center is built every new level will give you the next chapter of the tutorial.


Programming Badges


To prove that you have been able to automate your colony, activate one of the badges. This will disable all command buttons in the game and you will not be able to issue any orders, only watch as your script does the work. Now your scripts have 24 hours to complete the task. 



Risks and Challenges
Most, if not all, of the basic features are in place. The server is up and running 24/7 and have been through some stress testing. The programming infrastructure is done. Some basic game play is implemented (and is quite fun already). So the challenges are more about finishing all the features on time and not so much about solving technical problems. 


Stretch Goals
If the IndieGoGo Campaign is successful and reaches $9000 (USD), it will go on for higher goals.$9000
The first goal.Including all basic features.$11000
More than one planet.A galaxy-map view where you send probes and select the next planet to colonize. Different planets have different colors, minerals, gravity and atmosphere.$13000
Social elementsMarket where you buy and sell resources and technology. The tech-tree will be even more expensive so cooperation is more rewarded. Alliances, so you can team up with friends. Missions that give you expensive resources or technology. Some missions require an alliance to complete. If you want every technology, you will have to cooperate.$16000
Space WarSpace ships made for orbital fighting and planetary bombardment. Spies that sabotage or steal technologies. Defensive buildings against bombs and spies. This will be voluntary. If you don't want to play this bit, you don't have to.$22000
Ground WarYou droids will be equipped with weapons and fight in real time. Program them to become better fighters. Random aliens will attack, so you need some defense. Order dummy drones to perform attack simulations and test your drones' capabilities. Spies now have to infiltrate buildings with their small, somewhat cloaked, ships. This will probably make planetary bombardment boring and replace the bombers with droid carriers.

story:
TimeFusion is a story-driven, third-person and action-adventure game. The storyline will place you in two parallel universes, which are connected through a tear in the fabric of space and time, in a nutshell portal.

You will play the role of Livia, young female who after a numerous unpredictable events finds herself in a parallel universe, which is so different from ours, that she is struggling to make sense of everything around her. Your goal is to guide Livia over the many obstacles this new universe will throw at her. While you are chased from the "Agency", the organization entitled to safeguard the timeline, you have to make many complex difficult choices to determine your fate.

  

Concept Art : Agents

You will encounter many and versatile foes and your will to stay alive will be tested many times. You will experience deep and breathtaking story filled with action, adventure, fear, love and many more emotions.  

                                       

                                                              Concept Art : NPC

Just when you think everything is almost over and the moment you have managed to find another portal which could lead you back home, you will find yourself in a totally different universe once again ... waiting to be discovered.

Epsilon 5-A is the first universe that you will explore. Technologically advanced beyond our widest dreams, but without any hope and dreams on it`s own.

Lambda 14 is the second universe. Pure, clean and magical place, where the time stands still. Technology does not exist and the life is flourishing.

While our deep story puts you in emotional ride, our breathtaking graphics make you question reality itself and our amazing sound is touching your soul, you will be feeling joy that you are a big part of this project.


Main Features:

  • TimeFusion is a single-player, third person game
  • The unique story-driven plot is deep and complex
  • Stunning Next-Gen Graphics
  • The game will be developed in the Unreal Engine 4  
  • Action packed gameplay
  • Gorgeous cutscenes 
  • Amazing epic music
  • Full voiceovers
  • Support for Windows and OS X


We are a small team of industry veterans. With almost a decade of experience in the industry working for giants like Ubisoft, Crytek and etc., we know that we have the experience and knowledge to make this project happen. My name is Genadi Dimov and I'm responsible for everything Art and Story related. My friend João Silva is helping me with the Concept Art. There are more people in our team who you all will meet in the near future. We are driven and to this day there is nothing we love more than making and playing video games. I think this is the magic formula for a good game.


TimeFusion is a dream project for us. We are excited for the chance to create it and we want you to be a part of it as well. 

We need your help, so we can make the game. We will publish TimeFusion ourselves through digital channels in order to retain control over our project from the beginning to the end. Great thing about crowdfunding is that we can go directly to the people who have liked our project and would love to play it. This process allows us to create the game exactly the way you want to see it.

Our relationship with you can be even closer with IndieGoGo. We can be more transparent with the development stages and give you behind the scenes look to what goes on day-to-day with TimeFusion. We will retain an open dialog with our supporters through the entire production.

We are asking for your help to fund the project and to finally make our dream a reality!


Your money will go towards building the game. To hire artists, designers, animators, programmers and to pay for voiceovers. To create the worlds and the characters. To buy hardware and software licenses, pay for office space and finally to release the game.

Your pledges are incredibly important to us. In return we pledge to make every dollar count, and to deliver a game we all want to play.





THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT! ($5 or more)

You will receive our heartfelt thanks for your pledge by email + Cool badge on the official forums.


BEFORE THE TIME ($20 or more)

This is limited to the first 1,000 pledgers, special low price for Early Birds!

Digital downloadable copy of TimeFusion at launch + Cool badge on the official forums + Digital game manual.


TIME STANDARD ($25 or more)

Digital downloadable copy of TimeFusion at launch + Cool badge on the official forums + Digital game manual.


TIME-MACHINE ($50 or more)

Digital downloadable copy of TimeFusion 48 hours before the official launch + "Pledger" digital certificate + Cool badge on the official forums + Digital game manual.


FABRIC OF TIME ($75 or more)

Digital copy of the Art Book + High quality digital copy of TimeFusion OST + Digital downloadable copy of the game + "Pledger" digital certificate + Cool badge on the official forums + Digital game manual.


THE COLLECTOR OF TIME ($100 or more)

COLLECTOR'S EDITION BOX - includes game DVD and printed manual + Digital copy of the Art Book + High quality digital copy of TimeFusion OST + Digital downloadable copy of the game + "Pledger" digital certificate + Cool badge on the official forums.


SIGN THE TIME ($125 or more)

Add your name to the game`s credits + Unique postcard personalized and signed by the development team + COLLECTOR'S EDITION BOX - includes game DVD and printed manual + Digital copy of the Art Book + High quality digital copy of TimeFusion OST + Digital downloadable copy of the game + "Pledger" digital certificate + Cool badge on the official forums.


ALPHA TIME ($150 or more)

Exclusive access to the Alpha and Beta + Add your name to the game's credits + Unique postcard personalized and signed by the development team + COLLECTOR'S EDITION BOX - includes game DVD and printed manual + Digital copy of the Art Book + High quality digital copy of TimeFusion OST + Digital downloadable copy of the game + "Pledger" digital certificate + Cool badge on the official forums.


THE ART OF TIME ($250 or more)

The unique printed Art Book + Branded USB stick with the game and all digital elements + Exclusive access to the Alpha and Beta + Add your name to the game's credits + Unique postcard personalized and signed by the development team + COLLECTOR'S EDITION BOX - includes game DVD and printed manual + Cool badge on the official forums.


NAME THE TIME ($500 or more)
Your name in the game on "Wall of fallen Heroes" + DVD with "The making of TimeFusion" + The unique printed Art Book + Branded USB stick with the game and all digital elements + Exclusive access to the Alpha and Beta + Add your name to the game's credits + Unique postcard personalized and signed by the development team + COLLECTOR'S EDITION BOX - includes game DVD and printed manual + Cool badge on the official forums.


THE LORD OF TIME  ($750 or more)

In-game side-quest and location not accessible by anyone else + Personal Thank-you Skype call from the Art Director + Your name in the game on "Wall of fallen Heroes" + DVD with "The making of TimeFusion" + The unique printed Art Book + Branded USB stick with the game and all digital elements + Exclusive access to the Alpha and Beta + Add your name to the game's credits + Unique postcard personalized and signed by the development team + Everything in the "THE COLLECTOR OF TIME" tier.


DESIGN THE TIME ($1,000 or more)

30 min. video chat with the creator to ask him all the questions you like + Help us to design one NPC + In-game side-quest and location not accessible by anyone else + Your name in the game on "Wall of fallen Heroes" + DVD with "The making of TimeFusion" + The unique printed Art Book + Branded USB stick with the game and all digital elements + Exclusive access to the Alpha and Beta + Everything in the "SIGN THE TIME" tier.


TIME SHIFT ($2,500 or more)

Your personalized portrait will be seen in the game from every player + Help us to design one Weapon and NPC + 30 min. video chat with the creator to ask him all the questions you like + In-game side-quest and location not accessible by anyone else + Your name in the game on "Wall of fallen Heroes" + DVD with "The making of TimeFusion" + The unique printed Art Book + Branded USB stick with the game and all digital elements + Everything in the "ALPHA TIME" tier.


THE STATUE OF TIME ($5,000 or more)

In-game statue of you, which every player will see + Amazing 3D printed statuette of Livia shipped to you + Your personalized portrait will be seen in the game from every player + Help us to design one Weapon and NPC + 30 min. video chat with the creator to ask him all the questions you like + In-game side-quest and location not accessible by anyone else + Your name in the game on "Wall of fallen Heroes" + DVD with "The making of TimeFusion" + Everything in the "THE ART OF TIME" tier.


THE TIME ($10,000)
Spend one day with the team! (travel and accommodations not included) + Take a photo with the team and we will upload it on a special place in our official website + In-game statue of you, which every player will see + Amazing 3D printed statuette of Livia shipped to you + Your personalized portrait will be seen in the game from every player + Help us to design one Weapon and NPC + In-game side-quest and location not accessible by anyone else + Everything in the "NAME THE TIME" tier.

Get daily news of our progress and more! Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
This is a  journey to the super massive horizon

About falling stars, ancient gods and the song of souls

 

 

 

Soulgest is a survival adventure game inspired by games we love like Legend of Zelda, Dark Souls and The Forest. You will explore a post apocalyptic land forgotten by mankind, taken by the nature and ruled by the hands of ancient gods.

The gameplay is focused on exploration, survival and boss battles. Take your time fishing, hunting, exploring dungeons or learning about the history of the ancient gods and civilizations. You decide how deep you will dive into the world of Soulgest

 

 

Discover the mysteries of the ancient deities or focus on your main missions to find the gods pray for them and take down the giant bosses to rebuild the Stars Route Map.

The project is a dream coming to life, born from our passion for games like Legend of Zelda, Breath of Fire and so many nostalgic RPGs mixed with the survival mechanics of games like The Flame in the Flood.

The word "soulgest" is a mix of the original word Almagestum one of the first stars catalogue and its translation Alma: Soul, and Gest: Gestum (something like heroic song). Soulgest is at the same time the Stars Map and the Song of Souls

 

 

I’m in love with ancient history and astronomy, almost 2 years ago I started to study more and collect data to create a game based on the things I most love. Sometime after the born of my son and living together with him, i slowly learnt that there is something special in non-explicit violence games something relaxing and adventurous that was always present in games from Nintendo and some ps one era rpgs.

I also indentified a lack of games in this specific genre for PC users, only few ones gave me the right feeling of adventure that i was searching for, with this in mind Soulgest began to take shape, from top down pixel art, to isometric 3d and then to the actual third person view. 

In the process of creating the prototypes only when i got the third person angles working i could achieve the sense of greatness and loneliness i was aiming for.

 

 

 

 

A Free World

Soulgest combine a free world exploration with survival mechanics and boss battles based on strategy and observation of the enemy behavior. Your main quest is to defeat the bosses who represent the constellations in different cultures like Orion, Nimrod, Sirius and Kesil.

You can choose any boss or quest in any order and start to explore, but you will need to prepare yourself for the travel, think about your backpack size, take water and food to survive in the wilderness.

 

Backpack Management

One of the most important items in Soulgest is your backpack, you will need it to carry anything more than little sticks. 

You can find (rarely) or craft your own backpack in different models and sizes, each model will have different number of slots for items and quick-slots for your tools.

 

Be Prepared

Be well prepared for the travels is the best strategy to survive the lands of Xaartus, before going on a mission be sure to collect some information about the place you will go, talk to drifters, survivors or find documents that tells you a little about the new place you will discover

Study about the climate, wild life and history of the land and you will know what to carry and  what to fear.

 

Survive

 

While your main goal is to defeat the bosses you will have to survive all the journey till you find your objective. You will need to gather fruits or hunt animals to eat, search for consumable water and stay warm.

 

Lit Your Fire

Bonfires are essential to keep you alive, in them you can cook food and boil water to prevent ills or infections. Bonfires keep you warm in the night and keep animals away while you sleep.

 

Build Your Shelter

By building a shelter you can be safe from rain and cold. There are different levels of shelter that you can build. Temporary shelters last only one night but require less ressources, definitive shelters can be used as fast travel points, upgrade a shelter to a cabin will let you create craft tables, item chests and much more. 

Any new upgrade after that will put you closer of a community and that is what you need to recruit survivors to help you, any new survivor will need a room in the house to enter to your team.

 

 

 

 

Combat system in Soulgest work similar to games like Legend of Zelda BOTW and Dark Souls. You will need to pay attention to the enemies moves and behaviors and be ready to dodge and attack in the right time. While small enemies and animals would deal little damage large enemies and furious animals will kill you with little effort if you were not well prepared and equiped. 

While you can use any weapon or tool to attack, some enemies will not be hurted by normal weapons, you cant expect a little wood plank to deal any significant damage in something made of dark matter.

 

Equipment

All of your equipment need to be crafted, swords, tools, clothes, crossbows and armors. As well all equipments are breakable and can be fixed up to three times before it broke definitely. 

You will have tools like axes, pickaxes and hammers as well as weapons like swords, battle axes and crosbows. Your character will need better or specific armors to explore parts of the world,  you will also need to think about your clothes to stay safe from the cold and from the extreme heat.

Ranged weapons are among the tools you can create. Your crossbows will be important to hunt silently, interrupt attacks and to use status changing attacks.

 

 

Loot

When you run out of food, medicine or weapons, do not fear being rude, search the houses, the dead and the graves. Sooner or later you will be alone and without anything at hand, search every house for straps, old mechanic parts or maybe a simple roof to sleep.

 

Tomb Raid

Through the lands of Xaartus you will find various dungeons and caves, in those places you can find loot, resources and learn more about the history of the world. Discover monoliths and old scrolls that remains from a time most ancient than the gods.

 

A New Language

In order to read the monoliths and scrolls left by ancient people, first you will need to learn their language. Each old text or artifact will teach you new words till you can fully understand the languages and find the truth!

 

Hunting

There are your personal everyday hunts and contract hunts. You will need to use traps and stealth to catch your daily prey in order to eat but Contract Hunts are all around the world in boards in villages or ruins or from other npcs around the world. Sometimes the hunt contract is from ages ago found in ruins of a cave but if the prey still alive the hunt continues.

 

 

 

In the world of Soulgest you will find another survivors, some of them will become merchants or take another roles in the camps. But you will also find companions who will enter to you party and help you in your missions.

 

 

You can choose one companion at time to help you in some missions or boss fights, they may not follow you all the time, but in specific areas you can shoot a flare and ask them for help.

 

 

Initially we plan four companions, two males and two females. Each companion will have their own weapon and clothes or armor that are exclusive for them, their equipment will not have such variety as Noah equipments instead they will have exclusive status and skills like higher physical strenght, better ranged weapons, buffs and debuffs. 

 

Mounts

In Soulgest you will find one mount for each area of the world, camels in the desert, horses in the field, goats for the moutains, deers for forest, snow moutains and another areas. To earn the mount you will need to complete a quest first, after that the mount will be yours but it will need a place to rest. 

By building a barn your mount will have where to comeback if it stay alone for too much time or if it dies on the travel. You can create barns in all of your camps if you upgrade it to the right level, if you dont have a barn the mount will come back to its "born place"

 

 

• Open World Exploration (discover the mysteries of the gods of the first men and the fallen constellations) 

• Survival (survive the hunger, thirst and cold)

• Crafting and Gathering (craft tools, weapons and armors, logging, mining)

• Boss Battles (defeat the giant old kings and take the stars) 

• Hunting (take hunts across the world, animals, creatures and who knows what more) 

• Fishing (travel the lands to find fishing spots and secret fishes)

• Village Building (new craft tools in your house, merchants in the village)

 • Mounts (find the right mount for each area, camel, horse, deer, goat and more) 

• Companions (find survivors to help you in missions and boss fights)

• Farming (plant seeds and general goods to save food, make traps or feed animals.

 

 

 

The mankind followed its journey to the future, evolving and pushing the earth to its ruin, and after the devastation of the planet they turned their eyes to the stars. And then the space exodus began, time after time, spaceship after spaceship left the earth through the wormholes, leaving behind thousands abandoned to survive in a devastated world…but they left a last gift to the forgotten people on earth a crack in the space time……The Supermassive Horizon….

With the Supermassive Horizon the stars began to fall on earth and the ancient gods rose again… … and after them something even ancestral, something worshiped even by the gods themselves…the primordial deities…the personifications of the own constellations of the first men.

 

 

The Land

Xaartus, a land once inhabited by diverse human societies in a distorted place where once could have been the caucasus and the levant. Today, centuries after the horizon coming and the time-space convergence this land became the central point of the supermassive-horizon expansion and the only place on earth where the ancient constellations rose again

You will travel through a land of fantasy mixed with history and legends. Each area is based on real locations and ancient civilizations. You will find Celtic forest guarded by the horned gods, grasslands covered by ruins and Henges of the megalithic age, snow mountains touched by the old Nordics, deserts watched by YHWH and others by Sirius, Babylonian ruins, Sumerian Tablets and the ruins of the own contemporary mankind.

 

 

 

 

 

In the world of Soulgest the humankind had already gone, only few villages and drifters left. When the stars started to fall on earth people began to be flowded by the dark matter and the singularity. Those creatures once humans are called Voids, in your way you can find simple...almost human voids and other very massive as Ergo.

 When a new star falls on earth there are a chance for one of its fragments hit a void, when this happens the void become a Shard an armored enemy with cristalyzed star shards covering parts of his body. Shards can evolve with the star power and become Shells a very powerfull and aggressive version with all his body covered by the fragments.

 

Non_Voids

In the furthest lands you will also find different kind of enemies as the Giants the descendants of the fallen titans.

 

 

Animals

When traveling trought the wilds you need to be aware of wild animals, wolves and boars will attack you and certainly kill you if you are not armed. You will also find rabbits, turtles, birds that you can capture to use its leather or food.

 

Music and Voices

Soulgest music is hard for me to explain, you are in a post apocalyptic world at the edge of humanity, but you are also in and amazing land, with beatifull nature, you are surrouded by the dangers of the wild life and by something ancestral than the gods and at the same time you are delighted by the lands of Xaartus.

This is the team responsible to give life to something born from our deepest dreams with amazing songs and voice acting.

 

Composer: Alan Monteiro

Forest Theme - by Alan Monteiro

 

Composer: Andrei Shulgach

Main Theme

 

Voice Actress: Tarsila Bazilio

 

 

Platforms  

The planned release of Soulgest is to October 2019 and Nintendo Switch version some months later in the beginning of 2020.  Playstation 4 and X Box One versions depends if we reach the strecth goals for consoles. And the planned release is to the first half of 2020.

 

Languages

Brazilian Portuguese

English

 

Budget  

Almost all the funds of Indie gogo will be directed to development. The port to Nintendo Switch is already included in the initial budget cause we always plan a Switch release since the initial game prototypes. With the initial funding the three of us will keep working and sharing different roles in the development. If we achieve some of the stretch goals we'll can hire some extra animators and programmers to raise the level of our art and gameplay

 

Team

The project is a dream coming to life, born from our passion for games like Legend of Zelda, Breath of Fire and so many nostalgic RPGs mixed with the survival mechanics of games like The Flame in the Flood, and our even greater passion for history, astronomy and averything related to where we came from and where we'll go

We of Monster Burp being working with corporative and games on demand for almost 5 years. The members of the team work with CG and art up to 10 years.

After other personal projects we finally found on Soulgest our goal and a chance to create the game we always dream about.
story_txt: This is a  journey to the super massive horizon About falling stars, ancient gods and the song of souls   Soulgest is a survival adventure game inspired by games we love like Legend of Zelda, Dark Souls and The Forest. You will explore a post apocalyptic land forgotten by mankind, taken by the nature and ruled by the hands of ancient gods.The gameplay is focused on exploration, survival and boss battles. Take your time fishing, hunting, exploring dungeons or learning about the history of the ancient gods and civilizations. You decide how deep you will dive into the world of Soulgest  Discover the mysteries of the ancient deities or focus on your main missions to find the gods pray for them and take down the giant bosses to rebuild the Stars Route Map.The project is a dream coming to life, born from our passion for games like Legend of Zelda, Breath of Fire and so many nostalgic RPGs mixed with the survival mechanics of games like The Flame in the Flood.The word "soulgest" is a mix of the original word Almagestum one of the first stars catalogue and its translation Alma: Soul, and Gest: Gestum (something like heroic song). Soulgest is at the same time the Stars Map and the Song of Souls  I’m in love with ancient history and astronomy, almost 2 years ago I started to study more and collect data to create a game based on the things I most love. Sometime after the born of my son and living together with him, i slowly learnt that there is something special in non-explicit violence games something relaxing and adventurous that was always present in games from Nintendo and some ps one era rpgs.I also indentified a lack of games in this specific genre for PC users, only few ones gave me the right feeling of adventure that i was searching for, with this in mind Soulgest began to take shape, from top down pixel art, to isometric 3d and then to the actual third person view. In the process of creating the prototypes only when i got the third person angles working i could achieve the sense of greatness and loneliness i was aiming for.    A Free WorldSoulgest combine a free world exploration with survival mechanics and boss battles based on strategy and observation of the enemy behavior. Your main quest is to defeat the bosses who represent the constellations in different cultures like Orion, Nimrod, Sirius and Kesil.You can choose any boss or quest in any order and start to explore, but you will need to prepare yourself for the travel, think about your backpack size, take water and food to survive in the wilderness. Backpack ManagementOne of the most important items in Soulgest is your backpack, you will need it to carry anything more than little sticks. You can find (rarely) or craft your own backpack in different models and sizes, each model will have different number of slots for items and quick-slots for your tools. Be PreparedBe well prepared for the travels is the best strategy to survive the lands of Xaartus, before going on a mission be sure to collect some information about the place you will go, talk to drifters, survivors or find documents that tells you a little about the new place you will discoverStudy about the climate, wild life and history of the land and you will know what to carry and  what to fear. Survive While your main goal is to defeat the bosses you will have to survive all the journey till you find your objective. You will need to gather fruits or hunt animals to eat, search for consumable water and stay warm. Lit Your FireBonfires are essential to keep you alive, in them you can cook food and boil water to prevent ills or infections. Bonfires keep you warm in the night and keep animals away while you sleep. Build Your ShelterBy building a shelter you can be safe from rain and cold. There are different levels of shelter that you can build. Temporary shelters last only one night but require less ressources, definitive shelters can be used as fast travel points, upgrade a shelter to a cabin will let you create craft tables, item chests and much more. Any new upgrade after that will put you closer of a community and that is what you need to recruit survivors to help you, any new survivor will need a room in the house to enter to your team.    Combat system in Soulgest work similar to games like Legend of Zelda BOTW and Dark Souls. You will need to pay attention to the enemies moves and behaviors and be ready to dodge and attack in the right time. While small enemies and animals would deal little damage large enemies and furious animals will kill you with little effort if you were not well prepared and equiped. While you can use any weapon or tool to attack, some enemies will not be hurted by normal weapons, you cant expect a little wood plank to deal any significant damage in something made of dark matter. EquipmentAll of your equipment need to be crafted, swords, tools, clothes, crossbows and armors. As well all equipments are breakable and can be fixed up to three times before it broke definitely. You will have tools like axes, pickaxes and hammers as well as weapons like swords, battle axes and crosbows. Your character will need better or specific armors to explore parts of the world,  you will also need to think about your clothes to stay safe from the cold and from the extreme heat.Ranged weapons are among the tools you can create. Your crossbows will be important to hunt silently, interrupt attacks and to use status changing attacks.  LootWhen you run out of food, medicine or weapons, do not fear being rude, search the houses, the dead and the graves. Sooner or later you will be alone and without anything at hand, search every house for straps, old mechanic parts or maybe a simple roof to sleep. Tomb RaidThrough the lands of Xaartus you will find various dungeons and caves, in those places you can find loot, resources and learn more about the history of the world. Discover monoliths and old scrolls that remains from a time most ancient than the gods. A New LanguageIn order to read the monoliths and scrolls left by ancient people, first you will need to learn their language. Each old text or artifact will teach you new words till you can fully understand the languages and find the truth! HuntingThere are your personal everyday hunts and contract hunts. You will need to use traps and stealth to catch your daily prey in order to eat but Contract Hunts are all around the world in boards in villages or ruins or from other npcs around the world. Sometimes the hunt contract is from ages ago found in ruins of a cave but if the prey still alive the hunt continues.   In the world of Soulgest you will find another survivors, some of them will become merchants or take another roles in the camps. But you will also find companions who will enter to you party and help you in your missions.  You can choose one companion at time to help you in some missions or boss fights, they may not follow you all the time, but in specific areas you can shoot a flare and ask them for help.  Initially we plan four companions, two males and two females. Each companion will have their own weapon and clothes or armor that are exclusive for them, their equipment will not have such variety as Noah equipments instead they will have exclusive status and skills like higher physical strenght, better ranged weapons, buffs and debuffs.  MountsIn Soulgest you will find one mount for each area of the world, camels in the desert, horses in the field, goats for the moutains, deers for forest, snow moutains and another areas. To earn the mount you will need to complete a quest first, after that the mount will be yours but it will need a place to rest. By building a barn your mount will have where to comeback if it stay alone for too much time or if it dies on the travel. You can create barns in all of your camps if you upgrade it to the right level, if you dont have a barn the mount will come back to its "born place"  • Open World Exploration (discover the mysteries of the gods of the first men and the fallen constellations) • Survival (survive the hunger, thirst and cold)• Crafting and Gathering (craft tools, weapons and armors, logging, mining)• Boss Battles (defeat the giant old kings and take the stars) • Hunting (take hunts across the world, animals, creatures and who knows what more) • Fishing (travel the lands to find fishing spots and secret fishes)• Village Building (new craft tools in your house, merchants in the village) • Mounts (find the right mount for each area, camel, horse, deer, goat and more) • Companions (find survivors to help you in missions and boss fights)• Farming (plant seeds and general goods to save food, make traps or feed animals.   The mankind followed its journey to the future, evolving and pushing the earth to its ruin, and after the devastation of the planet they turned their eyes to the stars.
