story:
PC, PS4/XB1 Controller recommended for maximum fun

 

 

Blubber Busters is a run-&-gun 2D action platforming adventure diving headlong into the bellies of sad, afflicted space whales to cure what ails 'em. Explore their innards, discover the sources of each infection and neutralize them! Each disease offers up unique challenges, enemies, and objectives to get those poor creatures right as rain again.

 

 

The player can swap between characters on the fly to make the most out of every situation. Each crew member brings a unique play style and set of abilities to the team to help make strategic combos against the enemy & enhance your care-giving quotient!

 

 

We're big fans of 90s-era combat platformers, and especially inspired by games like Mega Man X, Metal Slug, and the Metroid series. Blubber Busters is a game that will embrace their spirit, but with an added punch!

 

As the station's janitor, Rudy's job mainly consists of burning off space barnacles from oncoming ships with his trusty modified utility torch.  

Rudy’s flamethrower is great for dealing with low health swarming enemies and for clearing away goopy obstacles at a safe distance. Not to mention has in interesting way of jump jetting his way over pits and traps.

 

Resident cook at the food truck outside the clinic, Eva spent her free time building a surgical suit to get the attention of the head doctor. Since tradegy struck, she's now one of the staff.

Eva’s syringe claws slice through hardened armored enemies and obstacles. She's also far more maneuverable with dashes and double jumps.

 

In a distant solar system, humans and space whales live in harmony among the stars. Whales provide transport across the galaxy, access to exotic resources, and much-needed companionship. In return they only ask that we keep them healthy. Easy, right? 

We... have our work cut out for us. For being such an ancient species living in deep space they're not too bright. Most steer themselves to Space Veterinary Centers that orbit the largest planets for medical help and loving care.

But over a years time, most centers have gone dark. Now, the only one left manned by misfits and the center’s janitor, Rudy, and wannabe doctor, Eva, must save the burdensome beasts from infectious threats to their species.

Fight your way into a world packed with guts, eccentric aliens and quack doctors! As you race to save every patient that comes to your door, a sinister plot unfolds…

 

 

Players treat four whales in the system on the journey to cure a new space whale disease. The order players choose to complete levels will create sicker & more difficult versions of the later chosen whales. The order levels are chosen to defeat will create one of several variants of a final level, and ending in an extra dimensional whale.

 

Your space station acts as a HUB between missions, and also serves as the setting for the first mission of the game.

 

 

The many combat and platforming levels of Blubber Busters are the actual goopy innards of space whales! Space whales have problems -- Lots of problems -- bizarre bacteria, pesky parasites, and more will fight your team until they’re all cleared out of your patient.

 

 

Each afflicted whale effectively works as a single stage with its own set of problems & objectives you need to solve to help get it happy and healthy again. A whale with a stomach ache may have a parasite infection having you burning through heaps of gooey blockage, and forcing your team to wipe out swaths of nasty critters before taking on their queen.

 

 

 

Another might have a malfunctioning pacemaker bigger than a house and now it’s security bots have become deadly. You’d have to reboot it’s systems and jerry rig some systems to give you access, all the while surviving the deadly bots! It's up to you to fix 'em up.

 

Our composer, Chris Christodoulou, known for Risk of Rain, Deadbolt and Risk of Rain 2 - will be joining us to compose the soundtrack for Blubber Busters! You can listen to some of his previously released tracks here! 

 

All of our budget will go into contracting a programmer & additional art support for things like animation, rigging, SFX and VFX. 

 

While our base game is something we can make with our 50k goal, our stretch goals will expand the amount of levels, platforms, game modes, characters, stories and more that we can add in the future. 

 

The Game

  • Get a digital PC copy (PC/Steam) of Blubber Busters! All backers will be able to choose on which platform (out of the unlocked release platforms) they'll receive their codes.

Digital Art Book

  • Character art, enemy iterations, level designs, full page spreads of colorful rivers of bodily fluids - this book has it all!

Early Beta Access + Discord

  • Play the game before anyone else! Help give our team feedback and make the game the best it can be.

Physical Art Book

  • It's the art book... but you can hold it on your hands! Digital-world cyber-beings need not apply; this is only for us creatures of flesh and bone.

Name & Portrait in the game

  • There are tons of dead surgeons in space whales these days, but oddly enough not many with names... until now. You can be one of these dead surgeons with a unique story of how you kicked the bucket.

Design an NPC

  • What's more exciting than talking to an NPC? Talking to one that you helped create! Become one with the lore or just mop up the floor.

Name a Disease

  • The first disease ever named after a sandwich! If... that's what you want to name it... Work with our team to create a gross, silly or unique name for your disease to go down in history! *cough*

Thar Be Monsters was founded in 2015 by three industry artists with a twisted desire to make a game inspired by colorful and over-the-top cartoons.

In 2016, we embarked on the journey of launching a Kickstarter for our game. For many reasons, we decided to cancel the campaign in order to come back with a bigger & better demo, refined scope, and concept that will highlight & focus on what makes our game fun.

 

Our biggest risks come from the fact that game development can be unpredictable and when that happens scheduling can be effected.

Our team members have over 20 years combined of game development experience, shipping multiple titles. We've been through the scoping and development process  a few times and we're confident that we've budgeted time appropriately, given our funds. Should several designs take more iterations than previously estimated, we have several publishers and investors already courting us, so we're willing to entertain those options to ensure that the best game is brought to you.

 

 

Shout out to all those that have helped us through our earlier stages of development and beyond - Alex Redfish, Kevin Culler, Priscilla Tsang, Khai Tran, Skylar Surra, Mike Ton, Terry Nguyen, Frank Washburn, Sam Thomas, Ai Tran

Those that helped with the current demo - Arthur Brussee, Denis Novikov, Erica Hampson, James Hostetler, Luis Brito, Paul Jarvis, Ray Rajadorai, Chris Christodoulou, Austin Devries

All of our backers on Patreon that helped us fund the demo's development!

And to all our friends & family that have supported us since the beginning. Thank you! <3

 

We understand that not everyone can back the campaign, but sharing helps too!

 

            

 

Please feel free to reach out to us through any of the above channels, and if all else fails, you can shoot us an email at info@tharbemonsters.net

story:
Bring the best driving game to the best arcade.

Outside the USA amazing games exist that sadly never make their way to America's arcades.

  • The Break ( 8 on The Break) located just outside NYC in Dunellen New Jersey,  is the longest continually operated  arcade in the country. The arcade opened its doors in 1973. It has been under current management since 1985.
  • We know the community believes in The Break, and has long desired an Initial D  machine, newer than the version we currently have (Initial d 3) .
  • Together with the community, we can achieve the goal of bringing one of these machines to the USA.

Help us fund Initial D 7

It's simple, help us and we will help you!

  • We  need $8,500 . This will cover the purchase and transportation from Japan, as well as local delivery.
  • Our perks are simple. For every amount you contribute, we will match it 100% in game tokens good on the Initial D 7 machine!
  • Contribute $10.00 we give you $20.00 in Initial D 7 collectible tokens good in this machine.  Contribute $20.00 we give you $40.00 in tokens, and so on. Once the machine is here you will be playing for 1/2 the price of those who did not contribute.

The Impact

The Break has always been on the cutting edge. With the power of our community behind us, we will be able to provide more and more games not available anywhere else  at the least expensive price.

Initial d 7 will be $1.00 a play, BUT,  if you contribute, we double your contribution in tokens, you play for 50% less than everyone else.
story_txt:
Bring the best driving game to the best arcade. Outside the USA amazing games exist that sadly never make their way to America's arcades. 
The Break ( 8 on The Break) located just outside NYC in Dunellen New Jersey,  is the longest continually operated  arcade in the country. The arcade opened its doors in 1973. It has been under current management since 1985. We know the community believes in The Break, and has long desired an Initial D  machine, newer than the version we currently have (Initial d 3) . Together with the community, we can achieve the goal of bringing one of these machines to the USA. 
Help us fund Initial D 7
 It's simple, help us and we will help you! 
We  need $8,500 . This will cover the purchase and transportation from Japan, as well as local delivery. Our perks are simple. For every amount you contribute, we will match it 100% in game tokens good on the Initial D 7 machine!
Contribute $10.00 we give you $20.00 in Initial D 7 collectible tokens good in this machine.  Contribute $20.00 we give you $40.00 in tokens, and so on. Once the machine is here you will be playing for 1/2 the price of those who did not contribute. 
  The Impact The Break has always been on the cutting edge. With the power of our community behind us, we will be able to provide more and more games not available anywhere else  at the least expensive price.
Initial d 7 will be $1.00 a play, BUT,  if you contribute, we double your contribution in tokens, you play for 50% less than everyone else.

story:
Welcome!

Thank you for visiting the crowd-funding campaign for "The Legend", an indie horror game based in the horrific world of many urban legends.

 

As our faithful fans already know, "The Legend" has recently been Greenlit by the Steam Greenlight service, thus, preparing a formal platform for the release of "The Legend".  The trailer above, was used as an original proof-of-concept and tech demo to achieve this milestone.

(Rollover with Mouse)

 

The goal of "The Legend" is revolutionize the horror game industry like several games before it.  For example, "Amnesia: The Dark Descent", which rewrote the definition of independent horror games.  With the assistance of the NextGen Graphics offered by the CryEngine 3 and multi-platform capabilities, "The Legend" will lead this revolution.  

We want to as many people as possible to experience the thrilling experiences generated from this project, but we can not do that without help from the community.  We need better equipment, proper licenses and the ability to pay our team of developers to achieve this groundbreaking goal.  We care about our community, and above that, our loyal fans.  We want to deliver on our promise to give them an unforgettable experience.

 

Who's behind "The Legend"?

An experienced, interested and motivated development team and a community of horror enthusiasts alike!

Elder Productions is a smaller-design team with the motivation to grow exponentially.  The team consists of several well-experienced individuals from the indie-game industry.

My name is Austin Handle and I'm the Project Lead for "The Legend".  I've had several years of experience in the CryEngine 2 & 3.  A couple of years ago, I wrote and developed the first functional code and system for a cooperative play system in the CryEngine, before passing the project off to a larger team.  I'm confident that any interest in this project will grow as you see our work, where we've been and where we're going.  Whether that be from our Lead Composer, David, our Executive producer, Christian, or any other essential member of our team.

This is our passion.

 

(Be sure to check it out!)

"The Legend" Main Theme - Main Composer: David

The Legend Main Theme With SFX - V2 by "The Legend"

 

 

What's "The Legend" about exactly?

"The Legend" will ultimately consist of numerous urban legends, horrors, common fears and some unique stories.  Players will experience many different aspects of these legends and stories from many different angles.  For example: a baby, a teenager or an elderly citizen, etc.

This allows for us dive deeper into the psychology behind these horrific experiences and deliver a variety of bone-chilling experiences.  

In example, a teenager would be able to use a cellphone as their main utility tool (a flashlight, contacting help, etc.), however, this life-saving tool could also be their downfall by giving away their position and receiving paranormal interference.  On the other end of the spectrum, an elderly citizen could be using a cane or wheelchair as their utility tool for quicker movement, however, there aren't many happy-ending horror games where the player is trying to escape using a cane.

We're also researching and developing random world generation (a totally innovative concept for horror games), which will allow for the player to never experience the same stories even if they are the same legends.  Thus, prolonging the entertainment period gained from this game.

 

Did you say Multi-platform?

Yes, we are trying to deliver this experience primarily to PC gamers, however, we can not leave out our Mac, Xbox and PS3 brethren.  "The Legend" will be able to release to these platforms as well, but only if we receive the funding to be able to acquire the proper equipment and licenses.

Where is the money going exactly?

We will not deliver anything less than exceptional for this project.  Our community and fans deserve the best and that's what we intend to deliver. We've already put so much into this project, and have proven ourselves to the community and to a publisher. That is why this project is set for fixed funding.  If we do not reach our goal, every cent of the money pledged is returned and the project will reach an early and disappointing grave.  .

The set funding goal for this project is the bare minimum for us to fulfill our promises on "The Legend".  Any dollar over that goal, will go directly towards ensuring that "The Legend" delivers nothing short of a revolutionary indie-horror title.  We have the technology, we have the means to achieve this goal, we have the motivation, mindset and experience, we even have a clear platform and publisher for release, we just need YOU. 

When will the game be completed?

By extending the original concept of "The Legend" into multiple urban legends and stories, we will be pushing our release date back to, most-likely, Spring 2014.  Honestly, the project may be finished by Winter 2013 or Fall of 2014.

We only want to ensure quality in what we release to our fans, however, the closed Beta will launch no later than November-December 2013.

Is there a way to influence development?

Sure! The team always loves to hear from the community and their opinions. "The Legend" is a game for the community and we would be shafting ourselves by not answering their calls.  We're always open to suggestions, constructive criticism and ideas!  

 

About the "Perks"

Limited Edition of "The Legend":  Receive a digital copy of "The Legend" that includes concept art, design documents, storylines, development team interviews and an exclusive soundtrack not included with the official album release!

Skype with the Development Team or Dinner with the Project Lead:  Receive the option of skyping with the Lead Development Team for "The Legend" or dinner with the Project Lead to discuss "The Legend".  (Dinner and partial transportation fees negotiated and paid)

story:
Note : The game will be available in English and French

THE GAME
Interference is a stealth puzzle-platformer set in the tech-noir city of Arachnopolis, a place where citizens' rights have been replaced by totalitarianism, oppression, and a robotic police force. Gameplay in Interference has four key aspects:
  • Manipulation - Adapt and shift the architecture of Arachnopolis to your advantage as you solve puzzles and outwit your foes.
  • Stealth - Killing is never an option. The only thing that can guarantee your success, let alone your survival, is your ability to outsmart those who would do you harm.
  • Exploration - Dive into an intricately designed, open world, cyberpunk metropolis and meet the shadowy inhabitants ready to help, hire, or kill you in the four districts of Arachnopolis.
  • Discovery - As you search the neon city for a way out of the conflict that's destroyed your life, uncover the truth behind the city, its shady inhabitants, and the Interferers themselves.
Some of the works that have influenced the development of Interference include movies like Blade Runner, Dark City, Brazil, and Akira, the novel Flashback by Dan Simmons,and games like Shenmue, Metal Gear Solid, Flashback, and Deus Ex, particularly for their balance between action, exploration, and storytelling.

You can try the pre-alpha demo here :

Please note that this is a prototype demo which doesn't reflect the final aspect of the game. Its main purpose is to let you experience some of the game's core mechanics.
(Other mirrors here)


MORE DETAILS

About the Playground: Arachnopolis

Interference isn't just another stealth platformer in the style of Mark of the Ninja, Gunpoint, or Stealth Bastard. I love these games, but I want to create my own with a fully-realized and immersive universe that's free from the boundaries of defined levels.

In Interference, like in Metroidvanias, players freely explore the city of Arachnopolis while progressively unlocking access to more districts and eventually gaining entry to the entire city.

Rough city map :
Some mood concepts :

About the Storyline


It all seemed like a regular night of work. 

You're sitting in your apartment droning at the computer when suddenly a blackout sweeps the entire area. You go to the roof to check the main generator. As you approach, you see someone standing in front of it.

Who is he? What is he doing?

You don't get the chance to find out. 

 As soon as he sees you he's gone, and seconds later a robotic police unit descends and arrests you for causing the blackout.

You don't know it yet, but your only way out is with the cyberterrorist group known as the Interferers.

About the Gameplay

1- Stealth-oriented platformer

Interference is a stealth game. Your main weapons are your agility and your intelligence. 

2- Puzzle mechanics

One of Interference's main gameplay mechanics is the ability to modify the city's architecturewith a tool called the Glitcher. The Glitcher needs to be connected to a network terminal in order to be activated.

It lets you:
  • Re-design parts of the world in order to create exits and escape routes
  • Make permanent alterations to the city's architecture.
  • Connect to networks in order to read and rewrite data packages.

... but when you're using the Glitcher, you're opening yourself up to virtual attacks.

3- Adventure

While most of your initial missions will come from the Interferers, as the game progresses you'll start dealing with a wider variety of people, including Quantic Girls, Ergs, Holoers, and more.

What's the press saying?

  • Indie Gaming Mag: Interference "Looks Beautiful"
  • Indie Statik: Interference "is the coolest thing"
  • Destructoid: Interference is "wholly unique, and certainly intriguing"
  • Cinema Blend: "the team did an amazing job making the world and characters feel alive"
  • Kotaku AU: "Interference is Flashback for a new generation"

Who is developing this game?

My name is Anthony Beyer (alias Sinok426), 28 years old.
I've been working as a graphic designer, then as a concept artist and 3D artist (on Modern Combat 3, Modern Combat 4, Asphalt 6, Dungeon Hunter 3). I'm now a freelance graphic designer and a game developer.

The music of the game is handled by 2 awesome composers: Music Vortex and Ryan Ike.

Which platforms will be supported?


Windows PC and Mac OSX for sure. Linux is also planned, but for this I need to buy an update of the engine I use for Interference (Unity upgrade costs approx. 750$).

When will the game be finished?

My goal is to have a playable beta/early access release in June 2014, with the full release coming a few months later as all the bugs get ironed out.

Why IndieGogo?

Mainly, so that I can work full-time on the game. I've spent nearly 4 months developing Interference, and I had to refuse some freelance contracts in order to make the prototype demo available.

At the moment, I'm alternating between game development and freelance contracts, which has been detrimental to the development process. If this campaign is successful, I will be able to focus completely on making Interference the best game it can possibly be.

The funding will also help me update my old computer (hardware and software) and to pay composers for their work and hire other people if necessary (translators, artists, etc...).

Right now, we're focusing on getting funded before we focus on stretch goals. Stretch goals have the potential to dramatically improve a game, but they can also expand it to an unmanageable point well beyond its initial scope, cause release delays, and take our attention away from more pressing matters. If we get closer to "stretch goal territory", we'll put our minds to it, but until that point our time is better spent focusing on the core game.


The perks ?


DRM-FREE Digital copy of the game (for all platforms : Windows, OSX and Linux).


Digital Artbook will contain all concept arts made for the game and also a bunch of digital wallpapers.


Digital Original Soundtrack of the game made by Music Vortex and Ryan Ike. It will feature all the themes developed during the course of the game.

The Postcards: 6 Printed postcards (15cm*10cm) of Interference's concept arts.




The Poster: Printed poster (80cm*30cm) of Arachnopolis, Interference's city.






Exclusive funder T-shirt
with the game's logo and city's concept art printed on it. 
You'll be asked for the proper size before they're sent to you.


Closing words

I will finish this game even if this crowdfunding campaign fails, but without the funding necessary to devote an appropriate amount of time and effort, the game will be either very short or the game won't be out for a very, very long time.

Help us do Interference right!

Thank you for reading this!

Sinok426

Feel free to share and follow the game on:


Interference's official website

story:
Short Summary

Doing something useful and unique was always my passion, recent application is a KidReadler, an easy way to learn reading for kids: https://kidreadler.com/ . Yeah, having kids make you think differently as you watch the learning progress and what is good, or bad.

The new idea is not going out of my head for some time already, definitely can do a world better with it.

The thing is... to learn and quiz anything. With just a few basic lessons but with ability to create your own, and share.

Just imagine this:

  • you as a student have to learn 30 Spanish words
  • you launch application, create a word and translation to it
  • you learn it
  • you pass the quiz
  • you pass the quiz again, watch your progress over time
  • you share this lesson with other students from your class so they can do same

 

Or another, you as a teacher do basic multiply praxis, 2*2, 2*5, 3*7 , you share it with a class and kids are learning it (yeah, we all know kids are addicted to phones).

The point is that you can create a lesson about ANYTHING you want, learn it, quiz it and share it eazily over QR-code or in any social network (facebook, whatsup, twitter). Any language, any questions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Comparing to previous application this project will not be that simple, interacting over webserver and working on different platforms requires some investing which I am not able to do myself. While it should be professionally made, including custom templates and skins etc. The usability and GUI should be great, that will make it successful app.

For sure going in a fixed goal, only when reached can start doing it. It should be done good, or not started at all :)

 

--

The Impact

Prototyped it a lot in my head, but also in special software. Some highlights:

Creating the lesson and learning process

Taking the quiz and watching progress results

Remember, quiz anything you ever need, countries and capitals here

I mean absolutely anything you ever can imagine!

And yes, those above are just prototypes how it should be. Colored version is below

No need to use phone for same actions, use a website to create/analyze/watch results

Share lessons easily

 

---

Risks & Challenges

Not a one-time project, but one for years. Going to make it great so definitely need further incomes . I hate ads, however that will be a main income after application become alive. Definitely not annoying one, but cannot refuse it totally in a free version of app. Paid package will be available to work without ad, and to provide some great customizations like custom templates, color schemas etc.

Few sections needed to be built:

- an application itself, android and iOS ready

- a secure webserver and a site to manage things like account management, create quiz in front of PC, save lesson to cloud, watch results

- a group of testers, perfectly students of teachers

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are things you can do to make the project better. As it is still in 'thinking of it' state I accept any input. Write what you think about it, propose your vision how it could be better.
Know someone interested? Share this page :)

story:
Introducing the Next Evolution in Fantasy + Football

Iron Rivals is a fantasy-themed strategy game where players fight over territory using legendary heroes who clash in head-to-head combat. The outcomes of the battles are determined by football statistics, streamed in real-time as professional football games unfold.

 

What makes Iron Rivals special?

  • Iconic heroes with unique backstories, rendered in our gritty, fantasy art style
  • Interactive game map where players strategically launch attacks, defense and manage their empire; the player with the most territory at the end of the football season wins!
  • Matchups happen between heroes, not between teams as in other fantasy sports; heroes are deployed alone or in combination, creating new and dramatic combat scenarios every week
  • Integration with live statistics; watch battles between heroes unfold as the football game stats are generated
  • Extensive list of alternate rules and game options (see Roadmap) to enhance the strategy gameplay and give league administrators total control

 

 

Why do we need your support?

Iron Rivals has a very well-defined deadline. It needs to be stable, fast, fun and ready to play by the start of fantasy football drafts in August and the first kickoff in early September. 

Having the game ready means greatly increasing artwork production and development over the next three months. 

Most of the money will go to pay concept artists to create heroes, developers to create the game and fantasy football features, and to pay for support services (like accurate, live statistics) that are required to make Iron Rivals everything that we want it to be. 

Your support is essential to ensure that Iron Rivals is ready for Fall 2013.

 

"I want to contribute, but what if you don't reach your funding goal?"

We've chosen a "fixed funding" campaign, which means that we do not receive any contributions unless we reach our goal. When you contribute, IndieGoGo collects he money immediately, but will refund the funds if the project does not reach its target. 

This ensures that supporters can feel confident about contributing, with no risk of losing money to a project that does not come to fruition.

 

Character Concepts: The Heroes of Iron Rivals

Important note: All characters are fictional. Persons referenced are not associated with nor endorse this project in any way, and are named only as a reference to their public athletic statistics.

 

C. Kaesar, Legion Commander of the Red Bay Empire (powered by the football statistics of Colin Kaepernick)

 

Sir Tomrad, Knight-Captain of the Kingdom Vanguard (powered by the football statistics of Tom Brady)

 

Ulwe Northborne, First Ranger of the Sota Province (powered by the football statistics of Chris Kluwe)

 

Ur-Lak, War Chief of the Central Tribes (powered by the football statistics of Brian Urlacher)

 

Every draftable player in professional football will have a hero alter-ego. Popular heroes will have custom portraits (contributors vote on which players receive custom artwork), while other heroes will draw from a pool of hero portraits. The more money we raise, the more custom portraits we can create. 

Over time we aim to have custom artwork for most players in professional football.

 

Overview of Gameplay

Iron Rivals will have a rhythm very familiar to fantasy football veterans. Players create leagues and invite friends or colleagues in order to compete against each other.

Heroes are drafted using common fantasy football draft mechanics, or hero rosters can be manually set up by the league admin (if you want to import draft selections from another fantasy football site).

Strategic actions are submitted on the days between professional football games, usually Tuesday and Wednesday. Heroes can be deployed alone or in combination to attack and defend territories. 

After Wednesday, matchups between heroes are finalized and ready for resolution during the football games, which can run from Thursday through Monday evening. Statistics from the live games are streamed to the site in real time so you can watch the combat unfold as the football players (and their associated heroes) perform on the field. 

Game map concept

 

After a week's games are complete, winners are declared, territories change hands and the war continues. 

The game will run for the entirety of the regular season (17 weeks) and a winner - the player who owns the most territory - will be declared after the last games are played. 

Thoughtful deployment of your heroes, combined with tactful manipulation of your opponents (alliances are encouraged!), will set you up for victory. That said, there are always surprises on the football field, and those amazing feats (and fumbles) will have big effects on the outcomes of battles.

 

Feature Roadmap

Primary features for the 2013 Football Season (if we reach our goal):

  • League creation and administration
  • Snake draft
  • Auto-draft option
  • Manual entry of rosters
  • Interactive game map with player territory assignment and support for 4-12 players
  • Hero attack and defense actions
  • Real-time updates of combat and outcomes
  • Integration with established, high performance data service
  • Fantasy heroes and profiles for every football player
  • Custom hero artwork for the top 40 professional football players (chosen by contributors)
  • Account creation, authentication, premium accounts and password management

 

Additional features that will be prioritized by contributors if we exceed our funding goals:

  • More draft options
  • Mobile version
  • Custom fantasy points values
  • Maps will be enhanced to accommodate more players
  • Expand library of custom hero artwork to the top 100+ football players
  • Escrow and distribution service for league pools and prizes
  • Trade and bid for rogue heroes to enhance your military strength (waiver wire)
  • Post-season gameplay
  • (Option) Rare but useful fate cards that can be used to tip odds in your favor
  • (Option) Player-editable game maps
  • (Option) Powerful hero artifacts that can be found, used and looted; inspired by the exploits, personalities and eccentricities of professional football players, these items enhance hero abilities
  • (Option) Resource system (gold, iron, wood), adding more dimensions for scoring and more depth for planning your attacks and defense
  • (Option) More hero customization including weapon types, mounts, war machines and hero classes
  • (Option) Troop counts and soldier recruiting
  • (Option) Building fortifications to create defensive strongholds
  • (Option) The ability to kill heroes, permanently removing them, and lay siege to castles

 

Questions & Answers

Who are you?

The Iron Rivals team is a humble gathering of Chicago-based designers, artists and developers wielding decades of software experience. We're locked, loaded and excited to build Iron Rivals for you and your friends. 

 

You're asking for a lot of money. Why do you need so much?

Iron Rivals has a very well-defined deadline. It needs to be stable, fast, fun and ready to play by the start of fantasy football drafts in August and the first kickoff in early September. 

Having the game ready means greatly increasing artwork production and development over the next three months. 

Most of the money will go to pay concept artists to create heroes, developers to create the game and fantasy football features, and to pay for support services (like accurate, live statistics) that are required to make Iron Rivals reliable, fast and fun. 

 

If I contribute and you don't reach your funding goal, do I lose my contribution?

No. We're using a fixed funding campaign, which means that we do not receive any of the contributions unless we reach our goal. IndieGoGo charges you when you contribute and will refund the money if the project does not reach its goal.

 

Will the game be free?

Creating basic leagues will be 100% free. The site will feature advertising, but players have the option of removing ads for a small one-time, per-season fee. Additional features may include additional fees, but our goal is to keep the game as open and low-cost as possible. 

 

Did you know that Brian Urlacher no longer plays for the Bears?

We do! The news came after we created Ur-Lak, but we don't mind the change. The bear pelt on his back now serves as an symbol of revenge which, if you ask us, is more interesting anyway.

Players changing teams is a reality of professional sports and we'll continue to create and update our hero artwork with this in mind.

 

I noticed defensive players among the heroes. Will you support both individual defensive players (IDP) and team defense?

We have plans to support both IDP and team defense options, but will likely pursue the individual defensive player model first as it fits more closely with the hero-centric focus of Iron Rivals' gameplay. We also have plans to accommodate more defensive positions, such as punters. 

 

Aren't you appealing to two very different types of people?

Our research, combined with our own interests, has shown that there are a lot of people out there who enjoy fantasy-themed movies, video games and TV shows who also enjoy a good football game.

The days of jocks vs. D&D nerds are long gone. Now everyone is free to pursue all of their interests regardless of how different they may be. Plus, we like the idea that we're bridging two different spaces in a way that may create both new football fans and new fans of the fantasy genre. 

 

Some of the heroes look a lot like their player counterparts. Are you worried about running into legal issues?

Our heroes are definitely creative works of fiction, but we absolutely respect each player's right of publicity and power to control how his likeness is used. 

Our intention is to nurture fandom, both of football and of the hard-working players in its ranks. We expect to tweak and adjust the artwork as needed to do right by both the fans and the professional football players.

 

Credits & Acknowledgements

Concept Art
"C. Kaesar" by Juan Martinez
"Sir Tomrad" by Pat Loboyko
"Ulwe Northborne" by Katarzyna Zalecka
"Ur-Lak" by Katarzyna Zalecka
Additional fantasy artwork by Fotokostic
 
Music
"The Presence of Power" by SonicCube
"Hellraiser" by kristijanf
 
Video
Contemporary Creative Productions

story:
Once upon a time, there was a great company.

A company that didn't just make games, but made games by gamers, for gamers.

This great company once released more games per year than EA was on everyone's lips. They gave birth to companies like Bioware, and gave the guys who now run Obsidian their first jobs in the industry. Their games included Decent, Warcraft, Fallout, and Planescape: Torment.

But dark times came to this company, and the empire began to crumble. A pair of saviours rode in, but their attempts to revive here were flaunted by misstep after misstep.

But perhaps.... Perhaps now in her darkest hour, she can be saved!

Interplay Entertainment was one of the biggest names in gaming, but now her share price languishes at a penny per share.

With 124.3 Million shares outstanding, this means we just need 1.243 million to buy every share at today's closing price!

But we don't need that many. We only need half plus 1, at current prices this will cost  about 600k

I propose we raise a bit more.  Firstly, we need 1.2 Million to buy at least half the shares at twice their current price - 2 cents per share.  Given this is a 100% premium on current prices, it makes an attractive deal for investors.

Indiegogo want about 10%, thats about 200k

The remaining 600k we'll use for working capital to help breath life in the old girl, or in case a few shareholders hang out for 3 cents per share.

Once we secure her, the road is a little less certain, it depends on what level of mess we find her in.

Hopefully, it wont be that bad and we can try and sell her to Brian Fargo - maybe he'd like his brand back?

We could try and make a game with what little silverware is left.

if worst comes to worst we can give the old lady the funeral she deserves, rather than suffer her ongoing mistreatment.

I know this is a big task... But unlike most of these crowdsource fundraisers, we actually have something right now - its not some game we might or might not end up making, or its not access to some super secret forum we might or might not put up - we have an actual company that still owns stuff, and still sells games.

And if we don't make enough money, we'll simply not take the cash from you. I bet thats the best deal you've heard all week.

 

What do you know about running a Game company?

Well, Interplay is famous for that "By gamers, for gamer" line, well, we're gamers!

Here's a list of reasons why we're better than the current management

  1. Noone involved in the Save Interplay campaign ever worked on Superman 64
  2. Noone involved in the Save Interplay campaign has ever had a Bankruptcy order served upon them, or to any companies they run
  3. Noone involved in the Save Interplay campaign ever worked on Fallout:Brotherhood of Steel

story:
Dear Shinkansen,


For the past two years we've had some fun, and a lot of that fun has involved creating spaces and events for each of us to come together and kill one-another in a totally not real, video game type fashion. Whether it be chatting in Teamspeak, playing Team Fortress or Minecraft, or even one day having that special space on the internet all to our own, it costs money.

Money. You know that's why you're here, right? This is a donation site, and we need money, folks. These tracks don't lay themselves!

Our current server host is going to be retired mid-May, and in its place will be NFO Servers, a company we've tested and proven to be a far more stable and rewarding experience for everyone. This means vastly improved latency/ping, literally instant server setup for a huge library of games, greatly improved customer service, and more room for those growing pains. All of that costs money though, friends, and every dollar counts. So, if you can give a little, we'll give a lot back.

If we reach our goal, each (non-anonymous) donor of any amount will be automatically submitted into a drawing for $100.00 credit on Steam, with a second drawing granting someone a free copy of Splinter Cell: Blacklist. If that isn't enough for you, then you also can sleep well at night knowing I think you're super swell.

We're really looking forward to this leap, as it's going to open a lot of doors for the community as a whole. Do what you can comfortably do, and have your part in bestowing upon the community a really great gift.

Thank you, Shinkansen.


QUESTIONS:

From Iris: "by server, you meeeeeeean..."

By server, I mean the Dacentec server unit we've been renting and paying for since September of 2011. In its history, we've hosted a number of games- some brief, like Killing Floor, and some enduring, like Minecraft. The server also hosts our Teamspeak channels, which have been used by more people than I can mention.

Dacentec was bought out a while back, and their quality has slipped. That's why, after a good deal of shopping around, we arrived at NFO Servers. Not only are they immensely more powerful, but the service is unbeatable. With a click, they will set-up, manage, and update any game we choose from their vast library- a library which is growing all the time. They've confirmed intentions to expand this to games like Starbound and Rust very soon as well.

It must also be mentioned that these units allow us to plan for an actual web-space down the road, featuring a wiki (instead of FB docs), a scoreboard, forums, and any number of services the group may like. Plans for that are another matter, but they are made all the more realistic by this.

So that's what you're supporting. It's long over-due, and going to make matters much simpler.

story:
Microcomputers in the shoes control the mini-treadmills and coordinate their movement with the game's avatar.

 

Our vision of the 7th prototype:

There were 6 prototype iterations built.  The 7th prototype will be designed to address all of the issues found during prior testing.

 

 

Early prototype – Too unstable and

back to the drawing board.

 

Early prototype test:  Obstacle sensors, forward/reverse motion, and speed control.

 

Early prototype test:  Communications and coordination between the shoes.

 

 

 

Introductions:

Jamie:  You probably recognize him from Mythbusters and is known for his creativity in mechanical engineering - the "get out of my way, no gimmicks or games, super inventor" guy.

Edmond:  Artificial intelligence specialist and inventor of 13 patents. One of his designs you see during NFL games – the Academy and Emmy Award winning overhead Skycam.  

George:  Prototype developer,  Emmy award winner and Villanova University engineering professor.  Helped build the WaveCam.

John: Fortune 20 background in global manufacturing and supply chain.

Cody: Gaming interface and crowdfunding expert.  Design guru.

Liesl:  Graduated college at 16.  Web, graphics, and search engine optimization (SEO) wizard.

EJ:  VR systems engineer and project manager with extensive fortune 500 experience.

Patsy:  Computer engineer and user interface expert.  The only person to have worn and used all shoe generations.

Ed:  Media expert with over 20 years experience and a serial entrepreneur.

 

You can help the shoes become a reality by backing our project and receiving a unique survival kit.

We are grateful for your help and willingness to contribute to our project and we're excited for the Vortrex Shoes to become a reality. In the meantime, Jamie wanted to guarantee that you got something cool for your contribution. While traditional swag items such as bumper stickers and t-shirts were an option, Jamie was quick to say “Frankly, that’s just not me...” So, he has put together some of his favorite stuff to form “The Hyneman Survival Kit.” This kit features a mix of items that he uses every day, as well as things he would grab in the case of an emergency. Some of our favorites are listed below.

 

Pick Your Kit

 

The Nuts and Bolts

Microcomputers in the shoes control the mini-treadmills and coordinate their movement with the game's avatar. Our vision of the 7th prototype:There were 6 prototype iterations built.  The 7th prototype will be designed to address all of the issues found during prior testing.  Early prototype – Too unstable andback to the drawing board. Early prototype test:  Obstacle sensors, forward/reverse motion, and speed control. Early prototype test:  Communications and coordination between the shoes.
   Introductions:Jamie:  You probably recognize him from Mythbusters and is known for his creativity in mechanical engineering - the "get out of my way, no gimmicks or games, super inventor" guy.Edmond:  Artificial intelligence specialist and inventor of 13 patents. One of his designs you see during NFL games – the Academy and Emmy Award winning overhead Skycam.  George:  Prototype developer,  Emmy award winner and Villanova University engineering professor.  Helped build the WaveCam.John: Fortune 20 background in global manufacturing and supply chain.Cody: Gaming interface and crowdfunding expert.  Design guru.Liesl:  Graduated college at 16.  Web, graphics, and search engine optimization (SEO) wizard.EJ:  VR systems engineer and project manager with extensive fortune 500 experience.Patsy:  Computer engineer and user interface expert.  The only person to have worn and used all shoe generations.Ed:  Media expert with over 20 years experience and a serial entrepreneur. You can help the shoes become a reality by backing our project and receiving a unique survival kit.We are grateful for your help and willingness to contribute to our project and we're excited for the Vortrex Shoes to become a reality. In the meantime, Jamie wanted to guarantee that you got something cool for your contribution. While traditional swag items such as bumper stickers and t-shirts were an option, Jamie was quick to say “Frankly, that’s just not me...” So, he has put together some of his favorite stuff to form “The Hyneman Survival Kit.” This kit features a mix of items that he uses every day, as well as things he would grab in the case of an emergency. Some of our favorites are listed below. Pick Your Kit The Nuts and Bolts

story:
As we all know, one of the greatest video game companies of all time, famous for their releases such as "Monkey island", "Sam & Max", "The walking dead" and much more, took us by surprise and announced that they will be  shutting down .  As a person who grew up playing their games, it's very hard to me to accept this bitter truth, therefore, I want to take action and prevent this disaster from happening. My idea is to crowdfund five million dollars which will go into starting a new video game company, allowing all the hard working people from telltale to continue where they left off,  doing what they do best.  I'm asking all my fellow gamers to take action and prevent this disaster from happening. If you're not in the position to help financially, you can contribute to the cause by sharing this crowdfunding page.

 

LETS SAVE TELLTALE!

story:
Voiceover artist

Music and sound effects

Animations associate

Risk and challenges

We are firmly committed to make Skull Port a successful project and we can assure you that many hours were spent in preparations and planning towards minimizing risks of backing this project.

Although this is the first Indiegogo project we've created we do have experience in running multi-phase projects. Nevertheless, there may be ways we could run a project better that we haven't yet discovered.

Delivery date – our current estimation for delivery is December 2018. There is always a chance for delays caused by third parties. Please understand that this is the last thing we want to happen as our primary goal is delivery of the game and add-ons to all backers on time.

One of the biggest challenges for us is going to be working with beta testers side-by-side. We’ll do our best to hear all the feedback and try to make this game in a way so backers feel like part of development.

story:
We are a start up small independent games studio announcing our flagship title “M3CH”. The game is a sci-fi, third-person shooter, with arena based single and multiplayer action initially for the PC and iOS platforms.

If we can achieve our funding with YOUR help we will use 100% of the money raised to complete a high quality Beta release of M3CH on our principle platform; iOS - shortly followed by PC version. It will be a Beta release because we see M3CH being a fluid game, frequently updated with content and even new modes directly influenced by you, the players feedback. 

We are a small group of 5 who collectively decided to step outiside our jobs in the game industry to start up a small independent studio to create our M3CH game. As fans of games like Steel Batallion and Armored Core we realised that the industry is incredibly creatively stifling so here we are taking a chance to bring back a game genre that is all but extinct!

M3CH deploys the full iOS capabilities of Unreal3 Next Generation technology. We don't want to take any shortcuts and are thoroughly concepting and crafting each piece of a dystopian future, developing a soundtrack and digital graphic novel to help root the world by explaining the story; both of which are available as rewards for any level of donation. 

Make war on your oppressors face to face in the M3CH arena and pilot your way to freedom and super-stardom in a nightmare vision of the future. Fight your way out of the slums. Enter the Tournament. Customise your salvaged M3CH and decimate the mighty pinnacles of M3CH technology in savage M3CH Combat. Own the M3CH arena with a devastating array of Class types, weapons, add-ons and pimp your ride with customisable paint-jobs. 

With your help we can help bring you the game we want with all the Gripping gameplay of a dark future of the moon. Battle hardcore AI opponents and profit big or devastate your rivals in competitive multiplayer. Gamble away your winnings or cut through wave after wave of Cleaver squads as they tear apart your M3CH for parts in vicious Scavenger Mode.

For anyone who loves Futuristic Sci Fi or Mecha and is tired of seeing your fandom go unnoticed in the games industry, help us bring back a genre that has been too long ignored. This is an opportunity to have the multiplayer experience we simply couldn't achieve without fans taking control and showing the games industry what they want.


Thank you for donating and helping us ressurrect the Mech genre to its former glory!

Don't forget to Like our Facebook page for constant updates:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/M3CH/282994775119159

story:
UFOLOGY on Board Game Geek

Cave Banana Games on Facebook

Try the game before you decide

Free Print and Play Version

La verisone Italiana del PnP

Or visit us at booth #6214 at PAX Prime in Seattle.

The Game

Aliens, UFOs – are they real? After years of research, Ufologists have answered this question, and the answer is...maybe. This is where you come in. Gather evidence, get your Doctorate, hack your opponent's computer, then – perhaps – you will solve one of the World's greatest mysteries: Are we alone in the universe?

Ufology is a card game based on the fringe scientific field of the same name. In Ufology, players use Research cards to collect Evidence cards from a 3x3 card grid (3x4 in 5-6 player games) called the Field of Research. Those Evidence cards, ranging in value from 0 to 6 points, are placed with Case cards that have corresponding icons. When a Case has the indicated pieces of evidence, it is considered Closed. The game ends as soon as a player closes 3 Cases, and the player with the most points wins.

Action cards allow players to, for instance, take cards from an opponent's hand, move cards from one Case to another, etc. There are also Credentials cards that increase the number of cards a player may use on their turn or their hand size, and Culture cards which change the game play for all players. The game has over 200 cards in three deck and, depending on the number of players, takes 15-45 minutes to play.

Money from this Indiegogo campaign will be used for printing and shipping costs.

 

The Company

Cave Banana Games is a new game company and Ufology is our introductory game. We look forward to having the opportunity to spend many years giving the gaming community the best and most innovative games on the market. But, we need your help to jumpstart our first game in order to establish ourselves.

We have many games on the horizon, including Feudal Endeavour: Fields & Fenceposts, and other games in the Ology family.

We hope you enjoy Ufology and will support our project, remember it's all or nothing. Thank you.

The Guys

Geoffrey Globus has been designing games since he made a checkers variant when he was seven years old. He's designed card games, board games and RPG's. UFOLOGY is his first commercial game. He is also an actor and wire artist, and lives in Seattle with his wife and two cats.

C. Wilson Trull is a graphic artist living in the Pacific Northwest. He has been an interior book designer, layout artist, book cover designer, web comic artist, character and concept designer, and comic book penciler.

Z. Mann Zilla is an accomplished artist, writer, actor, and musician originally from Buffalo, NY.  His work has been featured in the Albright-Knox Art Gallery, the Buffalo Music Is Art Festival, the Buffalo BEAST, the short film "Clicker Clatter", and at several galleries and showings throughout the Western New York area.  He was also the colorist and layout editor for "Amazing Me", an educational program that teaches children how to create their own comic books.  He currently resides in Seattle, WA, with his wife and daughter.

 

*This is just an honorary title. Only for the First Edition.
